loans.name: Maria Socorro

texts.es: Maria Socorro F. M. con 55 años de edad reside en el departamento de La Libertad junto a su esposo y sus cinco hijos donde tres de ellos aun son menores de edad. Maria y su esposo don José de 63 años de edad trabajan en conjunto para sacar adelante a su familia ya que para ellos es importante la educación escolar de sus hijos  y es por ello que estos padres se esfuerzan en su negocio para lograr ganancias dignas que les permitan darle estabilidad a sus hijos, Maria se dedica a la venta de productos varios como toallas de baño, zapatos, cremas para el cuerpo, sabanas para cama entre otros; Maria solicita este crédito por que quiere invertir en mas tollas de baños ya que este es el producto mayor demandado y también para seguir surtiendo su inventario en mercadería para su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria Socorro F. M., 55, lives in the La Libertad department with her husband and five children. Three of her children are minors. Maria and her husband, José, who is 63, work together to get ahead with their family. Their children’s education is important to them. That is why they put so much effort into their business. They do it in order to get decent earnings that allow them to provide their children with stability. Maria sells various products like bath towels, shoes, body lotion, bed sheets, and others. Maria is asking for a loan to be able to buy more bath towels. This is the product with the most demand. She also wants to continue stocking her inventory with merchandise for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy towels and stock her inventory

loans.name: Olimpia

texts.es: Olimpia tiene 53 años, vive con su esposo Rolando, de 51 años, quien es chofer de taxi, y con su hijo Álvaro de 15 años. Desde hace 20 años se dedica a la costura, siendo ésta una de las actividades que más le gusta realizar, Olimpia ofrece sus servicios en uno de los mercados más conocidos del distrito de Puente Piedra, en la ciudad de Lima. Ella elabora prendas de vestir y también trabaja arreglándo ropa a la medida de cada uno de sus clientes, los cuales recurren a ella para subir una basta o achicar alguna talla. Además, en su mismo puesto ha implementado un espacio para la venta de productos naturales, los cuales ofrece en una pequeña vitrina detrás de su máquina de cocer, así logra ingresos que complementan a los que trae su esposo y pueden cubrir los gastos de su hogar. Gracias a su perseverancia y ganas de trabajar, Olimpia está logrando muy bueno frutos, los cuales le dan las fuerzas necesarias para seguir labrándose un futuro mejor, ya que en adelante quiere comprar otro carro con el que también hagan taxi. Este es su noveno préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma y siempre ha sido muy puntual en todos sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de tela y productos naturales; además, hará refaccionar el carro de su esposo, ya que está presentando algunos problemas.
texts.en:
Olimpia, 53, lives with her husband, Rolando. He is 51, and he drives a taxi. They also live with their 15 year old son, Álvaro. She has been a seamstress for 20 years. This is one of the activities she most likes to do. Olimpia offers her services in one of the most well known fairs in the Puente Piedra district in the city of Lima. She makes clothing, and she also tailors clothes for each of her customers. They come to her to raise a hem or take in a size. She also has set up space in her place to sell natural products. She has them in a small display case behind her sewing machine. That way she gets income that compliments what her husband earns and can cover the household expenses. Thanks to her perseverance and desire to work, Olimpia has achieved good results. This gives her the necessary strength to keep working for a better future. She would like to buy another car to be used as a taxi. This is her ninth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She has always been very punctual in all of her payments. She will use the money she is asking for to buy a greater quantity of material and natural products. She will also refurbish her husband’s car because it has some problems.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sewing materials and repair her husband's car

loans.name: Lugendo Kauma Sania Group

texts.en: K. Sania is a married businesslady representing her group. She is blessed with two children going to school and additionally she is looking after two dependents that are also going to school. K. Sania has been in the charcoal business for four years. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of charcoal to improve her business. She is a hardworking free healthy lady whose dream is to construct a house.

loans.use: To buy charcoal for resale

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
La Sra Graciela de 38 años de edad es madre soltera con un hijo varón que va en el colegio del estado de dicho barrio, vive en su propia casa con su hermana mayor que es docente y comparten los gastos del hogar.
Ella es propietaria de un Despensa en donde además vende  artículos de mercerías como utensilios de cocina, manteles, ropa, zapatos, etc. el cual está ubicado en su propio domicilio hace mas de 4 años con buena clientela formada y que es atendida por ella misma. 

A medida que pasan los días cada vez tiene mas clientes y su negocio a su vez esta creciendo y esto le da mayor ganancia y asi puede cumplir con su compromiso con la Fundación.

El destino del crédito es para la compra de mercaderías varias para aumentar su stock de mercaderías, en vista de que no tiene competencia y la demanda es alta en esa zona.

loans.use: Compra de azúcar, gaseosas, lácteos, vegetales, frutas, carne, aceite, arroz, etc.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
Hugo tiene 31 años, vive con la madre de sus 2 hijos y por el momento viven en la casa de su madre. Él es un operario de la hacienda “el naranjal”, donde trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde, de lunes a viernes. Pero él ama mucho las labores agrícolas, por eso es que los fines de semana se dedica a sus propias chacras, ya que su sueldo no le es suficiente. Por tal motivo, en compañía de su esposa, trabajan podando con mucho cuidado sus cítricos y fumigando reiteradas veces para lograr cosechar productos sanos, los cuales envían a la ciudad de Lima en la temporada de verano. Los meses de enero a marzo son muy solicitados los frutos como la naranja y la mandarina, y por tener buen precio, Hugo reúne buena cantidad de dinero que le permite comprar algunos muebles para su hogar y vestimenta para sus hijos. Por ello, sus planes a futuro son de incrementar sus terrenos de cultivos.
Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, donde ha demostrado responsabilidad en sus pagos. La mayoría de las veces es su esposa quien se hace presente en las reuniones de su banco comunal, pues él se encuentra trabajando en la hacienda. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de abonos y fungicidas para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Hugo is 31 years old, lives with the mother of his 2 children with whom he momentarily lives in his mother's house. He is a worker in the estate "El Naranjal" where he works Monday through Friday from 8 AM to 5 PM. However, Hugo likes agricultural activities very much so on the weekends he works on his own land since his salary is not enough. That is why he and his wife work pruning his citrus trees and fumigating several times in order to harvest healthy products, which is sent to Lima in the summer time. During the summer months of January through March, fruits such as oranges and mandarin oranges are in high demand. Because of the fruits' good prices, Hugo collects a good amount of money which allows him to purchase furniture for his home and clothing for his children. That is why his future plans are to increase his plot of land.

This is his third loan with MFP as he has shown to be responsible with his payments. Most of the time his wife is the one present in the meetings of his communal bank since he works at the estate. The money he's asking for will be used for the purchase of fertilizer and fungicide.

Translated from Spanish by Rocio Vargas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and fungicide

loans.name: Saida

texts.en:
Saida T. is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs at her restaurant and is requesting a loan to purchase more tables and chairs. Saida is 39 years old and married; her husband is a cashier. She has three children, all of whom go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a permanent house for her family

About BRAC

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, targeted towards war refugees returning to their native home, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more chairs and tables for her restaurant

loans.name: Carlos Manuel

texts.es: Carlos Manuel E. O. tiene 30 años, es un hombre muy responsable y trabajador. Su actividad económica es la pesca, hace mas de 16 años que inicio este negocio Carlos tuvo que aprenderlo a muy temprana edad ya que tenía que mantener a sus 3 hijos y a su esposa que para él son lo más importante. Todos los días Carlos se levanta muy temprano, ya que tiene que arreglar sus redes para recoger muchos peces, últimamente ha presentado problemas como es poco capital de trabajo. Actualmente Carlos solicita el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo que será utilizado para la reparación del motor de su lancha, redes nuevas, ciertas herramientas que se utilizan en este negocio. su deseo es seguir adelante para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos Manuel E. O. is 30 years old, and is a very responsible and hardworking man. He has been engaged in the business of fishing for over 16 years. Carlos had to learn this business at a very young age, given that he had to support his 3 children and his wife, which he considers to be most important. Every day Carlos gets up very early, since he must rig up his nets so that he can catch a lot of fish. He has recently experienced problems with insufficient working capital. He is currently requesting a loan for working capital that will be used to repair the motor of his boat, and to purchase new nets and certain tools that he uses in his business. His desire is to continue to advance so that he can help his family.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Ana Margarita

texts.es: Ana Margarita B. O. reside en El departamento de Sonsonate, con 62 años de edad, Ana es una mujer soltera, se dedica de completo a su negocio el cual tiene ubicado en su casa, es una tienda con productos de consumo para el hogar, también maneja una pequeña producción de pupusas y tortillas,  las cuales son consumidas por los clientes de la zona, que reconocen que la amabilidad de Ana es una gran cualidad en ella, el deseo de superación de Ana hace que ahora solicite de un  crédito para surtir su negocio con mayor cantidad y variedad de productos para la tienda.
texts.en:
Ana Margarita B. O. is 62 years old, single, and totally dedicated to running her grocery store which she operates from her own home. She lives in the Sonsonate department and also runs a small pupusa (maize dumpling) and tortilla production operation. Her customers are people from her area who are drawn by Ana's kindness, which is one of her characteristics. And is requesting funds to buy supplies so that she can have a more varied inventory in her store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her store.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emilia is 36 years old, and is divorced with three children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade. She works to provide for her family.

Emilia has a palm oil production business. She buys the fresh palm nuts from nearby communities, prepares the oil, and supplies it to retailers in her community as well as selling it at the local market. Emilia has been in business for two years and wants a loan to procure palm nuts in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase palm nuts in bulk

loans.name: Ernesto Jr.

texts.en:
Ernesto, 41, owns one and one-fourth hectares of land. His one hectare is planted with corn, which gives him 50 sacks during harvest, costing 15,000 PHP. The remaining 1/4 hectare is a rice field, which gives him a harvest of 15 sacks or the equivalent of 10,000 PHP. He works hard to meet his target income during harvest time.

He heard about Community Economic Ventures, Inc., which helps entrepreneurs like him. He joined and requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy five sacks of fertilizer and other farm needs.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and farm inputs

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
el señor Esteban R. tiene 47 años de edad, es casado y tiene una hija que estudia y en vacaciones le ayuda ha vender su mercaderia. 

su negocio es la venta de ropa y reparacion de zapatos, dicho negocio esta ubicado en el mercado 
viejo de San Lorenzo, este negocio lo tiene desde hace varios años. Sus ventas son diarias de lunes a
sabado, esta solicitando el prestamo para surtir su negocio ya que se aproxima la navidad en donde la demanda es mayor. 
 
Su sueño es tener su propia casa para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hija que es lo que mas quiere en este mundo, dice que para ella trabaja.
texts.en:
Esteban R. is 47 years old. He is married and has one daughter who is a university student; during her vacations, she helps him sell his merchandise. His business is selling clothing and repairing shoes. The business is located in the traditional market of San Lorenzo, and he has operated it for several years. His sales stall is open daily from Monday to Saturday. He is requesting the loan in order to stock his business, since Christmas is approaching, when the demand is greater. His dream is to have his own house, in order to provide a higher quality of life for his daughter, which is what he wants most in this world; he says that he is working for her sake.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing ladies' and men's clothing

loans.name: Faasagaone

texts.en:
Faasagaone P. is 26 and single with 3 children (aged 12-17).  She owns a business venture, catching & selling ocean-caught fish .  Faasagaone has many years of experience in this business.  Faasagaone needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase a fishing boat.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 tala or US $208 per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.

Faasagaone joined SPBD.This is her 3rd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Faasagaone's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Faasagaone P. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.4 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.8 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2.3 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375p

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat

loans.name: Kigunga Twezimbe Group, Lugazi

texts.en: N. Betty is the leader of her lending group in Kigunga, Mukono. She is a widow with three children who go to school. She also takes care of two dependants, one of whom is an orphan. Betty is a business lady who has been involved in the sale of fruits and vegetables from Nakawa for eight years. She is able to make a profit of 40,000/= a week. She buys her stock from the farmers and sells to retailers. It’s due to her trustworthiness that she is successful. In the future, Betty needs to have a retail shop in addition to her current business to earn more income. She needs a loan to help with buying more supplies like tomatoes, onions, yellow bananas, and with paying for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: To buy more produce and pay school fees.

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Thorn L. is 44 years old and she lives with her family in Thmei village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Torng Ouk, are farmers. Although they try to work hard with the field, they still earn less income to support the family. In order to increase their income and improve the family's living conditions, Mrs. Thorn L. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow and four piglets for breeding. She will use the rest of the loan to buy pig food.

Mrs. Thorn L. has four children, two of whom are employed in the garment factory and the other two are students in the local school. Her husband is on the right of the picture.

loans.use: To buy a cow and four piglets for breeding, and pig food

loans.name: San Pablo Group

texts.es:
El comité San Pablo esta  ubicado en el Barrio  km 8  Monday de Ciudad del Este,fue conformado a través de la Elida Cuellar quien contacto con sus vecinas y amigas del barrio. Integran este comité 17 señoras activas y emprendedoras.
El crédito lo  destinaron a la compra de ropas,bebidas,embutidos,carne vacuna  y de cerdo,pollo,aceite,
arroz ,fideos,productos lácteos,cosméticos,cubiertos,joyas de plata,condimentos,frutas y verduras,zapatos,telas,gomas,
hilos,maiz, en fin de acuerdo a la actividad a que cada una se dedica.
 Así como ejemplo la señora Eligia B. quien destino todo su crédito para la compra de todos los productos en cuanto a cosméticos se refiera, ya que la misma se dedica a su venta, esta actividad ella lo realiza en sus tiempos libres. La venta lo realiza mediante visitas a clientes en su negocio o en su casa. El negocio ayuda bastante para los gastos de la casa especialmente en cuanto alimentación comenta la señora eligia, Agradece a sus amigas del comité por la ayuda constante y a la Fundación Paraguaya. 
Este crédito solidario les posibilita a  cada una de las señoras tener  un ingreso diario y un trabajo independiente.
Juliana B.
Venta y compostura de zapato
Ana Maria C.
Venta de ropa 
Eligia B.
Venta de cosméticos
Juana Amancia B.
Venta de ropas
Gloria A. 
Venta de ropa
Rosa A.
Venta de ropa seminueva
Cynthia A.
Venta de comida
Ramona B.
Venta de  productos de limpieza
Luz N.
Venta de ropa
Laura V. 
Venta de comida
Lidia A.
Venta de ropa
Ursulina S.
Despensa
Ursulina B.
Venta de bebidas
Efigenia Lopez
Venta de ropas
Delia B.
 Venta de maiz
Marcelina L.
Modista
texts.en:
The San Pablo (St. Paul) Committee is located in the kilometer 8 Monday Barrio, City of Este. It was formed by Elida Cuellar who contacted her neighbors and friends in the barrio. The committee is composed of 17 active and enterprising women. The loan is destined for purchasing clothes, drinks, lace, beef, silver jewelry, condiments, fruit and vegetables, shoes, cloth, glue, thread, and corn; in short, relating to the activity of each member. For example, Mrs. Eligia B. will use her loan to buy all those products related to cosmetics, which is what she sells. She does this in her spare time. Eligia sells by visiting customers in their homes, or in her store. The business helps her considerably with household expenses, especially with food, comments Eligia. She thanks her friends on the committee and at the Fundación Paraguaya (Paraguay Foundation) for their constant help. This solidarity loan makes it possible for each one of these women to have a daily income and independent work. Juliana B. Making and selling shoes Ana Maria C. Clothing sales Eligia B. Cosmetic sales Juana Amancia B. Clothing sales Gloria A. Clothing sales Rosa A. Sale of semi-new clothing Cynthia A. Selling meals Ramona B. Sale of cleaning products Luz N. Clothing sales Laura V. Selling meals Lidia A. Clothing sales Ursulina S. Provisions store Ursulina B. Dring sales Efigenia Lopez Clothing sales Delia B. Corn sales Marcelina L. Dressmaker

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING COLOGNES, MAKE UP, LINEN GOODS, ENAMELS, CREAMS, AND ACCESSORIES

loans.name: Gemalyn's Group

texts.en:
Gemalyn J. is from the village of Rang-ay, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is the leader of a four-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.
Gemalyn is 32 years old, married, and has one school-aged child. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Gemalyn has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Gemalyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Eslyn

texts.en:
Eslyn N. is from the village of Maddurulug Norte, Enrile, Cagayan. She is 57 years old and married with seven adult children To make a living, Eslyn has a store selling a variety of products such as vegetables. She has been in the business for over three years earning approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Eslyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eslyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. Eslyn is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Eslyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira S. is from the village of Langcangan, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 43 years old, married and has two adult children. To make a living, Elvira owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Elvira has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Elvira joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. Elvira is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan she has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Baigalmaa

texts.en:
Baigalmaa is 42 years old and lives with her husband and four children in Arhangai province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. Her two older daughters attend university, and her younger children are secondary school students.

She operates a clothing trading business from a rental counter at the Terh trading center. She sells a variety of men's and women's clothing, as well as sneakers, all of which she purchases in Ereen, a Chinese border town. She began operating her clothing trading business in 2004. She also has been operating a bakery business since 1997, baking and selling bread.  

Over the years Baigalmaa has steadily expanded her business, and today her working capital is 3,500,000 MNT. She is a very hardworking person, a great businesswoman and a good mother for her children. She says, “I would like to provide a good education to my children so that they will become well educated people.” 

Baigalmaa is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase additional inventory for her clothing business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Trương's Group

texts.en:
Q. Trương Thị (20203050016) is a 31-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - B. Ninh.  Q. is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Ô Cach Nhóm 05 (4).


Q. is married and has three school-aged children.  To make a living, Q. owns & operates a business making & selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members.  Q. has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2009, Q. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Q. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings.  She is now requesting a new loan of 7,840,000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital.  The loan will be the second loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  Q. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Đoàn Thị B. (0) is a 29-year-old female who is requesting a 6,944,000 VND loan to support her service-based business.


2.  Trương Thị Q. (0) is a 23-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her furniture making business.


3.  Nguyễn Thị C. (0) is a 55-year-old female who is requesting a 6,944,000 VND loan to support her furniture making business.


4.  Nguyễn Thị C. (0) is a 28-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her furniture making business.


5.  Đoàn Thị T. (0) is a 23-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her furniture making business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Q. Trương Thị (20203050016) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - B. Ninh.  Q. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Ô cach nhóm 05 (4).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán trang thiết bị gia dụng thông thường cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Q. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Q. kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND.  Vào 2009, Q. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp C. thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Q. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.152.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua nguyên liệu thô bổ sung để mở rộng việc giới thiệu sản phẩm.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.840.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Đoàn Thị B. (0) là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


2.  Trương Thị Q. (0) là 23 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


3.  Nguyễn Thị C. (0) là 55 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


4.  Nguyễn Thị C. (0) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


5.  Đoàn Thị T. (0) là 23 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía B. Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm C. phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah is a single mother of three children and all her children go to school.  She also takes care of her old father. She owns a stall in Kanyanya in the outskirts of Kampala selling bananas, tomatoes, Irish potatoes and cassava. She buys these foodstuffs from Kalerwe market and uses public transport to and from shopping. Deborah  goes shopping on a daily basis.  She wants to use this loan of 300,000/= to buy more bunches of bananas, boxes of tomatoes, one bag of Irish potatoes and cassava. She has been in this business for 20 years.  Besides this food business, she also sells piped water to the community at 100/= per jerrycan.  Her major customers are the community around her. Deborah works seven days a week and her business challenges are transportation and thieves. She aspires to buy directly from the farmers. She joined MCDT because she wanted money for her business. She resides in and owns a two-room house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include paying utility bills and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bananas, tomatoes, Irish potatoes and cassava

loans.name: G.s Don Tino Group

texts.es: El grupo Solidario Don Tino está conformado por Constantino De Jesús y Juan José. Por lo que lo que ambos se dedican a diferentes actividades económicas. A pesar de tener mucha experiencia en su negocio todavía deben aprender más, pues  no es la primera vez que realizan financiamientos son dos personas luchadoras y trabajadoras que han demostrado pagar sus cuotas en tiempo y forma. Actualmente están solicitando este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima en el caso de Constantino para la compra de telas tijeras, hilos, botones y agujas en el caso de Juan José para la compra de leña, gaseosas, jugos y golosinas. Juntos sueñan con mantener activos sus negocios que son los responsables del mantenimiento de los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
The Don Tino Solidarity Group is made up of Constantino De Jesús and Juan José. They each have different businesses. Even though they have a lot of experience in their fields they know that they still have to learn more. This will not be the first loan they have received, and they are hard workers and have proven to be trustworthy making their payments. Currently they are applying for a loan to purchase raw materials. In the case of Constantino the money is for fabric scissors, thread, button, and needles, and Juan José will use the money to buy firewood, soda, juices, and snacks. They both hope to keep their businesses functioning because they use their profits to cover their household costs.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: work capital (thread, buttons, needles and firewood, soda, juices, and snacks)

loans.name: Mujeres De Tierra Colorada Group

texts.es:
Doña Julia X. C., es una persona que ha superado Elaborando canastas, y luego venderlos en los distintos días de plaza, en los diferentes municipios, por lo tanto ella se dió cuenta que elaborando y vendiendo las canastas a podido mantener a su familia y cubrir sus gastos de su hogar, por tal razón ella tomo la idea de formar un grupo de señoras, para que ellas puedan superar también este grupo está conformado por trece integrantes,  mujeres que se dedican en diferentes funciones como crianza de animales, venta de ropa, venta de artículos de consumo diario, elaboración de canastas, elaboración de mochilas. 

Las integrantes del Banco Comunal, Mujeres de Tierra Colorada , Momostenango, están conformados por MUJERES todas se conocen bien desde hace más de doce años, decidieron solicitar un crédito en ASDIR para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia ya que estas personas son de escasos recursos y es de gran ayuda para ellas ampliar su capital de negocio y mejoras sus ventas como también sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Julia X. C. is a person who has succeeded through making baskets and selling them on market days, in different towns. She found that through making and selling baskets she has been able to maintain her family and cover all of the household costs. For this reason she had the idea of forming a group of women so that they also could succeed. This group is composed of thirteen members, women who work in various areas such as the raising of small animals, clothing sales and sales of basic staples, basket-making and backpack-making. The members of the Mujeres de Tierra Colorada ("Women of the Red Earth") are in Momostenango. It is a group made up of women, all of whom have known each other well for over two years. They decided to request a loan from ASDIR in order to be able to improve their living conditions and those of their families, since they are women of limited resources and this is a great help for them to expand their business capital and improve their sales and their earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Sabougnouman 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe Sabougnouman 1 sont des femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 49 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Fatiana, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. 
es spéculations cultivées sont entre autres  l’arachide,   le petit mil et le haricot. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne et le premier a été bien remboursé.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, SALI C. compte acheter les intrants avant la hausse des prix, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1,8 hectare d’arachide et du haricot.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Dioïla et Fana après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25000FCFA en fin de  campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Sabougnouman 1 group are married women who average 49 years of age with three children each. The majority of them live in polygamous families in Fatiana, one of the villages of the prefecture of Dioïla, in the Koulikoro region, which is the second administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, with the aim of better organising their activities at the beginning of the winter season. The crops they cultivate include peanuts, pearl millet and beans. They are on their second farming loan, and the first was paid on time. With this new loan Sali C. is planning to buy intrants before the prices increases and small equipment, as well as paying the labor costs of maintaining around 1.8 hectares of peanuts and beans. The produce, once harvested, is sold in the towns of Dioïla and Fana, to a customer base made up of men and women. The women are expecting to make an average profit of 25,000FCFA at the end of the season.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of intrants and small equipment as well as payment of labor costs

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda T. is from the town of Trento. She is 34 years old. Linda is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Linda owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Linda has been engaged in her business for over 10 years. She wishes to be a successful businesswoman and also dreams for her children to finish college.

Linda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Linda has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Linda is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Linda from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, fertilizers and other farm materials

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en:
Diosdada P., aged 45, and her husband Eufrocino, aged 50, work hard to cover their daily expenses.  They have a child in college.  For the past ten years Diosada has owned and run a small videoke (karaoke) eatery, which generates 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month in earnings.

Diosdada would like to improve her business and has applied for a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase food (meat, soft drinks, vegetables, and spices) as well as a new microphone for videoke.  She believes the improvements and expanded inventory will help her attract more business and increase earnings.  

Diosdada has been a member of the Center for Community Transformation since 2006 and has consistently attended weekly fellowship meetings.  She hopes the earnings from her business will continue to help her cover her basic needs. 

About CCT:

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical missionary work in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

Locally, all CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for food business, beverages and a new microphone unit for karaoke.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is happily married and has three children who attend school. She owns a home with electricity and piped water. She says food is her greatest expense.

Veronica is a tailor and has run a tailoring school at her home for over ten years. She joined Yehu so as to access financial support. With the Kshs 20,000 loan, she wants to buy clothing materials for her tailoring business.

Veronica’s greatest challenge in her business is seasonality as most of her customers’ needs occur mainly during special days such as during wedding ceremonies which mostly happen during the holidays in the months of April, August and December.

Veronica also owns a rental house as her other source of income. She hopes to open a bigger shop for her tailoring business.

loans.use: To buy more clothing materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Pedrita

texts.en:
Pedrita N. is from the village of Purok de Oro, Iligan City. She is 42 years old and is single. Pedrita owns & operates a food business where she sells specialty food products, in particular viands. She has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Pedrita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

location.town: Purok de Oro, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Madame Mariama C.  est une femme mariée de 37 ans qui habite dans la localité de Yoff. Elle a  4 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 4 et 8 ans. Elle a choisi l’activité de commerce par amour  mais aussi dans le but de satisfaire ses besoins d’ordre familiaux. L’aspect lucratif de cette activité l’intéresse  beaucoup. Par conséquent elle s’adonne  à l’achat et la revente d’habits et de chaussures depuis déjà  plus de 15 ans. Elle est membre de la caisse de Yoff depuis aout 2009.Elle sollicite un crédit de 300 000frs qui sera destiné à accroitre son fond de roulement afin de développer son activité. L’augmentation de ses bénéfices lui permettra d’améliorer  le cadre de vie de sa famille et d’aspirer a disposer d’un grand magasin en renforçant  son épargne.
texts.en: Mrs. Mariama C. is a married woman, 37 years old, who lives in Yoff. She has four children ranging from 4 to 8 years of age. She has chosen this line of business because she was attracted to it but also because of the need to support her family. The financial aspect matters a lot to her. And so she has been selling clothing and shoes for over 15 years already. She joined the Yoff credit union in August 2009. At present she is seeking a loan of 300,000 which will be used to bolster her business capital and grow her business. The increase of her revenues will allow her to improve her family’s life conditions; eventually she hopes to have a large store and  maintain her savings.

loans.use: Increasing working capital

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice W. is forty-eight years old.  She has two children whom she hopes to educate to the university level. She has a restaurant in a residential area in Nairobi known as Joski in which she serves the local people. She has been in the restaurant business for three years now and she says that the business is profitable; the major challenge she has is lack of finances. However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep her business doing well. She hopes that in the future, she will grow her business into a hotel. She is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy supplies for making food to sell to her customers. She describes herself as ambitious.

loans.use: Raw materials for her restaurant

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en: This is 25-year-old Salamatu. She is married and has a child who is 8 years old.  In 2004, Salamatu established her textiles business.  This consists of cotton and gara fabric as well as lace materials.  She began her business in order to help her father generate income for their family.  Working 6 days a week and 8 hours a day, she earns about Le 600,000 every month from this business.  Salamatu would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 to purchase more goods in bulk.  She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 1,400,000. In the future, Salamatu plans to grow her business by increasing her stock.  Eventually, she hopes to buy more modern goods by trading internationally.  In the long run, she hopes to both build a house and educate her children to a higher level.  She thanks you for your support

loans.use: To buy more bales of clothing for her business

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PUNTUALITO ”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Mery ; ella tiene 39 años de edad ,conviviente  y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de agencia de turismo ,vendiendo paquetes turísticos , boletos turísticos .La socia trabaja desde las 08:00 am  hasta la 07:00pm de lunes a sábado  , la socia quiere ampliar su negocio  .
 La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar su agencia de viajes ya que es el único sustento para su familia.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Mery is a member of the community bank "Puntualito", which is located in the Cusco district in the province and department of Cusco.

Mery is 39 years old, married, and has two children.  She balances her daily activities with work at a travel agency, selling travel packages and tickets.  She works from 8:00am to 7:00pm from Monday to Saturday.  She would like to improve her business.  

She is asking for this loan in order to improve her travel agency because it is the only income her family has.

Mery is thankful to everyone who is helping her achieve her dream with this loan, and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: Improve her travel agency business

loans.name: Baasandorj

texts.en: Baasandorj D., 27, lives with his wife and daughter in a rented house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His daughter, aged two, is in kindergarten. Baasandarj and his wife operate a meat-trading business in a rented stall at Harharin market, one of the largest markets in the city. They have had this business for the last three years and have built a stable operation. Baasandorj is responsible for purchasing meats from wholesale traders while his wife works as a salesperson in their meat stall. Their working capital has grown to 3,000,000 MNT. Baasandorj is a modest man who plans to expand his business and have his own work place. He is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan to purchase and preserve more meat.

loans.use: To purchase and preserve more meat

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma, de 24 años, vive en casa de su hermana en compañía de ella, y de su pequeña hija, juntas se esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante. Hace más 2 años, esta trabajadora mujer se dedica a la venta de menús (comida del día) durante las mañanas, en un puesto alquilado de su zona. Esta muy satisfecha pues las ganancias son diarias y solo se ocupa del negocio parte del día; pues en las noches  se dirige al trabajo de limpieza que realiza en un hotel de un distrito aledaño. Tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante, y por esta razón trabaja sin cansancio para educar bien a su hija y también para ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida. Le gusta mucho sus labores pues le generan regulares ganancias. Y ya tiene pensado para el futuro instalar, en sociedad con su cuñado  que es zapatero, un negocio de renovadora de calzado, de esta manera espera salir adelante. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que les permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Vilma tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de materiales para implementar mejor el negocio de renovadora de calzado que instalará con su cuñado.
texts.en:
Vilma is 24 years old.  She lives in her sister's house with her sister and her young daughter.  Together they work hard every day to get ahead.  This hard-working woman has been selling meals for more than two years.  She sells her meals in the morning, from a rented stall in her area.  She is very satisfied since her profits are daily and she only has to take care of the business for part of the day.  In the evenings she goes out to do her cleaning job in a hotel in a neighboring district.

Vilma has a great desire to get ahead in life and, for this reason, she works tirelessly to educate her daughter well and offer her a better quality of life.  Vilma likes her work a lot because it makes her regular income.  She is thinking of setting up a shoe-mending business with her brother-in-law who is a shoe maker.  In this way she hopes to get ahead in life.

This is Vilma's first loan with MFP and she pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner since she doesn't want to let down the people who are making this support possible as it will allow her to continue working in search of progress.  Vilma plans to invest her loan in buying materials to set up a shoe-mending business with her brother-in-law.

loans.use: To buy materials to set up a shoe-mending business

loans.name: San Martin Mb Group

texts.es: La foto fue tomada el la casa de Benita, una integrante del grupo San Martin MB que está ubicado en el Estado de Veracruz en México. Se ve al grupo de señoras al rededor de los arreglos navideños que vende doña Benita en la foto. Ella se dedica a vender ropa y adornos navideños que inicio hace 6 años. Solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa de invierno. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente satisfecha con su crédito. Tiene 35 años, estudió hasta segundo de secundaria, vive en unión libre y tiene un total de 4 hijos; 2 mujeres y 2 varones. Quiere este crédito para comprar más mercancía de temporada y mejorar sus ingresos. También espera realizar mejoras en su casa, cambiar sus muebles y apoyar los estudios de sus hijos. Eugenia del Carmen G. es la Presidenta del grupo. Tiene 25 años, estudió hasta secundaria y es casada. Ella se dedica a la venta de dulces que inicio hace 4 años. solicita el préstamo para comprar dulces y jugetes para vender. El grupo esta conformado por 9 integrantes y todas aparecen en la foto.
texts.en:
This photo was taken at Benita's house, a member of the group San Martin MB which is located in the state of Veracruz in México. In this photo, a group of women can be seen gathered around the Christmas decorations that Benita sells. Benita began selling clothes and Christmas decorations six years ago. She is applying for this loan to purchase winter clothing. At the time of applying for the loan she felt satisfied with the terms of the loan. 

Benita is 35 years old and studied until the second year of secondary school. She lives in a common-law marriage and has four children: two girls and two boys. She is requesting this loan to purchase more merchandise for the Christmas season and to increase her income. She also hopes to make some renovations on her house, change the furniture and support her children's studies. 

Eugenia del Carmen G. is the president of the group. She is 25 years old, studied until she reached high school and is married. She began selling sweets four years ago and is now requesting a loan to purchase sweets and toys to sell. 

The group is made up of nine members and all of them appear in this photo.

loans.use: Purchase winter clothing

loans.name: Gulmairam's Group

texts.en:
Gulmairam S., 33, resides in Kadamjai. She is the leader of this group. She is divorced, and the single mother of  three daughters. All of her daughters attend school.  To earn a living,  Gulmairam is a commercial agent who sells medicine. She started this business two years ago with the initial investment of 5000 soms, and she now earns 1000 soms per month. With money received from the loan,  she wants to purchase kitchen furniture in order to improve the family’s living conditions. In the future she dreams of opening her own pharmacy. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase kitchen furniture

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda, tiene 45 años, es casada, tiene tres hijos y vive en la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Ella después de hacer sus actividades del hogar se dedica a su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de materiales de escritorio como por ejemplo lápices, lapiceros, cuaderno, libros y muchas cosas más. Yolanda requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo cuadernos, lapiceros, etc.

Yolanda pertenece al banco comunal “Renovación” de la UMF Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal está conformado por personas emprendedoras y trabajadoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 45 years old, married, has three children, and lives in the city of Cusco, Peru. After doing the household tasks, she works at her business selling office items like pencils, pens, notebooks, books, and many other things. Yolanda needs the loan to purchase merchandise like notebooks, pens, etc.

Yolanda belongs to Asociación Araiwa’s Renovación Communal Bank in Cusco, Peru. The communal bank is comprised of enterprising and hardworking people who always look for opportunities to get their children ahead in life.

loans.use: To buy merchandise like notebooks, pens, etc.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva S. is from the village of Margos Kapatagan, Lanao Del Norte. She is 27 years old and married. To make a living, Eva owns and operates a business venture in the services sector, operating a tricycle transport service. She is just starting this business.

In 2011, Eva joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This will be her 1st loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle for better service

location.town: Margos Kapatagan, Aurora Zamboang Del Sur

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: This is 34 year-old Fatmata K.. She is married and has two children aged two and six. In 2008, Fatmata K. established a kitchen utensil business. She opens her business six days a week and eleven hours a day. She is requesting a loan of 4,800,000 SLL to help her buy a large quantity of stock. This will reduce her transportation costs and in turn increase her profit margin. In the future, Fatmata plans to buy a piece of land. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more plastic kitchen equipment

loans.name: Zubaida's Group

texts.en: Zubaida lives in Kasur, which is a small city in Pakistan known for its leather industry. She lives in the Rasoolpura area in a three-room brick house with her family. She is 31 years old and has six children. Her eldest son works for a private organization while the others are studying and attending a local school. Her husband is a cobbler by profession and manufactures shoes. He makes contracts with different factories and shoe stores and fills their orders on time to earn profit. He has another business of making rope which is used to make a local bed called a charpae (a cot). Zubaida also helps her husband financially by making embroidered shawls. She is very good at her work and prepares a good number of shawls every month which she sells to different shops in the city. She is a very responsible lady and also manages her household work very well. Zubaida has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, to improve her husband’s rope-making business. With this loan, he will buy a rope-making machine and thread that will help him make rope in larger quantities and sell at a higher profit. He has been in business for the past six years, and Zubaida is hopeful that a loan investment will make her husband’s business more profitable and will increase his income. Zubaida is a new loan applicant of Asasah and hopes to bring positive financial changes to her family. In the photo, the lady holding a book (an Asasah passbook) is Zubaida.

loans.use: to buy a rope-making machine and thread for a rope-making business

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
As a married parent of 11 children, Flora is a very hard working entrepreneur. Flora is 57 years old. Flora has four children who are in school.

Flora has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. Flora requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing net and repair her fishing boat.

Flora has been in this business for nine years.  In the future, Flora would like to continue to send her kids to school.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net and repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 59 years old and married with five children aged between 14 and 30. He has a mixed farm in Nkubu town in eastern Kenya that produces coffee, bananas, maize and milk. Michael has been in the farming business for 35 years and employs two farmhands. He sells all his products locally. He solely depends on the income from his farm to cater for the needs of his family.
Michael has requested a loan of 40,000 KES through Kiva partner, Juhudi Kilimo, to purchase a dairy cow. He says that the extra income from this loan will enable him to expand his farming activities and support his family. He aspires to start a retail shop and acquire three dairy cows in the next five years. His biggest challenge has been lack of sufficient money to finance his farming business.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Dorjnamjil

texts.en: Dorjnamjil is 56 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in a house in Han-Uul district, Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. They live with their two disabled relatives and take care of them. Dorjnamjil is a photographer who works at Suhbaatar square, is the central square of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. It is scene of major state ceremonies, cultural events and exhibitions. Therefore many people gather at this square and like to be photographed to keep their precious memories. He started his business in 2001.  In 2004 his wife, Altantsetseg, also began working as a photographer too. His daughter, age 25, helps with the family business by picking up the films in order to process them at a laboratory. They prefer to use advanced cameras in order to provide quality service for their customers. So they began using digital cameras to capture images electronically which allowed them to print their pictures in a minute. They also offered a very special service of taking one's picture with Mongolian traditional clothes on. They are planning to continue and expand their business in the future. Dorjnamjil is a hardworking man who says, "By depositing my business earnings I want to pay the education cost of my daughter." He is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT of loan to renew his camera and to purchase more photo papers.

loans.use: To to renew his camera and purchase more photo papers for his photography business.

loans.name: Dante Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto tiene 69 años de edad, es casado con la señora Maria Agapito, con la que tienen 2 hijos.  Ellos tienen casa propia y esta ubicada en la zona rural de Chacupe, en distrito de La Victoria.

Alberto se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura desde hace mas de quince años, el suele sembrar arveja en un pequeño terreno de cultivo con el que cuenta y se ubica en su misma localidad de Chacupe, en esta  zona la mayoría de pobladores se dedica a esta labor.

Alberto desea adquirir fertilizantes y abono para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de arveja con esta acción el espera obtener una buena cosecha. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de S/. 3000,00 nuevos soles.

Alberto es una persona bastante tranquila y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es poder crecer como empresario y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Alberto is 69 years old. He is married to Maria Agapito and they have 2 children. They have their own house, located in the rural area of Chacupe, district of La  Victoria.

Alberto has been working in agriculture for over fifteen years. He usually grows peas in a small field he owns, also located in Chacupe. Most of people in the area do this kind of work. 

Alberto would like to buy fertilizers and manure to support his pea crop. He expects that this will bring him a good harvest. That's why he has had to request a loan of 3,000 soles to Edpyme Alternativa. 

Alberto is a rather quiet and responsible person. His greatest wish is to grow his business and get on.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and manure for his crop.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA”; La socia vive en el distrito de Urubamba en la provincia de Urubamba,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia tiene 50 años de edad y La socia es soltera y tiene 3 hijos de 25, 22, 19 años de edad; la socia se dedica  al comercio minorista, la socia se dedica  a la compra y venta de forraje, la socia distribuye el alimento para ganados a diferentes clientes que ella tiene, la socia solía comprar al por mayor forraje de la cervecería llamad sutuchi pero ya no lo hace ahora ella saca de las cosechas de maíz y vende a los clientes que tiene sus ganados, chanchos, cuyes, la socia también tiene chanchos y cuyes que cría y los vende. La socia desea el crédito para poder comprar el follaje al por mayor fresco y distribuirlo. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar follaje para la venta. 

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the "San José de Urubamba" community bank.  She lives in Urubamba district, in Cusco department.

The borrower is 50 years old, single, and has three children aged 25, 22 and 19.  She buys and sells fodder.  She distributes the animal feed to different customers that she has.  She would like to buy fodder called 'sutuchi' wholesale from a brewery but right now she buys corn harvests and sells them to customers for their cattle, pigs and guinea pigs.  She also raises and sells pigs and guinea pigs herself.  She would like this loan to buy fresh fodder wholesale which she will then sell.

The borrower appreciates the loan that she has been granted and is infinitely grateful since it will allow her to grow her business and improve her quality of life.  She pledges to make her repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to buy fodder to sell

loans.name: Dolores Isabel

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Managua, la señora Dolores Isabel Es madre soltera, trabaja como oficinista para salir adelante y darle un mejor bienestar a su familia. 
La señora Dolores se  presente a nuestra oficina de ceprodel para  solicitar crédito ya que necesita invertir en compra de zinc por que con la entrada del invierno necesita hacer el cambio del techo que se encuentra el mal estado, tales como lámina de zinc perlin y pagar mano de obra.
texts.en:
In the city of Managua, Dolores Isabel, a single mother, works as an office assistant to move forward and to provide her family with wellbeing.

Dolores has come to our Ceprodel office (Kiva Field Partner) to request a loan which will be invested in the purchase of zinc sheeting, purlins, and to cover the labor expenses. As winter approaches she will need to change the roofing of her house which is in poor state.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Nusra

texts.en:
Nusra is a 39-year-old hard working single lady. Her passion to design and sew clothes since she was a young lady led her to find a full time job as a tailor in one of the biggest tailoring factories in Jordan. But that did not satisfy Nusra. She wanted to have her own business in tailoring and sewing.  So she bought a sewing machine and started every day, after getting off her full time job, to work at her house as a freelancer sewing and tailoring clothes at her clients' requests, noting that most of her clients are other tailoring workshops.

It has been three years since her own business started; now Nusra is applying for a loan to buy a modern sewing machine to help her serve her clients in a faster way. Since Nusra is a conservative person, her sister Haijar, who also helps her with her business, has agreed to have her picture taken instead of Nusra.

loans.use: To buy a modern sewing machine

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en:
Elchin is a 41 year-old-man. He is married and has two children. 

Elchin owns a grocery store and has provided for his family with the revenue generated by the grocery store since 2004. His shop is located in the Agsu central bazaar and many people pass through his grocery shop to buy something. 

His monthly turnover is 300 AZN and he would like to increase it. He is requesting a loan of 1,400 AZN to increase his stock. 

Elchin is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. 

Elchin is taking his second loan from Aqroinvest CU, and his previous loan history makes us believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: to purchase more food items to increase profits.

loans.name: Chheuen

texts.en:
Chheuen, 33 year old, is scavenger. His wife is working in the factory and their income is $5 per day. He has three children, and one of them is studying. 

Every month, he has to spend $40 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on rent, $10 on school fees, $15 on transportation and $20 on other expenses. 

He notices that his business can make a good profit, so he plans to extend his business by purchasing more recyclable items to stock whenever he is able to save enough money.

He would like to request a loan of $800 to buy items to recycle and resell. He hopes to send all of his children to study in the university when they finish high school.

loans.use: To buy items to recycle and resell

loans.name: Theoneste

texts.en:
Theoneste is a 38 year old Rwandan entreprenuer with 3 children between the ages of 5 and 7 years old.  His wife is a business woman.

For the past 5 years, he has been running a general store selling sugar, tuna, rice and other goods. This business has allowed him to to improve the standard of living for himself and his family. 

He requires this loan so he can continue to purchase goods that he will sell in his store to make profits.

With the future profits from his business, he wishes to renovate his family house.

loans.use: to buy goods for sale in his general store

loans.name: Evas

texts.en: Evas is a 49-year-old married woman with four children living in her own house in Kamwenge, Uganda with a dream of educating her children up to university. She has been in poultry farming for four years now and her major threats are thieves who break in and steal chickens and also the high cost of feed, but  in spite of this she longs to buy more birds and also construct a more secure structure. Evas needs the loan to buy chicken feed.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Being a parent means taking on the responsibility to provide for all of the family's financial and emotional needs. Most of this responsibility is to send children to school to give them the best education for the future. Likewise, Marcelina and her husband aim to continue sending their three children to school to give them a bright future. But due to financial difficulties, they need to improve their source of income to satisfy their daily basic needs and support the education of their children.

In this regard, Marcelina wants to request an additional loan of PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides to sustain their rice farming business. She believes that the loan will help them to increase their production and income this coming harvest season. She hopes that in the future, their business will improve and all of their children will finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides to sustain rice production

loans.name: Zamina

texts.en:
Zamina is married and has three children. The knowledge acquired from her parents and grandparents has contributed to Zamina's work raising cattle for the last 10 years. 

Zamina's work in animal sales generates a good income for her family. She usually earns the equivalent of 250 US dollars (USD) per month. This income comes from meat and dairy selling. Currently she has two cows in her house. Her husband works as an accountant in a local company, but his salary is only 150 Azerbaijan New Manats (AZN) per month and so raising cattle is the main financial profit in Zamina's family. 

She would like to gradually increase the variety of her animals and is seeking a loan of 1000 AZN. This will be her fourth loan and she has a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase two cattle and fodder.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. 
Violeta has a shop that sells green & yellow bananas. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy bananas for sale.
Violeta has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Violeta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas for sale

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 54 years old and blessed with four school-aged children. She lives with her family in a village and generates her income through growing vegetables. She wants to earn more income to provide for her family's needs and save for the future of her children.

At this time, she has tried to plant more vegetables to increase her production. Due to inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of P7,000 (Philippine pesos) to buy seeds and fertilizers to sustain her vegetable production. She believes that the loan will help her increase her yields. She is hoping to harvest a large volume of vegetables and earn a higher income to support her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers to sustain her vegetable production

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with four children. 

Amos has a pigpen from which he sells matured & grown pigs. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy animal feed for the pigs.

Amos has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Amos hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs

loans.name: Habrahan

texts.es: Abrahán tiene 46 años, es soltero y vive en su casa propia, ubicado en el distrito de Pichari. Abrahán es un hombre trabajador que desde niño soñaba con tener una buena vida llena de comodidades, él sabe que para lograr éste objetivo debería trabajar mucho. Es por esta razón que se dedica al negocio de venta de ganado vacuno, siendo él mismo que los trae desde la sierra ayacuchana. Nos comenta que que es un trabajo bien sacrificado, trasladar caminando durante 5 días arreando el ganados desde las alturas de huamanga hacia el distrito de Pichari. Una vez llegado a la ciudad los sacrifica para comercializarlos en las carnicerias del distritio. Él esta satisfecho con las ganancias que obtiene, pero mas adelante desea dedicarse en la venta de carne de res al por mayor. Este será su primer crédito con MFP por lo que él esta comprometido en realizar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 2,500 soles, comprará más reses para comercializarlos.
texts.en: Abrahán is 46 years old, single, and lives in his own home, which is located in the District of Pichari.  Abrahán is a hardworking man that since childhood has dreamed of having a good life full of commodities.  He knows that in order to achieve this objective, he needs to work very hard.  As such, he works in the sale of cattle which he himself leads down from the Sierra Ayacuchana.  He tells us that it is a difficult job, having to walk five days pulling cattle from the peaks of the Huamanga Mountains down to the District of Pichari.  Once he arrives to the city, he sacrifices the animals to sell to the butcher shops in the area.  He is satisfied with the earnings that he makes, but in the future he hopes to work in the whole sale of roast beef.  This will be his first credit with MFP and he has promised to make all of his payments on time.  With the 2,500.00 Soles, he will purchase more cattle to sell.
