loans.use: to purchase more livestock.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”LOS COMERCIANTES”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Andahuaylillas en la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Vilma;  La socia tiene 22 años de edad, la socia es conviviente, la socia tiene 2 hijos de 4 y 2 años de edad; la socia vende chicha y animales menores la socia compra pollos por docenas, la socia se dedica  a la compra y venta de pollos por docenas, la socia desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de alimentos para su pollos y en la compra de pollos por docenas para criarlos y para la venta.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Los Comerciantes communal bank, located in the district of Andahuaylillas in the province of Quispicanchis and department of Cusco.

Vilma is the member.  She is 22 years old and lives with her partner and two children, ages 4 and 2.  She sells "chicha" [a drink made from corn] and small animals.  She buys chickens by the dozen and works buying and selling chickens by the dozen.

She wants to use the loan to buy feed for her chickens and chickens by the dozen to raise and sell.

Vilma is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments in accordance with the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy feed for her chickens and to buy chickens by the dozen to raise and sell.

loans.name: Manda Muungano Group

texts.en:
Samuel is the facilitator of the Manda Muungano group. Samuel and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Samuel takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices, to ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Samuel had a good maize yield harvesting 12 bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Samuel was only able to harvest three bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Samuel and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Samuel will educate his children, build a house and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Manda Muungano group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es: Yanet, de 32 años convive con Hugo, su pareja y padre de sus 2 hijos de 12 y 6 años, a quienes cría y educa en su casa propia en el anexo de Puente Paucartambo. Yanet como una mujer trabajadora, se dedica a la agricultura. En sus hectáreas de terrenos tiene sembrado plátanos y plantas de café, los que comercializa en la ciudad de La Merced a las cooperativas cafetaleras quienes le dan buenas ganancias por sus productos. “El café de esta zona es bien solicitado, por eso cuando cosecha lo vendo rápido”, comenta. Por su parte, Hugo, su pareja, trabaja en el campo en los cultivos, limpiando, abonando y para la cosecha tiene que contratar peones, por ser una faena dura. Y cuando el trabajo en los umbríos cesa, Hugo labora en propiedades ajenas como operario, de esa manera obtiene ingresos para el día a día. Y como Yanet no se conforma, también se dedica a la elaboración de viveros de café, los que vende de 400 a 450 soles el millar. Yanet espera darles una buena educación a sus hijos para ello seguirá trabajando duro y parejo. Éste sería su préstamo número 10 de MFP, por esa razón se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas como lo fue en los ciclos pasados. Además menciona sentirse muy contenta con su banco comunal, ya que fue una de las fundadoras. De recibir el dinero, Yanet invertirá en la compra de abonos, plantas de café y bolsas, para la elaboración de los viveros.
texts.en: Yanet is 32 years old and lives with her partner Hugo. the father of her 2 children, aged 12 & 6 years, who she raises and educates in her own house in Puente Paucartambo. Yanet as a hardworking woman, works as a farmer. On her hectares of farmland she grows bananas and coffee which she sells in the city of Merced to the coffee cooperatives who give her a good price for her products. "The coffee from this region is well sought after which is why my crop sells quickly," she comments. For his part, Hugo, her partner, works in the fields, cleaning and spreading manure; for the harvest he has to hire manual labourers as it is hard work. And when the work in the fields is finished, Hugo works on other neighbouring propeties as a labourer and so earns an income day to day. Not content, Yanet also has a coffee plant nursery and sells the plants at 400 to 450 soles per thousand. Yanet hopes to give her children a good education and will continue to work hard and long to achieve this. This would be her 10th loan with MFP and for this reason she agrees to be punctual with her repayments as she was with her past loan cycles. In addition she mentions feeling very happy with her communal bank as she was one of the founding members. On receiving the money, Yanet will invest in the purchase of manure, coffee plants and bags to be used in the nurseries.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Nome

texts.en:
Nome is 35 years old, a married woman with five children. Three of them are in school. 

She has had a business of selling clothes in Yambio, South Sudan, for nine years.

Nome is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mahoutin Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHOUTIN est composé de cinq personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Vidéhou est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Vidéhou est âgée de 34 ans et est mariée à un certain Félix. Vidéhou a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Vidéhou vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Pour y parvenir, Vidéhou mène comme activité depuis trois ans, la vente de tissus et de boisson locale à son domicile. Vidéhou s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Vidéhou sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHOUTIN, un deuxième crédit. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: The MAHOUTIN group is made up of five people who live in the same neighborhood.  This is the second time that the group is seeking financial assistance from ALIDé in order to increase their activity.  Vidéhou, the group's facilitator,  is the woman raising her hand on the photo.  Vidéhou is 34 years old and married to a man named Félix.  Vidéhou stopped going to school at the secondary level.  She lives with her husband and children.  Vidéhou and Félix have two children who attend school and whom they financially support.  Vidéhou and Félix take care of the various household expenses together.  In order to provide for her family, Vidéhou has been selling fabrics and local drinks at her home for three years.  Vidéhou buys her merchandise in Benin. In order to satisfy her customers and to increase her turnover and her income, Vidéhou is requesting a second loan, together with the other members of the MAHOUTIN group.  The first loan was well repaid.

loans.use: To buy fabrics and local drinks.

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es:
El grupo que lleva por nombre San Francisco, es de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, está integrado por 20 mujeres, quienes son todas amigas y vecinas de barrio. Ellas se unieron con el objetivo de trabajar juntas, y por medio de este trabajo poder ayudarse las unas a las otras y salir adelante. Ellas trabajan en forma conjunta y siempre tratando de ayudarse.
La señora Elena es una de las miembros, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, emprendedora y luchadora, y comenta que gracias a su trabajo y sacrificio ha podido salir adelante y ayudar a su familia y cubrir los gastos que diariamente surgen. Ella se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de prendas, como ser remeras, jeans, bermudas, camisas y demás, ya que siempre tiene buenas prendas, ya pudo formarse una buena clientela y hoy en día es una microempresaria exitosa.
Ella pide la ayuda de la fundación y de kiva para poder tener más variedad de prendas, y de esa forma atraer a más clientes y tener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
The group, which is called San Francisco is from the city of Coronel Oviedo, is made up of 20 women, who are all friends and neighbors in the neighborhood. They came together with the objective of working together, and through this work, be able to help themselves and each other succeed. They work in a collaborative way and are always trying to help each other progress.

Elena is one of these members. She is a hard working women, entrepreneur and fighter, and she says that thanks to her work and sacrifice she has been able to succeed and help her family to cover the expenses that arise daily. She sells all types of clothes for a living, like t-shirts, jeans, shorts, shirts and more. She always has good clothes and she was already able to develop good clientele and is today a successful small business.
She asks for the assistance of the foundation and of kiva to be able to have a greater variety of cloths and in this way attract more clients and make more income.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Chanthim

texts.en: Chanthim, 30, is married and lives with her husband and four children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in an agricultural business for over eight years, have extensive experience and are successful in their career. They are involved in growing rice and breeding pigs. Additionally, they are distillers and run a rice mill as well. In order to improve business, Chanthim is requesting a loan of USD1000 to purchase more pigs to breed in order to generate more income to support her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase pigs to breed to generate more income

loans.name: Barohat

texts.ru:
Барохат молодая и трудолюбивая женщина 29 лет. Она замужем и имеет троих детей. Они живут в сельской местности. 
Для того, чтобы иметь доход на проживание Барохат занимается своим бизнесом. Вот уже на протяжении 5 лет она занимается выращиванием сельхозкультур. Барохат женщина очень трудолюбивая, несмотря на трудности жизни она стремится улучшить свою жизнь. 
 Барохат взяла в аренду 2 га земли и  хочет посеет семечку. Но из за нехватки денежных средств она обратилась в МДО Арванд. Она надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит за поддержку.
texts.en:
Barohat is a young and hardworking woman. She is 29 years old, married, and has three children. They live in the countryside. Barohat runs her own business in order to generate income for daily life. She has been engaged in crop cultivation for five years. Barohat is a very hardworking woman, and in spite of difficulties in life she strives to improve her life. 

Barohat has rented two hectares of land and wants to sow seeds. However, due to insufficient funds, she has turned to MDO Arvand. She hopes for a positive outcome and gives thanks for the support in advance.

loans.use: to buy corn

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.en:
I sell second hand bed clothes, women's accessories, perfumes and other items. I have had my street vending business for two years, with which I have been able to continue studying and to help my parents, who are very humble people, of little resources. I would like to increase my sales and to sell a variety of items in my business.

Loan Use: Purchase bed-clothes, women's accessories, and other items.

Me dedico a la venta de ropa usada de cama, accesorios para dama, perfumes y otros. Tengo dos años de tener mi negocio ambulante, con lo que he podido seguir estudiando y ayudar a mis padres que son personas humildes y de bajos recursos. Me gustaria poder incrementar mis ventas y veder variedad de articulos en mi negocio.

loans.use: Venta de ropa de cama, accesorios de dama y otros.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Grace would like to buy different varieties of fruits and vegetables for her green grocer

loans.name: Faapala

texts.en: Faapala S. is an old lady of 75 years, married with nine children. Despite her old age, she still tries to come up with ways to earn money to support her and help out with the family commitments. Faapala works very hard in making and operating her popcorn business, so that it can be profitable even though she gets very sick at times. The popcorn is sold at schools or delivered to the village, but when she is sick, her daughter helps out. Faapala can never forget or leave her business because it’s what she relied on in the past to pay her kids' school fees and cater for her family needs, even though the children are now employed and more money is coming in to support the family.

loans.use: To purchase a popcorn popper, corn seeds, to pay kids' school fees

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura is a single mother who as a 12 years old daughter and 8 years old twins. She used to work for a company but her salary was too low and she didn’t have time enough for her kids, so she decided to leave her job and open her own business 5 years ago. She started selling juices, yogurt, cream, and cheese in the cooperative schools near by her home; little by little she grew on clientele and fixed her house to offer a better service.

It hasn’t been easy for Laura to support her family alone, but her love for her children her biggest motivation each day, now she needs a loan for $750 to buy merchandise to get more variety and keep on being her clients favorite. Help Laura and help her business improvement, she and her family will thank you forever.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Laura es madre soltera de una hija de 12 años de edad y un par de gemelos de 8 años. Antes ella trabajaba para una empresa pero su salario era bajo y no le permitía tener tiempo disponible para sus hijos, por lo que decidió abandonar su empleo e iniciar su propio negocio desde hace cinco años. Comenzó vendiendo jugos, yogurt, crema y queso para nachos en las cooperativas de las escuelas cercanas a su hogar, poco a poco fueron incrementándose sus clientes y acondicionó un lugar de su casa para poder ofrecer un mejor servicio.

No ha sido fácil para Laura tener que sostener a su familia ella sola, pero el amor hacia sus hijos es el más grande motivo que tiene para esforzarse casa día, ahora ella necesita un préstamo de $ 750 dólares que destinará a la compra de mercancía para tener una mejor variedad y continuar en la preferencia de sus clientes. Apoya a Laura y ayuda al desarrollo de su negocio, ella y su familia te lo agradecerán por siempre.

loans.use: Buy Merchandise

loans.name: Maria Elba

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Maria Elba. I am a merchant and I have my own business selling clothing and shoes that is located in front of the Boulevard of my city. I have been in this type of business for several years. I am a single mother with three children. Thanks to the income from this business, I am able to cover the expenses of food, education, health and other things. My husband emigrated and I haven’t heard anything from him. I need to stock my business well, since a good sales season is approaching, and be able to offer a variety of products to customers. In this way I can improve my income and my family’s standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Maria Elba, soy comerciente, cuento con un negocio de venta de ropa y Calzado ubicado frente al Boulervar de mi ciudad. tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de negocio, soy madre soltera y con tres hijos los que gracias a los ingresos de este negocio puedo cubrir los gastos de alimentación, educación, salud y otros, ya que mi esposop emigro y no se nada de el. Necesito surtir mas mi negocio ya que se acerca la temporada de mayor venta y asi ofrecer variedad de productos al cliente, logrando asi mejorar los ingresos y el nivel de vida de mi familia.

loans.use: To buy men's shirts, t-shirts, dress pants, children's shirts and shoes, and tennis shoes

loans.name: Roeun

texts.en: Mr. Im Chok, 49, lives with his wife and three school-aged children in Batambong province, Cambodia. To support his family, Im Chok works as a carpenter, making around US$3 a day, while his wife stays at home and takes care of the children. Mr. Im Chok is asking for a loan of US$600 to be able to purchase a motorcycle to go to work every morning. Thereby, he hopes to save the money he usually spends on motor-taxi services.

loans.use: Purchase of a motorcycle

loans.name: Vigoumidé

texts.fr:
A store owner in her own neighborhood of Djidjolé, Mrs. Vigoumidé K. was born on November 5, 1962 in Anfoin. She has five children to look after as her husband is retired and can no longer provide for the family. Mrs. K. has a small general food store but does not have the means to satisfy the demands of her customers. To supply her store and meet customer demand, Vigoumidé is asking for a loan of $400.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Revendeuse à djidjolé où elle réside, Madame Vigoumidé K. est née le 05 novembre 1962 à anfoin. Elle a 05 enfants à sa charge car son mari en retraite n’arrivait plus à subvenir à tous les besoins de la famille. Madame K. a une boutique d’alimentation générale mais ses moyens ne lui permettent pas de satisfaire la demande des clients. Pour alimenter sa boutique et satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle Vigoumidé sollicite un prêt de $400.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her general food store

loans.name: Rosa's Group

texts.es:
Elvira, Rose and Rosalinda have been associates of the Paradise Communal Bank for 11, 3, 1 year respectively. In their Communal Bank they say that they learned to save and to be more organized, generous, responsible, and punctual.

Elvira is 53 years old and has 2 children. Elvira offers her services as a scribe, creating different documents in a central street of Ayacucho. She has worked doing this for 20 years.

On the other hand, Rose is 50 years old and has 3 children. Rose started selling clothes to order three years ago. She brings her merchandise to Lima and at times to Tacna. Previously she had a grocery store, but she closed it because of low sales.

Rosalinda is 24 years old and has 1 son. Her business is making pretty costume jewelry, like pins, earrings, and rings. She learned to make the jewelry in Lima when she worked with her cousins. Besides the costume jewelry, she sells clothes to order.

Elvira, Rose and Rosalinda need loans of 600 soles, 800 soles and 600 soles, respectively, that will be invested in the purchase of papers, beads of various sizes, handles, hoops, imported stones, polos, jeans, sweaters, and blouses. They will use their savings to finish the second story of their house, to run their businesses, to buy land and for the education of their children.

Elvira, Rose and Rosalinda’s dreams incluD. buying a computer, working on their house, growing their businesses, opening a store of costume jewelry, distributing wholesale, educating their children to be professionals and beginning a new wood sale business.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Elvira, Rosa y Rosalinda son socias del Banco Comunal Paraíso desD. hace 11, 3, 1 año respectivamente. En su Banco Comunal dicen que aprendieron a ser más organizadas, a ser generosas, responsables, puntuales y a ahorrar.

Elvira tiene 53 años y 2 hijos, Elvira presta servicios D. digitación, elabora distintos documentos y lo realiza en una calle céntrica D. Ayacucho, actividad que realiza hace 20años.

Por otro lado Rosa tiene 50 años y 3 hijos, Rosa hace 3 años venD. ropa a pedido. Su mercadería lo trae D. Lima y a veces D. Tacna y anteriormente ella tenía una tienda D. abarrotes y lo cerró porque ya no tenía venta.

Mientras que Rosalinda tiene 24 años y 1 hijo y en su negocio realiza lindos trabajos D. bisutería, como joyas, aretes, anillos, actividad que aprendió en Lima cuando trabajaba con sus primas, además D. la bisutería ella venD. ropa a pedido.

Elvira, Rosa y Rosalinda necesitan préstamos D. 600 soles, 800 soles y 600 soles, que serán invertidos en la compra D. papeles, mostacillas, mostacillones, asas, aros, piedras importadas, polos, jeans, polos, chompas, blusas. Sus ahorros los utilizarán para terminar el segundo piso D. su casa, implementar su negocio, comprar un terreno y para la educación D. sus hijos.

Los sueños D. Elvira, Rosa y Rosalinda son comprar una computadora y trabajar en su casa, tener un negocio mas granD., una tienda D. bisutería y repartir por mayor, sus hijos sean profesionales e implementar un nuevo negocio D. venta D. maderas.

loans.use: To purchase papers, beads of various sizes, handles, hoops, imported stones, polos, jeans, sweaters, and blouses.

loans.name: Katogo A(I) Group

texts.en:
Regina is a 48 year old widow with seven children. Only one child goes to school. Her current business is chicken roasting. Regina sees a business opportunity of starting up her own poultry farm to reduce the costs of buying chicken. She wants to use the extra profits to buy a plot of land and construct as house for orphans. Irene and Jalia sell second hand clothes and want to use the loan to increase stock. Margret has a grocery store while Teo sells raw foods in the market.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more chicken

loans.name: Ayesha's Group

texts.en: My name is Ayesha J. from KRK, Pakistan. This is my birth town and I have spent all my life here in Kot Radha Kishan. I am married and a mother of three: two boys and one girl. Our poor family conditions did not allow us to send our kids to school. I sell milk from my house and own seven dairy cows. I want to buy an additional cow so that our income can increase. I am a group leader of few other women: Sabra B., Suriya B. ,Mahmoodan ,Saeedan B. and  Shakila B. all these women sell milk from their houses and want to buy additional cows. These women have been together for five years and have always helped each other in time of need.

loans.use: Buy an additional cow

loans.name: Rafael Enrique

texts.es:
Rafael M. is a young man who has a business in stockbreeding in the municipality of Achuapa in the city of León in Nicaragua. Since a young age, Rafael was known to be a hard worker in the fields, raising the cattle in order then to commercialize it. Currently, Rafael is single and his only responsibility is to support and provide for his elderly parents.

Despite of the difficult circumstances that Rafael encounters, he managed to find the way to improve the conditions of his home. Rafael acquired a solar panel because his community does not have electric power since it is so far away from the city. To finish paying the solar panel, Rafael has requested the support of Ceprodel, which he hopes will provide him with a loan that will allow him to finish paying the solar panel and therefore, continue to use it for daily home activities.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer

El joven Rafael M. se dedica al negocio de la ganadería en el municipio de Achuapa en la ciudad de León en Nicaragua. Desde su niñez se ha destacado por ser un gran trabajador en el campo criando el ganado para luego comercializarlo. Actualmente este joven esta soltero y solamente tiene la responsabilidad de mantener a sus padres que por ser avanzados en edad necesitan del apoyo de su hijo.

A pesar de las difíciles circunstancias que ha atravesado este joven, ha buscado la manera de cómo mejorar las condiciones de su hogar y para ello ha adquirido un panel solar debido a que en su comunidad no existe energía eléctrica por estar alejada de la ciudad. Para cancelar la deuda ha solicitado apoyo en Ceprodel para cancelar dicha deuda y así darle el uso al panel solar en las actividades diarias de su hogar.

loans.use: To Pay for a Solar Panel for the Home

loans.name: Marsella 1 Group

texts.es:
Dolores is 23 years old and has two children. Along with her husband she has a business making brooms, which she has done for 10 years. She sells her products in nearby cities like Tuxtla, Ixtapa and Bochil. With the loan, she will acquire rolls of plastic and wood since those are the prime materials needed to continue production and increase family income. She belongs to the group "Marsella 1" along with Maria H. Giron, who sells pots, saucepans, cups and plates; Juana P. H., who makes and sells brooms; and Martha H. P., an artisan who makes and embroiders blouses.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

DOLORES TIENE 23 AÑOS, DOS HIJOS. JUNTO CON SU ESPOSO TIENE EL NEGOCIO DE HACER ESCOBAS, UTENSILIO QUE SE UTILIZA PARA EL ASEO DE LAS CASAS. LLEVAS 10 AÑOS CON ESTA ACTIVIDAD Y SUS PRODUCTOS LOS VENDE A LAS CIUDADES CERCANAS COMO TUXTLA, IXTAPA, BOCHIL. CON SU PRESTAMO ADQUIRIRAN ROLLOS DE PLASTICO Y MADERA YA QUE ES LA MATERIA PRIMA PARA CONTINUAR CON LA PRODUCCION Y LA FUENTE DE INGRESO FAMILIAR. PERTENECE AL GRUPO SOLIDARIO LLAMADO MARSELLA 1 JUNTO CON SUS COMPAÑERAS MARIA H. GIRON (VENTA DE OLLAS, CACEROLAS, VASOS, PLATOS), JUANA P. H. (HACE Y VENDE ESCOBAS) Y MARTHA H. P. (ARTESANA, HACE Y BORDA BLUSAS CON TELA DE MANTA).

loans.use: Purchase raw materials / INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE PRODUCTOS COMESTIBLES

loans.name: Sajida's Group

texts.en:
Sajida B., wife of A. S., has been living in a the city of Chichawatni, Pakistan for the last 30 years. She is a mother of six children: four sons and two daughters. All her children are currently attending school. Her husband is a trader while Sajida is a teacher. She gives stitching and embroidery classes to her neighbors on a monthly basis. She would like apply for a loan to expand her husband’s wheat business again. Previously, she successfully completed her first loan that she borrowed from Asasah, a microfinance institute of Pakistan. With her first loan, she bought wheat and earned sufficient profit to buy two sewing machines.

Her loan group includes: Razia B., who wants to start a grocery shop; Bushra B., who wants to expand her grocery shop business; Irshad B., who wants to repair her rickshaw; and Kosar B. who wants to buy seasonal wheat. This loan will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
In the municipality of Sandino, in the city of Managua, Maria Solis works hard at her business making bracelets and other items from leather, which she sells from her home as well as out in the streets. She has put a lot of effort into this work for the last 20 years, as this has been the only way to support herself. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials she needs to continue making her leather goods.

En el municipio de Ciudad Sandino en la ciudad de Managua, la señora Maria S. se dedica arduamente a su negocio de elaboración de fajas y pulseras las cuales las comercializa en su casa de habitación y cuando es necesario desplazarse en las calles de su municipio lo hace con tal de llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación.

Se dedica muy esforzadamente a este negocio desde hace 20 años siendo este su único ingreso para mantener su hogar. Hoy en día acude a CEPRODEL para obtener el crédito para la compra de sus materiales de trabajo como lo es la cuerina, tijeras, pega, etc.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE NECESSARY MATERIALS TO MAKE HER LEATHER GOODS

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Liliana sells cosmetics per catalogue since four years. Rosa also sells clothes upon request; her clients are mostly her neighbors.

She has used the loans she has received to buy cosmetics and clothes. One day she would also like to have a store and sell clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Liliana vende cosméticos por catálogo desde hace 4 años. Ella también se dedica a la venta de ropa por pedidos que sus vecinos le hacen. Los préstamos que ha recibido le han servido para pagar los cosméticos y la ropa que ofrece. A ella le gustaría tener una tienda y vender ropa.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and clothes

loans.name: Maria Amelia

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria Amelia is divorced, 50 years old, and studied social work in school. She never worked in that profession since she got married and took over the housework for her family. Thus, she was never able to receive her professional title. She has four children, two work and two study and she lives in the Trujillo district of Trujillo, Peru.

In order to improve her economic condition, she began selling food but she got sick of that job and decided to switch to selling cosmetics. She had to quit that business since her customers would make orders then not pay; she also sold snacks in a kiosk in the Marcial Acharan high school, but she had to stop there since her suppliers raised prices. Eight months ago, she began selling clothing. She traveled to Lima where her relatives encouraged her to begin selling, and now she sells to her friends and neighbors. She has worked with Manuela Ramos bank for two years and is president of the Jesus Confio en Ti (Jesus I believe in you) Village Bank. She decided to participate in the bank because she was separated from her husband and he refused to pay child support; she began working and with her first $125 loan, she purchased rice, chicken, vegetables, yucca, etc.

With this $425 loan which she will repay in 6 months, she will invest in clothing for children and adults. She hopes to continue working and invest in her own locale for selling clothing and to help her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora María Amelia, es divorciada, tiene 50 años, estudió la carrera D. asistenta social, no ejerce la profesión porque se casó, se dedicó al hogar, además le falta sacar el titulo, tiene 04 hijos, 02 trabajan y 02 estudian, vive en el Distrito D. Trujillo en la Provincia D. Trujillo en el Departamento D. La Libertad. Para ayudarse económicamente, empezó a vender comida, la socia se enfermó del trajín D. hacer el menú, después cambió D. negocio y decidió dedicarse a la venta D. productos cosméticos, pero dejó el negocio porque los clientes hacían pedidos y no cancelaban, también vendía golosinas en un kiosco en el colegio Marcial Acharan pero se retiró porque subieron los precios. Hace 08 meses se dedica a vender ropa, la socia viajó a Lima, donD. los familiares la animaron a vender, ahora ella venD. a los vecinos y amigos. Tiene 02 años trabajando con Manuela Ramos, es presidenta del Banco Comunal “JESUS EN TI CONFIO II”, ella decidió participar en este Banco porque se había separado D. su esposo, y como el no le pasaba el sustento para sus hijos, entonces decidió dedicarse al negocio y con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 que recibió compró arroz, pollo, verduras, yuca, etc. Con este préstamo D. S/. 1200.00 que cancelará en 06 meses, tiene pensado invertir en la compra D. ropa para niños y adultos. La empresaria sueña con seguir trabajando, invertir en un local para tener un negocio D. ropa y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Purchase of items of clothing

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is 40 years old. She is a widow with 3 children aged 22, 14 and 4 years old. She has been a clothes and coconut seller since 2006. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

Maryam is now seeking a loan to buy more clothes and coconuts to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and coconuts to improve her business

loans.name: Zikrillo

texts.ru: Факиров Зикрилло проживает в районе Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 49 лет. Женат и имеет одиннадцать детей. Занимается сельским хозяйством. Имеет участок земли . Сеет пшеницу и картофель. Полученный урожай продает на рынке . Часть урожая оставляет себе. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 10 лет. Планирует подготовиться к посевному сезону и получить кредит для покупки семян и удобрений. Полгасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Zikrillo F. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi region. He is 49 years old, married and has eleven children. He owns a plot of land where he raises wheat and potatoes and then sells his harvest at the local market. Zikrillo keeps some of the harvest for himself to feed his large family. He has been working as a farmer for the last 10 years. Zikrillo is getting ready for the planting season and wants to take out a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer. He is planning to pay back the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Sergio Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. A. U. habita en la Cmca. La Peña, casado, con 2 hijos, su esposa Gloria Gomez se dedica a la atencion del hogar y sus dos hijos pequeños y garantiza la alimentacion a su marido,  don Sergio se dedica a la siembra de arroz secano, y desde muy temprano atiene su cultivo de 5 Mzs de arroz; es socio de la cooperativa agropecuaria La Esperanza y a traves de esta tiene la oportunidad de ser asociado en el montaje de un trillo de arroz que le permitira obtener mayores ingresos para el sustento familiar; su mayor anhelo es alcanzar un ingreso adicional para el bienestar de la familia en el futuro.
texts.en:
Señor A. U. lives in la Cmca. in La Peña. He is married with two children. His wife, Gloria Gomez, is a housewife, raises their two young children, and prepares food for her husband. Don Sergio grows dry rice and attends to his 5 manzanas (8.65 acres) of land starting very early in the morning. He is a member of the agricultural cooperative "La Esperanza." Through this, he has the opportunity to collaborate in assembling a rice thresher that will let him make more income to sustain his family. His biggest dream is to make additional email for his family's future well-being.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To support 30% of the construction of a rice thresher in La Peña

loans.name: Bouran

texts.en:
Bouran, 33, lives in Bourj el Barajneh, a southern suburb of Lebanon, with her husband and their three children. She has been selling cleaning products and seasonA. food merchandise for four years. Bouran is requesting a loan of $800US from A. Majmoua in order to purchase more merchandise for her shop and to pay school tuition fees. This is the first time that she has asked for a loan.

The loan will help her improve her family's income. She has a good reputation because of her honesty and the way she treats her clients. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. Bouran decided to open her business because her family needed more income.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her shop and pay school tuition fees.

loans.name: Folole

texts.en: Folole T., 38, is married and has six children.  She has many years experience in selling shop stocks to the villagers and public people six days per week.  Her husband is also working, and he helps out with the family and the shop business.  Folole has had three previous loans with SPBD, which are her only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.  She plans to purchase items to restock her shop.

loans.use: Purchase items to restock shop

loans.name: Liliey Julia

texts.es:
La señora Julia es socia del Banco Comunal “Sacuyo”, del sector II, de la comunidad de Sacuyo, distrito de Acora, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno; de  39 años de edad, tiene dos  hijos, es madre soltera y posee estudios de primaria completa.
Trabaja hace poco tiempo con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, se dedica a comprar y vender animales menores (cuyes) y vender sus quesos, la venta lo hace en las ferias del mercado; su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, ella invirtió en la alimentación de sus animales, compro platos cerámicos, gazaperas y otros.
Con este préstamo de S/ 500.00, el cual cancelará en 3 cuotas, ella invertirá en la compra de semillas  (cebada, alfalfa), alimento (afrecho, concentrado, etc.), comprará más cuyes para aumentar su producción y obtener buenas ganancias; Ella agradece a Manuela Ramos por su confianza, ya que le permitió mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the "Sacuyo" communal bank, in section II of the town of Sacuyo, district of Acora, province and department of Puno. She is 39 years old, has two children, is a single mother and completed primary school. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for a short time. She buys and sells small animals (guinea pigs) and sells cheese. She makes her sales at the markets. Her first loan was for S/. 500 new soles, which she invested in food for her animals, bought feed dishes, cages and other goods. With this loan for S/. 500, which will be repaid in 3 installments, she will invest in the purchase of seeds (barley, alfalfa), feed (brans and mixed grains), and will buy more guinea pigs to increase her production and make a good profit. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for their trust, which has allowed her to improve her family´s standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds and food for small animals (guinea pigs).

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es: Domitila tiene 33 años, es casada, vive en su casa propia con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Se dedica a la venta de golosinas y bebidas de todas las variedades en un pequeño local construido por su esposo, esta labor la realiza desde hace 5 años atrás. Le gusta mucho su trabajo porque la mantiene activa y conoce a muchas personas, además le es muy rentable porque su negocio se encuentra ubicado cerca de un colegio y tiene ingresos diarios que provienen, en su mayoría de los colegiales. Más adelante Domitila quiere llegar a tener su minimarket. Ya son 2 veces que recibe un préstamo con MFP, por lo que se ha comprometido a ser puntual en sus cuotas de devolución. Con el dinero que solicita quiere mandar a ampliar su negocio y ambientarlo mucho mejor para verse más presentable ante sus clientes, también comprará más golosinas y bebidas gaseosas.
texts.en:
Domitila is 33 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and two children in a house she owns. She sells candies and refreshments of all kinds in a small locale made by her husband. She has had this business for five years. She enjoys her work very much because it keeps her busy and she meets many people. In addition, the business is very profitable because it is located near a high school. Most of her sales are to students. In the future, Domitila would like to have a convenience store. This is her second loan from MFP; she is committed to repaying the loan on time. She will use the loan to expand her business and give it a better atmosphere so that it will be more attractive to her customer; she will also buy more candies and soft drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise to resell

loans.name: Lupu

texts.en: A. and Lidia have 2.5 hectares of arable land that they use for agricultural production. The cereals that they harvest are used for rearing pigs. They currently have 2 pigs, and expect to buy 4 piglets for fattening. In the future, A. and Lidia intend to increase the number of animals they raise, which is the purpose of the loan. They sell the meat in the meat market in the town of Causeni. Besides working at home, A. works in construction.

loans.use: To increase the number of animals they raise

loans.name: Los Fuertes 1, 2 And 3 Group

texts.en:
This Kiva loan will be for a full Bank of Hope with a total of 15 members. This will be their first loan with Esperanza International. They are all looking forward to starting or reinforcing their business activities. Expanding their businesses represents a challenge for them; in their own words, "the economy is not good and not proper for most businesses". However, they remain optimistic and are willing to work hard.

The coordinators for the three groups of five are Ligne L., Emilia M., and Wilson F.. The three of them are in sales but each sells a different item: Ligne sells vegetables, Emilia sells hair extensions and weaves, and Wilson sells clothes. Emilia and Wilson are parents. Emilia has an 8-year-old child and Wilson's child is 9 years old. They all have a common dream: own a house one day.

Please help us support this new group of entrepreneurs. Thank you!

loans.use: stock or re-stock their business inventory

loans.name: Ascencia

texts.es:
La señora Ascencia es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres trabajando por el desarrollo“, en el distrito de Cabanilla, de la provincia de Lampa, departamento de Puno, ella tiene 50 años de edad, es casada, y tiene 07 hijos, ella posee estudios de secundaria incompleta (primer grado). 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace pocos años, actualmente ella se dedica a la elaboración de panes (panadería), ella socia nueva por ello viene solicitando un préstamo nuevo de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que piensa pagar en 06 cuotas, con dicho préstamo ella podrá adquirir insumos y materiales para seguir elaborando panes para distribuir a las tiendas de su zona. Su deseo mas grande es seguir creciendo en su negocio y ver profesionales a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ascencia C. P. is a member of the Communal Bank "Women Working for Development ," of the Cabanilla district, in the Lampa province, department of Puno. She is 50 years old, married, and has 7 children. Her education is incomplete, having only completed first grade. She’s been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for only a few years. Her business is a bakery, where she sells loaves of bread. She is requesting a new loan of 500 soles ($175), and she plans to pay it in 6 installments. With this loan she will be able to acquire supplies and materials to continue baking loaves of bread to distribute to the stores in her zone. Her greatest desire is to keep expanding her business and to see her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Lisette Artiga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies for her bakery.

loans.name: Samir

texts.en:
Samir S. is an educated young man with full experience. He has a spare-parts shop where he works. He has been working in this business for a long time and has a good number of customers. He has a small business but when he got his first loan he completed his stock and then continued his business with more success and he is still working.

Now he has requested a second loan to enlarge his shop and involve one of his sons in the business. Therefore, he wants to work hard to make a better future for all his family, especially for the son who works with him. He is sure that he can further his business with more success and he was really happy about this process of small loans in Jalalabad, Afghanistan.

loans.use: To enlarge his shop and involve one of his sons in the business

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina has owned a small grocery store in the Kihesa neighborhood of Iringa for twenty years. She belongs to Ngome north group loan (Group code 2032). She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $80. Every day she works at her business for four hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more local beer for her business. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Amina is married, and has five children: ages 36, 34, 23, 12 and 9. She also cares for three additional dependents.

loans.use: To buy more local beer for resale

loans.name: Buki

texts.en: F. buys refrigerators from the manufacturer at a discount and sells retail.  She has been in this business since 2007 and needs a loan of N140,000 to increase her inventory.  F. is 45 years old, married and has three children. She says thank you.

loans.use: Purchase refrigerators to sell.

loans.name: José Raúl

texts.es: José Raúl A. de 41 años de edad reside en Ciudad Arce junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo. El posee una ladrillería desde hace muchos años y es un experto en la elaboración de ladrillos, es por esto que posee muchos clientes. José solícita un préstamo para poder comprar materia prima como tierra negra y tierra blanca y leña para la elaboración de ladrillos. José es una persona muy entusiasta que anhela brindarle todo lo mejor a su familia y es por ellos que él obtiene las fuerzas necesarias para trabajar arduamente.
texts.en:
41-year-old José Raúl A. lives in Ciudad Arce with his life partner and son.
He has owned a brick-making business for many years and is an expert brickmaker. This is why he has many customers. José is requesting a loan to purchase raw materials like black soil, white soil and wood to make the bricks.
José is a very enthusiastic person who wishes to give his family the best. They give him the strength to work hard.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Brick-making materials

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Ndung'u

texts.en:
Ndung'u N. is a married businessman with two children. He owns a carpentry shop at the Kangemi Shopping Center in a middle- and low-income estate on the outskirts of the city of Nairobi. He has been running the business for the past seven years and now makes a monthly profit of about 7,500 Kenyan shillings (about $95).

Ndung'u plans to use this loan as working capital to buy raw materials for his workshop. He learned about KADET through his friends who are also members of his borrowing group at KADET. Ndung'u hopes to grow his business and to eventually be able to buy more of his own tools, such as a circular saw.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To obtain working capital to buy raw materials for carpentry.

loans.name: Nakalama C 1 Tamubula Jemia Group

texts.en: Jemia T. is 40 years old, married with seven children all attending school, and she looks after three orphans who are also in school. For ten years she has had a business buying and selling matooke (bananas). She is using the loan to purchase bunches of matooke (bananas) in much more volume for sale. The loan is also adding capital to her business in improving the stock. She is encouraging and a hardworking businesswoman whose dream is prospering.

loans.use: To purchase bunches of matooke (bananas) for sale

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
Armando J. is from the village of Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. He is 46 years old. Armando is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Armando owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing electronic repairs in the local community. Armando has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Armando joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Armando has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC. Armando is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Armando from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide electronic repairs in the local community

loans.name: Chisley

texts.es:
La señora Chisley, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Valerosas II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 30 años y es madre de 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

Hace 03 años, que Chisley decidió vender sus anticuchos en una esquina de su casa, ella nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas ventas, por la sazón rica que le da a sus preparados y muy buena acogida. 
En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con su trabajo que realiza día a día, a partir de las 5:00 de la tarde, esta preparada para atender a sus clientes, con una sonrisa alegre y con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,000.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como: arroz y azúcar en kilos; aceites en paquetes, pollos en javas y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Chisley, se siente muy bien con el trabajo que realiza, nos cuenta que tiene muchos sueños y metas en su vida, como implementar su propio restaurant en un local muy bien acondicionado y al mismo tiempo agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en iniciar su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Chisley is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Valerosas II” (Courageous Women II), which is located in the District of Tarapoto, Province of San Martín, Department of San Martín. She is 30 years old, in a common law marriage, and has 2 dependent children.

Three years ago, she decided to sell “anticuchos” on the corner outside of her house. She tells us that sales have been good and that her food has been well-received because of its rich flavor and careful preparation. She continues with her business and is very pleased with the work she does every day. Chisley begins serving at 5pm and welcomes her customers with a cheerful smile and a charismatic personality.

With her loan of 2000 soles, she will buy supplies for her daily food preparation such as rice and sugar in kilos, oil, cases of chickens, as well as utensils that will keep her business running and help her provide better service to her customers.

Chisley feels very good about her business. She tells us that she has many dreams and goals in life, such as opening a restaurant in good condition. She thanks Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for preparing food

loans.name: Kpatikomai Group

texts.en:
Kpatikomai is a group of 5 borrowers led by Jusu J. M., who is 28 years old. He has completed high school and is preparing for university, while taking care of his 6 year-old son and a nephew at the same time. Jusu lives in Vai Town, Monrovia, Liberia. His community is very crowded and has a high poverty rate, which pushes the residents to get involved in many different means of generating income.

Jusu is in the garment business. He buys textiles, sews clothes and sells the clothes to the residents of Vai Town. In seventh grade, Jusu struggled to learn how to how to sew but since he started to sew on his own, he has been creating quality designs.

Jusu wants to eventually buy a piece of land on which he can build a home and a business storefront. He also dreams of having a well plan and established family. Jusu needs the loan to buy more sewing materials to continue his garment business.

loans.use: To purchase more materials to expand business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of wheat flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of motor oil and oxydized iron for resale

loans.name: Llerme

texts.es:
La señora Llerme, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Luchadoras”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San de Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 45 años y es madre de 03 hijos, todos ya independientes. 

Llerme, juntamente con su esposo, decidieron acondicionar algunos ambientes de su casa, para el alquiler mensual de habitaciones, la cual el servicio los brinda a estudiantes y conocidos que llegan de otros lugares para quedarse a trabajar en el Distrito de Tarapoto. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio y cuenta con 05 habitaciones. Además, se dedica a la venta de plastiquería y se traslada por  diferentes pueblos aledaños, cerca de la Cuidad.

Con este préstamo de S/ 3,000.00, comprará ladrillos, cementos, triplay, para la construcción de mas habitaciones. Parte del dinero, también lo invertirá en la compra de accesorios, para los baños, para mejorar el servicio e higiene,  de esa mañera sus inquilinos queden   satisfechos y contentos.

Llerme, se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Llerme belongs to the “Mujeres Luchadoras” ("Fighting Women") Community Bank in the district of Tarapoto, province of San Martin, Peru. She is a 45-year-old mother of three children, all grown up, and lives with her partner. Llerme, along with her husband, decided to set up some rooms to rent by the month out of their home, offering the service to students and acquaintances from other places looking to stay and work in Tarapoto. They have stuck with the business and currently have five rooms for rent. Furthermore, Llerme works selling plastics and travels to the different towns surrounding her city. With the loan of 3,000 soles she is requesting, she plans to purchase bricks, cement and plywood to build more rooms. She'll also use part of the money to buy accessories for the bathrooms to provide better service and hygiene. In this way her tenants will remain satisfied and content. Llerme feels very accomplished and has a strong desire to reach and fulfill her other dreams. She is thankful to Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for its help in starting her business and helping the many other women who want to grow their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to build rooms to rent

loans.name: Tauilo

texts.en:
Tauilo S. is a 40-year-old woman living in the town of Falealupo. She is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Tauilo owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting fruits & vegetables for sale. Tauilo has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 400 WST a month from these activities.

In 2008, Tauilo joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tauilo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Tauilo is now requesting a new loan of 1500 WST which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Tauilo plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay tuition fees for her children.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Marlene es una mujer muy activa y trabajadora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 38 años, es madre de tres hijos(2 de ellos mayores de edad) y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es pescador.
Marlene se  dedica al alquiler de botes de pesca, actividad que realiza en el puerto de Yarina Cocha.
Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Tigresas” desde hace ocho años y el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles los que utilizò en la compra de hielo para la conservación de los pescados que luego fueron vendidos a diferentes mercados.
Actualmente necesita un crédito de 3000.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà insumos para la pesca. La meta de Marlene es tener una tienda de abarrotes en general y seguir apoyando en la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Marlene is an active and hardworking woman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa, in the Ucayali region. She is 38 years old and the mother of three children (two of them grown).

Marlene’s business is renting fishing boats in the port of Yarina Cocha. She has been a member of the “Las Tigresas” [Lady Tigers] Communal Bank for 8 years. Her first loan, for 300 soles, was used to purchase ice to chill fish that she sold at various markets. Now she is seeking a loan of 3000 soles to buy fishing supplies. Her goal is to have a grocery store, and to continue supporting the education of her children.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fishing supplies

loans.name: Lili

texts.en:
Lili T. is 37 and married with 2 children (ages 6 and 9).  She owns & operates a business venture, selling food stuffs and other goods.  She has 3 years of experience in this business.    Lili needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase new equipment & tools to expand the business.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 260 talas or US $108 per week) to make improvements to her house.

In 2007, Lili joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Lili's 3rd loan with SPBD. 

Overall Social Metric Score for Lili T.:*               1.4 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.4 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.4 out of 3

 *SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase new equipment & tools to expand the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional clothes for her business.

loans.name: Vy

texts.en:
Mrs. Vy B. is 23 years old and she lives in Khvav village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land for cultivating rice. 

Her husband, Mr. Bros Pov Lorn, is a battery-seller who earns a small income to support the couple. They have no children. 

Since her husband's business is going well, Vy wants to expand it to increase their income and improve their standard of living. She decided to ask for a loan to buy more batteries to sell. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more batteries for selling

loans.name: Leonel

texts.es:
Nuestro socio Leonel,  pertenece al banco comunal  “NUEVA VISION DE URUBAMBA”, nuestro socio está ubicado en el corazón del valle sagrado de los inkas, Urubamba está a 1 hora 10 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestro socio  tiene 36 años y tiene 2 hijos (14, 3) es conviviente y se dedica al comercio minorista, nuestro socio antes se dedicaba a la venta de ropa que traía desde Lima, ahora el socio cría pollos y los vende de maduros, el socio dice que este negocio nuevo le será rentable porque estudió todo el mercado y ya tiene compradores. Nuestro socio desea el préstamo para comprar pollos.

Nuestro socio agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Leonel is a member of the Communal Bank “Nueva Vision de Urubamba” (New Vision of Urubamba). He lives in the heart of the Sacred Valley of the Incas in Urubamba, located an hour and ten minutes away from the city of Cusco.

Leonel is 36 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two children (ages 14 and 3). He has a small business in which he sells clothing shipped in from Lima. Now he wants to raise chickens and sell them when they mature. Leonel says this new business will be profitable because he has studied the market and has already lined up buyers. He is requesting a loan in order to buy chickens.

Leonel is appreciative of this opportunity and promises to make his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chickens to raise

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian E., 60, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She is married to Alfredo E., a school utility personnel, and they are blessed with four children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn money so that their family can have a better life. She has been selling Filipino rice cake delicacies for several years.

Lilian has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow three times in CCT’s Cooperative. She has been consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed as added ingredients for her food vending business. Her business lets her earn a profit of PHP 3,900 per month.

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 8,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying key ingredients for her food vending business.

She dreams that her business will grow for a better life in the future.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy key ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Mrs. Kosal Penh Village Bank Group

texts.en:
In Chheu Teal village in Kandal province are 19 people who make up a village bank loan. The members will use their loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Kosal P. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members. She is a mother of 4 children, three of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory, and the other attends the local public school

She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice that she sells to support her family’s living. Her husband, Mr. Loch Khut, is a construction worker and aside from this he is also a fisherM.. Although they try to work hard with their careers, they earn little income and do not have enough to buy supplies for fishing.

Thus Mrs. Kosal P. decided to apply for a loan to buy fish nets and a boat to find fish.

loans.use: To buy fishnets and a boat to find fish.

loans.name: Arnela

texts.en:
Arnela O. is from the village of Brgy. 24, Gingoog City. She is 28 years old and married. To make a living, Arnela runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Arnela has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately $200 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Arnela joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arnela has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Arnela is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: God Will Make A Way Group

texts.en: Annie T. is the leader of this group of five borrowers called God Will Make A Way Group. In the photo, she is the one holding the sign. She is 51 years old and is single with six children who range from 11 to 36 years old. She also cares for two siblings. She could not continue her education through 5th grade due to the death of her sponsor. Annie started by selling jewelry but decided to put her money into the food business. For twenty-three years Annie has been running her mini-restaurant at the Carey Street Snapper Hill, downtown Monrovia, Liberia. Annie gives her food good preparation in order to encourage customers to continue buying her food. Her goal and dream is to expand her business to a bigger size. Annie plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar potion of the group loan of 26,000 Liberian dollars to buy additional rice and oil to serve her customers. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating micro-finance institution with thirteen branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women. Join the Team LEAP - Liberia lending team on Kiva today!

loans.use: To buy additional rice and oil for her mini-restaurant

loans.name: Sophat

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophat S. (shown in the photo) and her husband Mr. Morn Meu, have been married since 1984 and have five children: two sons and three daughters. Two of them are married and live outside the family home, one daughter is a garment factory worker, one son has full-time employment and another one attends school. The family lives on an Island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sophat is a silk weaver. Her husband has been a boat repairer in the village for more than two years. She is asking for a loan in the amount of $350 to purchase a motorbike for her son to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her son to drive to work.

loans.name: Melody

texts.en: Melody B. is from the village of San Jose. She is 52 years old, is married, and has two adult children. Melody owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over thirty years and earns approximately 50,000 PHP when she sells her harvested palay (rice). In 2006, Melody joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Melody is requesting a new loan of 31,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This loan will be her eighth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria tiene 42 años, vive con sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Hace mas de 8 años posee una tienda, instalada en su misma casa, en donde sus hijos la apoyan en la atención. Disfruta mucho su trabajo, por que le permite  tener sus propias ganancias y poder disponerlas en los diversos gastos de su hogar y también porque le gusta atender a su clientela. Durante este tiempo de  experiencia ha visto las buenas rentas que le han generado por lo que quiere tener una tienda mucho más amplia y abastecida de mayor variedad de mercadería. Es la tercera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, es muy responsable con sus pagos y agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de mercadería para abastecer su tienda.
texts.en:
Gloria is 42 years old and lives with her 3 children in her own house. For more than 8 years she has had a store in her home where her children have helped to look after the business. She enjoys her work very much because it allows her to have her own earnings and enables her to put it towards the various household expenses. She also likes to serve her customers. During this time, she has generated good revenues, so much that she wants to expand her business and stock her store with a wider variety of merchandise. This is the third time that she is going to receive credit from MFP. She is very responsible with her payments. She thanks the people that will be providing her with her loan request because it will be very useful for her in the advancement of her business. With the credit she is seeking, she will purchase merchandise to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Dina Bach, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to stock her store

loans.name: Peter

texts.fr:
Monsieur Tuyishime Peter est un jeune de 25 ans, qui est née dans le district de Rubavu de l’ancienne ville de Gisenyi en province de l’Ouest. Il est célibataire, il vit avec ses parents il a un diplôme de niveau A2 en informatique de gestion.
Informaticien qui a monté un Studio de musique pour graver les CD, DVD, VCD de musique et films. Son IMF est Amasezerano COmmunity Banking sa.
Il prend un prêt aujourd’hui pour acheter un outil de musique appelé SOUND CARD pour élever la capacité de son studio et améliorer les qualités de ses services ainsi satisfaire les clients. C’est son premier prêt, il veut à la longue prendra un prêt pour le minerval car il compte étudier l’université l’an prochain 2011, en faculté de computer science ou informatique de gestion car ils sont des facultés promu par le gouvernement Rwandais, il pourra aussi se marier et avoir des enfants par les épargnes continuelles qu'il effectu.
texts.en:
Mr. Tuyishime Peter is a young man of 25 who was born in the Rubavu district of the old city Gisenyi, Western Province. He is single and lives with his parents. He has a level A2 diploma in administrative data processing. A computer specialist, he has created a music studio to burn CDs, DVDs, and VCDs, both music and films. His microfinance institution is Amasezerano Community Banking S.A. He is seeking a loan to buy a sound card to raise the capacity of his studio and improve his quality of service, in order to satisfy his customers. This is his first loan. Over the long term he would like a loan to pay his tuition fees. He plans to study at the university next year (2011), either computer science or administrative data processing. These are the departments encouraged by the Rwandan government. He would also be able to marry and have children thanks to his regular savings.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a sound card to burn CDs, VCDs, and DVDs

loans.name: Pamela Atieno

texts.en:
Pamela Atieno B., 34, is married and has five children. She started a shoe-vending business in 2003 in Nambale, even though she lives in Lwanyange. This was due to increasing economic demand and, as a housewife, she could not salvage the situation since the family size was also increasing and her husband alone could not afford all the family's basic needs. As a result of influence from friends and easy accessibility to shoe supply points, she opted to start this venture. 

She tells how motivating the business is because of the returns, but her desire to expand it further isn't possible due to inadequate capital. That is why she requested a loan worth 8,000 Kenyan shillings to improve her stock level to enable her to realize a high income and to acquire land for extensive agriculture.

loans.use: Boost the business

loans.name: Naboth

texts.en:
A. Naboth is 28 years old and married with three children. He has operated a boda-boda business in Bwamba for four years now. (A boda-boda is a cycle or motorcycle fitted with a tailor-made seat over the rear wheel).

Naboth says that it is the good service that he offers that has helped to increase and retain his customers. He says that his customers are from the local community and most of them are repeat customers and he is able to make 300,000 shillings as monthly profits. He also has a banana plantation from which he is able to produce food both for sale and for home consumption.

Naboth needs a loan to be able to buy a new motorcycle and this will increase his income base. He says that before becoming a boda-boda operator, he was a contractor working for people and now he is grateful that he owns his own business and hopes to increase the number of motorcycles for increased benefits.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle for increased income

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita B. is from Barangay Inaban, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 39 years old. Perlita is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Perlita owns & operates a business selling fruits and vegetables to the local community. Perlita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Perlita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Perlita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Perlita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Brgy. Inaban, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca O. is from the town of Bunawan. She is 54 years old. Francisca is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Francisca plants and harvests rice for sale. Francisca wishes for her business to grow so she works hard to achieve her dream.

Francisca joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Francisca has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Francisca is requesting a new loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP), which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda T. is from the village of Bato. She is 53 years old. Erlinda is married and has 1 adult-aged child. To make a living, Erlinda owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community.
