Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Erlinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 10th loan taken out by Erlinda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KUKULI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Maria Luisa; ella tiene 24 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesanías como chompas, aretes, collares y bolsos, la socia atiende desde las 10:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar su negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería para la tienda. 


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The borrower is a member of the "Kukuli" loan group, located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco. 

Maria Luisa is 24 years old, lives with her partner and has 2 children. Alongside her daily activities she sells crafts such as sweaters, earrings, necklaces and handbags from 10am to 9pm. She would like to expand her business and is requesting a loan to buy merchandise for her shop.

She would like to thank those helping her with her dream through this, and she is committed to repaying the loan in the agreed terms.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her shop.

loans.name: Cornelia's Group

texts.en: Cornelia B. raises hogs to sell. She is 53 years old, married and has two grown-up children. She is from the village of Minlasag, Sibutad. Cornelia has been in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2008, Cornelia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Cornelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Cornelia is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her third loan from PMPC. Cornelia is the leader of a two member group accessing a loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group member if she is delinquent or defaults. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for hog raising

loans.name: Erica

texts.en:
Erica is a widow with two daughters. She owns a small store selling food items like bread, baked goods, candies and so on. The monthly profit averages to $508.

Erica has been in this business for eight years. There is very little competition in the neighboring area. Erica knows her clients well and offers them what they need or ask for.

Erica would like to borrow 6,500 UAH to increase her working capital. She hopes to make additional profit and improve her living conditions. Erica lives with her younger daughter in a small apartment.

loans.use: to increase her working capital

loans.name: Josephene

texts.en:
Thirty-nine-year-old Josephene is a married mother of 2 children ages 18 and 22. Her youngest child is currently attending school. 

She is a farmer from Nyamira town in western Kenya. She has been farming for twenty years and employs 3 farmhands. Her farm produces maize, sorghum, milk and tea which she sells locally. She mainly depends on the income from her farm to cater for the basic needs of her family. 

Her major challenge has been unpredictable weather conditions, especially dry spells which destroy her crops.

Josephene has requested this loan of 45,000KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help her pay school fees for her child. In the future, she plans to start a poultry project and expand her dairy farming.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Odonchimeg

texts.en:
Odonchimeg Y. is 29 years old and lives with her parents and brother in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent (also known as a "yurt"). 

Since 2006, she has been operating a computer and printer, as well as billiard services in the basement of an apartment building. After years of successful operation, her working capital has exceeded to 2,500,000 MNT, includes her business equipments and tools, and her daily average income is 40,000 MNT. 

Odonchimeg hopes in the future to expand her business and have her own work place. She is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase necessary equipment for her service in order to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to increase her working capital

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es: Juan José Ortiz M. cuenta con un negocio de Abarrotes y pollo frito desde hace 14 años denominado “Abarrotes Ortiz”  donde ya han tomado su clientela que esta satisfecha con el servicio brindado. El negocio es la fuente de ingresos para cubrir los gastos para seguir trabajando en esto necesitan comprar mas mercancía para incrementar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Juan José Ortiz M. has owned a business for 14 years called “Abarrotes Ortiz” where he sells groceries and fried chicken. His customers are satisfied with the service he provides.

This business provides a source of income to cover the expenses. To continue working, he needs to buy more merchandise so that he can increase his earnings.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise

loans.name: San Blas Group

texts.es:
SanBlas se denomina el excelente grupo D. mujeres conformado en  Capiata en fecha 18 D. noviembre D. 2009, gracias a que la actual Directora General la Sra.  Antoliana F. quien se dedica a la venta D. mercaderías, contactó con la asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía en la zona, para enterarse D. la forma D. trabajo que tiene el Comité D. Mujeres Emprendedoras, una vez asesorada acerca del Programa logró juntar a 13 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 1° cicL., en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro sel programa.
Todas trabajan con muchas ganas y una D. ellas es la señora Adelaida, una mujer muy trabajadora y que lucha diariamente por el bien D. su familia. 
Ella se dedica a la venta D. aceite D. comer, cuenta con mercaderías D. varios tipos y variedad. 
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra D. aceite en gran cantidad.
texts.en:
SanBlas is the name of this excellent group of women which was founded in Capiata on November 18th, 2009.  The current general manager Antoliana F., who sells merchandise, contacted a Fundación Paraguaya advisor during a weekly meeting that she was giving in her area, to find out about how the Enterprising Women's Committee program worked.  Once she had been advised about the program, she managed to gather together 13 women who are now working very happily on their first loan cycle, in a united and supportive way, within the program.

All of the women work enthusiastically and one of them is Adelaida.  Adelaida is a very hard-working woman who works hard every day for the well-being of her family.  She mainly sells cooking oil but has various types and varieties of merchandise.  She is requesting a loan to buy oil in large quantities.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil in large quantities

loans.name: Mongolmaa

texts.en:
Mongolmaa B. is 27 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in Tuv Province in Central Mongolia.  She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent.  Her husband works as a construction worker for a local company since 2008 and earns monthly salary of 200,000 MNT during summer months. 

Mongolmaa operates a consumer goods trading business out of a rented stall at a local trade center.  She sells a variety of common household goods to her customers.  She started her business in 2008 after working for a private company for several years.  Based on her many years of business experience that was gained by helping her mother's grocery trading business, she has quickly established herself in the local business community. 

Her earnings have enabled her to provide for her family and decorate her home.  For the future, she hopes to build her own house for her family.  Mongolmaa is a modest and hard working person and says, "My main goal is to expand and enlarge my stall where I sell my products."  She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to enlarge her current stall at the market.

loans.use: To enlarge her current stall at the market.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “BANCO DEL DESARROLLO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco. 

La socia es la Sra. Eva; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de bar, ella vende gaseosas y cervezas, ella trabaja desde las 4:00 p.m hasta las 12:00 p.m y por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el servicio de bar. La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar el bar.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Eva belongs to the community bank "Banco del Desarrollo" ["Development Bank"].  The bank is located in the district, province, and state of Cusco. 

Eva is 40 years old, is married, and has 2 children.  She alternates her daily activities with managing her bar, where she sells soft drinks and beer.  She works from 4:00 p.m to 12:00 a.m.  Through the income generated from this business, Eva is helping her children get ahead.  Eva wants to expand and improve her bar service, and is requesting this loan to do so.

Eva is thankful for the loan and promises to comply with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: The member is requesting this loan to expand and improve her bar

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina M. is from the village of San Roque, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 38 years old. Cristina is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Cristina owns and operates a seafood business where she sells fish like kitob, budburon and matang baka. Cristina has been engaged in her business for more than seven years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month. In the picture, she is operating her business in a public wet market.

In 2008, Cristina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Cristina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 16,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Cristina is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell like sardines and milk fish. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Cristina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.
 
About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Yeison Alexis

texts.es:
Llegar a tener una gran empresa es el sueño de Yeison Alexis Díaz P., un joven emprendedor que al lado de su familia aprendió el oficio de la Confección el cual debido a la falta de oportunidades lo convirtió en su fuente de ingresos. 

A sus 26 años, Yeison confecciona diferentes tipos de prenda por encargos y a pesar de que en algunas ocasiones sus clientes se retrazan en los pagos, es así como este joven se gana la vida. 

Yeison necesita de un préstamo para comprar algunas herramientas para sus máquinas y adquirir algunos insumos, esto se convertirá en una oportunidad para mejorar sus procesos, hacer más rápido la producción y generar un incremento en sus ventas debido a la capacidad de respuesta para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Coming to have a large business is Yeison Alexis D. Perez's dream. He is a young enterprising man who learned the business of tailoring from his family. Due to the lack of employment opportunities this business became his source of income. 

At 26 years of age, Yeison makes various types of clothing as special orders are placed. And even though sometimes his clients fall behind on their payments he is still able to earn a living. 

Yeison requires a loan to purchase certain tools for his machines and to purchase some materials. This will translate into an opportunity to improve his work, increasing the production rate and generate an increased level of sales given the improved ability to respond to his clients.

loans.use: To purchase materials and tools.

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion M. is from the village of Centro 1, Mallig, Isabela. She is 44 years old. Consolacion is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Consolacion owns & operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Consolacion has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Consolacion joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Consolacion has successfully repaid a previous loan of 35,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Consolacion is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Consolacion from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mao S., 59, lives in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. She is a housewife and her husband makes a living by selling firewood. He earns about $6 a day, and the family spends $83 a month on food and $35 on other necessities. S. is applying for a loan of $600 to repair the family car, which her husband uses to transport firewood. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to repair a car

loans.name: Aires

texts.en:
Aires is 28 years old.  She is married and has 2 children.  With both her children in school, Aires works very hard to provide for them.

Aires runs a general store in the Philippines.   She has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, rice, canned goods, etc. 

Aires has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell.   In the future, Aires would like to expand her business to secure the future for her family.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard lives with his family of four children, ages 11 and 1 years old, in Litein Town in South Rift Kenya where he does his farming.  He produces maize and milk. He has been farming for 5 years and gets additional income from employment as a driver.

Benard has requested for a loan of 50,000 KES to enable him purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says he hopes to generate enough income to educate his children about the dairy business. He is also focusing on having at least five quality dairy cows.

Benard would not mention any challenges since he believes the ones existing are surmountable.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Denny Maribel

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María José se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Denny, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos, dos de ellos ya son mayores de edad y dos de 12 y 4  años los mismos que estudian en colegio y  kínder. El marido es comerciante. 

Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que para ayudarle a su esposo realiza el crédito para el negocio de él, el mismo que tiene un puesto en el mercado de Portoviejo donde vende frutas y legumbres, trabaja de martes a domingos ya que los lunes se dedica a descansar del trabajo diario, el se desplaza a las 05h00 hasta el mercado mayoristas a surtirse de los mejores productos para luego llevarlos hasta su local y venderles a sus clientes, ella nos cuentas que su marido lleva cerca de 20 años en este tipo de negocio.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar frutas de todo tipo, legumbres y verduras.  Lleva en el Banco Comunal siete años  y le gusta porque  con estos créditos ella por lo menos puede ayudar a su esposo en su dura tarea.
 
Su sueño es terminar su casa que la tiene en construcción.
texts.en:
The communal ank Maria Jose meets every two weeks in the Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo.  This area is known for its commercial activity, the San Pedro and San Pablo festivities and joyfulness of its people.

Here we meet Mrs. Derry, age 40, who is married and has four children.  Two of them are adults and the other two are 12 and 4 years old and in school and kindergarten.  Her husband is a merchant.

She is a good homemaker and also handles the credit activity related to her husband's business in the Portoviejo market where he sells fruit and legumes.  He works Tuesday through Sunday since Monday is when he takes the day off.  He goes to the wholesale market at 5:00 a.m. to select the best products to sell to his customers.  He has been in business for 20 years.

This loan will be used to buy all kinds of fruit, legumes and vegetables.  Derry has been in the communal bank for seven years and enjoys being able to use the loans to help her husband with his hard work.  Her dream is to finish her house which is currently in construction.

loans.use: To buy legumes, fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Tala't

texts.en: Tala't is a 32-year-old man who is married and a father of a girl and four boys. He has a clothing store and he is planning to improve his work, as he has a large family, Tala't wants to buy a larger amount of summer clothes to increase the store's sales, so he took out a loan from FATEN. Tala't, who has a good reputation and manners, is photographed in his store.

loans.use: To pay for summer clothes to sell

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is a 53-year-old married woman from Madaba, Jordan, who owns a dairy products retail store. Mariam is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to purchase the equipment necessary to fulfill her dream of expanding her business and increasing her sales.

loans.use: to purchase equipment necessary to expand her business.

loans.name: Hilola

texts.ru: Хилола проживает в районе Вахдат. Ей 26 лет. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Ее муж работает в строительной организации. Сама она имеет среднее образование. Уже год как она занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Хилола берет заказы у себя дома. В основном она шьет национальные платья. Она берет кредит для приобретения швейной машинки, так как ее имеющаяся машинка хорошо не шьет.
texts.en: Hilola lives in Vahdat.  She is 26 years old, married, and has two children.  Her husband works in construction.  She has a high school education.  She has been making traditional dresses for a year now.  Hilola takes orders at home.  She primarily sews traditional dresses.  She is taking out a loan to buy a new sewing machine since her current machine does not sew well.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Ermisenda Del Carmen

texts.en: Ermisenda lives in Danli, Honduras where she has operated a small convenience shop for the last 18 years. She has managed to grow her business over time and now employs two individuals to help at the store. Nonetheless, she is in need of a Lps. 20,000 loan to purchase additional merchandise such as: meats, cheeses, fruit, vegetables, snacks, milk, soft drinks, basic grains, cornmeal, salt, butter, cooking oil, basic household cleaning products, and personal hygiene products.

loans.use: to purchase meats, cheeses, fruit, etc.

loans.name: Diego

texts.en:
Diego is 35 years old and married to Imelda, who manages their general store. The couple is blessed with 2 children and they are school-aged. According to Diego, he is able to earn about PHP 50,000 per cropping harvest. The rice farming business is not the only source of income of the family instead they also managed a retail shop within the village where they live.

Diego grows rice and has been doing it for almost 15 years. He would like to make his farm more productive, that's why he is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 as his additional capital in maintaining and improving his farm. 

In the future, Diego hopes that he can avail his loan request so that he can provide the farm supplies needed in the maintenance of his rice farm. He also wants to increase his income to be able to provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides for his farm.

loans.name: Yon

texts.en: Yon is a food seller who earns about $3 a day. She is a single mother with five children, two of whom are in school while the other three work in a local factory where they earn earn about $2.50 a day. Every month, Yon has to spend about $50 on food, $15 on rent for her house, $20 on transportation, $5 on school fees and $15 on other items. She is applying for a loan for $600 to buy a motorbike for her son, who earns a living by providing motor taxi services. This loan will help her son launch his own career so that he can support himself and not have to depend on his family to help meet his daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her son so that he can provide motor taxi services.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a water tank and irrigation pipes.

loans.name: Phiona

texts.en: Phiona is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala region of central Uganda.  She is single, has no children and has earned a living for the last three years by running a small retail shop where she sells soap and salt. To help expand her business, improve her life and buy more food for her family, Phiona has applied for a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to buy more items to sell to her customers.  Phiona is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her get a loan to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell to her customers such as salt and soap.

loans.name: Marisela

texts.es: Marisela  D. 28 años D. edad vive al sur D. la ciudad, con su pequeño hijo D. 7 años. Allí se dedica a la confección D. ropa en general. Inicialmente trabajó como empleada D. una ferretería  mientras adelantaba sus estudios D. administradora D. empresas. Comenzó su trabajo en las confecciones,  porque una D. sus amigas conocía D. este oficio y a Marisela le gustó;  inició comprando telas y accesorios para fabricar bolsos que vendió entre sus compañeras D. estudio y D. trabajo;  considerando la rentabilidad del negocio se dedicó exclusivamente a él y dejó D. ser empleada. Así fue que con su liquidación adquirió su maquina plana y su fileteadora,  aprovechando que contaba con el apoyo D. su madre, quien conoce también este oficio. Sus principales líneas D. trabajo son los vestidos para damas, uniformes y ropa para fiestas.  Ella compra la materia prima D. contado y con relación a los uniformes le entregan materia prima y ella compra los insumos. Su principal sueño es abrir un almacén D. ropa diseñada y confeccionada en su taller.  Su mayor desafío es su capital D. trabajo que se torna insuficiente,  ante la creciente demanda y esta es justamente la razón por la cual acuD. a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, la cual invertirá en tela, para responder a la confección D. ropa que venD. a todo costo. Mientras Marisela trabaja para cumplir sus sueños, maneja en su negocio una rotación D. inventarios D. 18 días, un margen D. contribución D. 39,44% y una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menor del 36,5%.
texts.en:
Marisela, 28, lives in the south part of the city with her little 7-year-old son.  She makes all sorts of clothes there.  She started out working as a hardware store employee while going to school majoring in business administration.  She started working making clothes because one of her girlfriends knew this occupation and Marisela liked it.  She started out buying fabric and accessories to make purses that she sold among her classmates and coworkers.  

Noting the profitability of the business she dedicated herself to it exclusively and stopped being an employee.  She used her severance pay to buy a plain sewing machine and also an overlock machine taking advantage of the fact that her mother, who also knows this occupation, was willing to help her out.  Her main lines of work are women’s dresses, uniforms and party clothes.  She pays cash for raw materials.  With respect to the uniforms, the raw materials for them are delivered to her and she buys the other supplies.  Her main dream is to open a store to sell clothes designed and manufactured in her workshop.

Her greatest challenge is insufficient working capital in face of the growing demand and this is precisely the purpose of her Kiva loan request, the first financing she’s gotten from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she’ll use to buy fabric to make the clothes she sells at all costs. While Marisela works toward reaching her dreams, she has an 18-day inventory turnaround rate, a marginal profit per unit sale of 39.44% and a profit margin on sales of no less than 36.5%.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mom, 31 years old, is a farmer who earns $2 per day. Her husband is a yam seller and earns $5 per day. They have three children, two of whom are studying and one who works in the garment factory, earning $3 per day. Every month, Mom must spend $63 on food, $10 on electricity, $10 on school fee, $10 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $850 to buy potatoes to sell with her relatives. This loan will help her have the money to start a new career that can provide some profit for supporting her family. She plans to buy more potatoes to sell when she can find a good market.

loans.use: To buy potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 50 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are still studying. Her oldest child sacrificed by working abroad to obtain a good quality of life. Estrella has been managing her hog raising business for three years. She describes herself as patient and industrious.

Her business serves as a source of income for the family that helps her provide their daily needs. Now, she is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 (Philippine Pesos) to buy feed for raising her piglets. She wants to develop her business, to earn a higher income, and to save some of it for any future emergencies in her family.

loans.use: to buy feed for raising her piglets.

loans.name: Manuelito

texts.en:
Manuelito is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has three children. 

Manuelito is providing motorcycle or habal-habal services. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan for 10,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the service. 

Manuelito has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Manuelito hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the service

loans.name: Maria Brendy

texts.es:
María D. 51 años, vive junto con su esposo e hijos, no cuenta con los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito D. TambogranD. que pertenece al departamento D. Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

María desD. hace algunos años se dedica a la venta D. todo tipo D. artículos para el hogar como accesorios para la cocina, frazadas, vajilla, etc. Además cuenta con su propia clientela, la misma que le realiza pedidos y les da facilidades D. pago a sus clientes frecuentes, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá solventar sus necesidades familiares.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 3000 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad D. mercadería innovadora para seguir ofreciendoles a sus clientes y aumenten, ya que estamos cerca a las fiestas naviD.ñas, con la finalidad D. que sus ganancias se incrementen para cubrir su crédito y tener una mejor calidad D. vida para su familia.
texts.en: María is 51 years old and lives with her husband and children in a rural area of the district of TambogranD., department of Piura, where they do not have basic services. This area is known for its agriculture, livestock and craftwork. For a number of years María has maD. a living selling all kinds of household goods, such as kitchen accessories, blankets, dishes, etc. She has her own clientele who make orders with her, and she offers payment plans to her regular customers. With the income she makes, she will be able to meet family needs. She is requesting the loan from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa to purchase a larger quantity of innovative merchandise so she can keep offering them to her customers and increase her sales with Christmastime drawing near, so her profits can increase to cover the loan and she can proviD. her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of innovative merchandise to offer her customers.

loans.name: Henry Octavio

texts.es: A sus 39 años Henry Octavio es un emprendedor que sueña con agrandar su negocio, el se dedica a brindar el servicio de carpintería. Es consciente que para cumplir su sueño necesitará un préstamo con el cual comprar pega, madera, clavos, maque y herramientas de trabajo para realizar los diferentes pedidos que le realizan pues actualmente no cuenta con el capital necesario. Henry es un luchador incansable que se propuso mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia por lo que trabaja cada día con la motivación de cumplir sus metas.
texts.en: At the age of 39, Henry Octavio is an entrepreneur who dreams with enlarging his business.  He is a carpenter.  He is aware that in order to reach his dream he will need a loan to buy glue, lumber, nails, varnish and work tools to fill the various orders he has pending because he currently lacks the necessary capital.  Henry is a tireless fighter who has resolved to improve his and his family’s quality of life and is motivated to work daily to reach his goals.

loans.use: to buy glue, lumber, nails, varnish and tools.

loans.name: Velikhan

texts.en: Velikhan is a 49-year-old man who has been engaged in milk and dairy product sale for the last 20 years. He has two milking cows. His monthly profit from milk sales is 300 AZN. His wife actively helps him to run the business. Milk products are very popular in Azerbaijan and people use them in everyday cuisine. That’s why Velikhan would like to expand his business and purchase two additional milking cows. For this purpose he applied for 1300 AZN loan. This will be his 4th loan and he has a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase two milking cows

loans.name: Maria Eloisa

texts.es:
Maria de 48 años, tiene un restaurante el cual trabaja sola todos los días de 6 am hasta las 10 pm, le ha ido muy bien y ahora también se dedica a la venta de víveres al por menor.

El único problema que presenta es que su sector es muy peligroso y su miedo es la delincuencia.

Es madre soltera y trabaja para salir adelante con sus dos hijas de 12 y 10 años que estudian en escuela fiscal.

Su meta es terminar de construir su casa y poder decorar su comedor para la mejora atención y conformidad de sus clientes.
texts.en: Maria, 48, has a restaurant where she works alone every day from 6 am until 10 pm.  It has gone well for her and now she also sells food retail. The only problem is that their sector is very dangerous and her fear is crime. She is a single mother and works to move ahead with her two daughters, 12 and 10, studying in public school. Her goal is to finish building her house and to decorate her dining room to improve care and comfort of her customers.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and other food.

loans.name: Damaso

texts.es:
El señor Dámaso es una persona muy trabajadora, cuenta con 49 años de edad y está casado con la señora Estefanía con quien tiene 4 hijos, de los cuales solo miguel y ángel estudian, el mayor cursa el segundo año de prepa y el otro estudia sexto año de primaria, ya que los otros 2 están casados, el es pescador desde hace 20 años.
Don Dámaso dice que decidió iniciar con esta actividad, ya que quería buscar de manera de apoyar a su esposa con los gastos de la casa, y a sus hijos con sus estudios, también porque quiere mejorar aun mas su calidad de vida, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de tarrayas, carnada y renta de pangos (lanchas).
La meta que él dice tener para su negocio, y espera poder cumplirla es la de invertirle muchísimo más, para hacerlo crecer rápidamente, ya que quiere comprarse un pango y así ya no tener que rentarlo, ya que así incrementara un poco mas sus ganancias, para asegurar su futuro y el de su familia.
Le da las gracias a los prestatarios de kiva, por la confianza que le están brindando, ya que gracias a ese apoyo ahora cuenta con una mejor calidad de vida y solvencia económica, también continuara con la inversión en su negocio, para mejorarlo mucho más.
texts.en:
Damaso is a very hard-working person.  He is 49 years old and is married to Estefanía with whom he has 4 children.  Two of his children, Miguel and Angel, are students.  The oldest is in his second year of high school and the other is in his sixth year of primary school.  The other two children are married.  Damaso has been a fisherman for 20 years. 

Damaso says that he decided to start this business because he wanted to find a way to support his wife with the expenses of the household and his children with their studies, and also to improve his quality of life.  With the loan that he received he will invest it in the purchase of nets and bait, and to rent boats.

The goal he says he has for his business, which he hopes to be able to achieve, is to invest in it a lot more to make it grow. He wants to buy himself a boat so he doesn't have to rent one.  In this way he can increase his profits a little bit more to ensure his future and that of his family.  He gives thanks to the Kiva lenders for the trust they are giving him.  Thanks to their support he now has a better quality of life and economic solvency.  He will also continue with the investment in his business to improve it much more.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of nets and bait, and to rent boats.

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Provincia de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 2 filhos que frequentam a Escola. Fez a 5ªclasse e parou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta mais 2 sobrinhos que vivem com ela. 

É Servente de bar ha mais de 10 anos e tem um salario de 3.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Já teve emprestimo noutros bancos e conseguiu pagar sem dificuldades, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a sua casa (cimento, pedra, chapas, barrotes, ferro, e outros). O primeiros emprestimo foi de: 10.000.00mt, para habitação.  
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a obra da sua casa para melhor confortar a sua familia, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
She was born in the district of Boane, province of Maputo, southern Mozambique. She is single and has two children who attend school. She completed 5th grade and stopped for lack of financial conditions. She lives with her family in a house she owns and also supports two nephews who live with her.
She has been a bartender for over 10 years and earns a salary of 3.000mt a month. She uses it to pay for home expenses and saves part of it in her bank account.
She has had loans in other banks and has managed to repay without difficulties. She first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is her second loan with Hluvuku. It is for 15.000mt, which she intends to use to purchase construction supplies for her house (cement, stone, metal sheets, rafters, iron, etc.). The first loan was for 10.000mt, for personal housing.
She pledges to repay as scheduled. In the future she plans to finish building her home in order to offer more comfort for her family. For that reason she intends to request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies for her house (cement, stone, metal sheets, rafters, iron, etc.).

loans.name: Khadim

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un jeune qui a quitté très tôt l'école.Il devait travailler pour soutenir ses deux parents dans la prise en charge des besoins de la famille. Il se lance alors dans le commerce de cartes de téléphone prépayées qui se vendent très bien dans sa localité. Pour écouler ses cartes, il se déplace dans les grandes artères de la ville en les proposant aux passants. Ce travail très difficile lui permet néanmoins de subvenir à ses besoins et de supporter l'essentiel des dépenses de sa famille. Il sollicite un prêt de 250000f pour acheter  un stock de cartes téléphoniques et faire face ainsi à la forte demande en cette veille de fêtes de fin d'année. Son ambition est de louer une cantine à la gare routière de sa ville.
texts.en:
The borrower is a youth who left school very early. He needed to work to support his two parents in taking care of the needs of the family. 

So he began selling prepaid phone cards which sell very well in his region. To sell off his cards, he goes to the main roads of the town and offers them to passersby. This very difficult job allows him nevertheless to meet his needs and to support the essential expenses of his family. 

He is requesting a loan of 250,000f to buy a stock of phone cards and be ready for the large demand this eve of the festive season. His goal is to rent a canteen at the bus station of his town.

loans.use: to buy a stock of phone cards.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is 58 years old, married to Elizabeth and has four children. Edward is a tea farmer in Kaptobogen location and has been farming tea for the last 18 years, earning a monthly income of KES 9,200.

He is requesting his first loan with KADET of KES 20,000. He wishes to use the funds to purchase fertilizers for his tea estate. With the anticipated profits from the farm, he will save to improve his tea plantations.

His hopes are to own larger tea estates in his locality and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Emee

texts.en:
Emee is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Emee has a retail shop where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 6,000 Php to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Emee has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Emee hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: 3.14.158.thiệu Khánh Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tình  works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

Tình  is 46 years old and she is married with 3 children.  Tình  is the group leader of the 3.14.158.Thiệu Khánh  solidarity group, which consists of 9 members.  She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents, her children have grown up.

This is Tình's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.  Tình  has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  The main hardship that Tình  faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Tình hopes to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business and to hopes to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Sonia Maribel

texts.en:
The drink Pinol is typical to my country, you can drink it cold or hot, according to taste. I have had my small business, making pinoles, for five years. I sell the drinks to clients, pulperias(small restaurants) and to people outside of the capital. I have one son who I help with his studies and expenses. I am a single mother and I have to seek a way to give us a better way of life.

Loan Use: Purchase corn, chocolate, cacao, cinnamon.

El pinol es una bebida tipica en nuestro pais, puede tomarse helada o caliente segun el gusto de cada persona, tengo cinco años de tener mi pequeña fabrica de pinoles que vendo a clientes, pulperias y personas de afuera de la capital. Tengo 1 hijo al que he ayudado con sus estudios y gastos, ya que soy madre soltera tengo que buscar la manera de darnos una manera mejor de vivir.

loans.use: Compra de maiz, chocolate, cacao, canela

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Joyce would like to buy more business stock

loans.name: Fetulima

texts.en: Fetulima is married with five children. Three of her kids are in high school and two are in primary levels. In the beginning, she sold small goods in her house, like snacks for kids, sugar, salt, flour, bathing soaps and lollies. She bought them from wholesalers in bulk and then re-sold them in pieces. These transactions took place at her home because she did not have a shop to be used. Therefore she used her first loan from the program to build a shop to sell her items. Now Fetulima is a very happy woman because now she is able to earn money from her new shop; she plans to use this loan to extend the shop and make it more productive.

loans.use: To purchase building materials for the expansion of her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase his stock of stationary.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a nurse/midwife managing her own private facility in Meru, which is in eastern Kenya.  She is 56 years old and lives with her husband and three children.  She was certified as a nurse/midwife in 1974. She worked at Meru District Hospital, a government facility, until 2006 when she retired and opted to start her own clinic.  Her clinic is located in the middle of a market, which is where she draws most of her clients. She offers a wide range of health services including general medical services, family planning, maternal and child health services.  She also runs a pharmacy and a laboratory at the site.  Joyce attributes her success to hard work, perseverance and financial assistance from K-MET.  She needs a loan of US $1200 to purchase additional stocks of drugs and also integrate other services into her clinic that are in high demand.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of drugs

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
Maria is married and has six children, two of them school-age. They live in Xai-Xai, Mozambique. Her husband works in a different city, which makes her the main person responsible for attending to the day-to-day needs of her children. She joined the program in 2005. Selling firewood from home has been a good business, one which has allowed them to start building a house. She will use her loan to buy more firewood to sell, as demand for it is growing. With the income from her firewood sales she is able to provide much help with the family's household expenses and to buy the materials to keep working on her house (in the picture Maria appears next to her unfinished house).

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria vive maritalmente com um homem com quem tem 6 filhos. Maria entrou para o programa em 2005. Ela vive num dos bairros perifericos da cidade de Xai-xai, o marido de maria trabalha numa outra Provincia. Por isso ela e quem cuida dos filhos a maior parte do tempo. os filhos mais velhos estao a estudar e os 2 mais pequenos ainda nao porque ainda nao tem idade escolar. Ela vende lenha na sua residencia. A lenha e muito procurada, por isso com os rendimentos ela ja iniciou a construcao da sua residencia usando material convencional.Mas talvex venha a tomar um outro emprestimo quando fechar este para a compra de material de construcao.Ela ajuda em grande medida o marido nas despesas da casa.

loans.use: Maria will use her loan to buy more firewood – which she sells from home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Béatrice

texts.fr:
Mrs. Béatrice N., 26, was born in Dapaong and lives in the Hédzranawoé district of Lomé with her husband. Her business activity is door-to-door (ambulant) sales of tooth picks and she is the mother of three children. Her husband is a cook who is going through a difficult patch right now, since he has been unable to find steady work. It is Mrs. N.'s little ambulant sales business that provides the income for the most urgent needs of the family. She is therefore asking for a loan of US$ 800 so that she can buy her products in bulk and thus assure a constant supply for re-sale. By retailing products that she has purchased at wholesale prices, she manages to earn enough of a profit margin to keep her family going.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agée de 26 ans, Madame Béatrice N. est née à Dapaong et réside au quartier Hédzranawoé à Lomé avec son mari. Revendeuse de cuir dent et mère de trois (03) enfants, elle s’est mariée à un cuisinier qui actuellement s’en sort difficilement car il n’arrive pas à trouver un emploi stable. Et c’est grâce à son petit commerce de cuir dent que madame arrive à subvenir à quelques besoins urgents de la famille. Elle voulait à cet effet avoir un crédit de $800 pour acheter en gros et faire un stock consistant. En les revendant en détaillant elle peut réaliser d’important bénéfice pour pouvoir satisfaire les besoins de sa famille.

loans.use:
Distribution of tooth picks

Ravitaillement en cuir dent

loans.name: Mukisa Group

texts.en: N. Speranza has been our client for the last 4 years and she is the chairperson of Mukisa Group, which will share in this loan. She is married with 4 children and cares for 3 brothers and 3 sisters. She operates a canteen at Tiger Army School, Mubende with students as her customers. She has serviced loans of $250 and her current loan is $150. She has benefited by building her own house. She also has a piggery business and rears local chicken. She plans to increase the number of pigs and expand her canteen to be able to build her parents a house, continue paying school fees for her children as well as cater for her dependents. With her leadership skills and commitment, she can achieve her goal.

loans.use: Natabi Speranza intends to increase the stock in her canteen by buying bread, yellow bananas, washing soap and sodas.

loans.name: Balqees' Group

texts.en: I was married 15 years ago and have six kids: two boys and four girls. I reside with my family in KRK, Pakistan. I believe that education is necessary, therefore my kids attend school.  My husband works at a tea factory and I sell milk. I am borrowing for a second time from Asasah, a microfinance institution, and want to buy an additional cow. My group members are:  Rehman B. will buy a rickshaw with her share of loan. Majeeda B.,Sughran B. and Nusrat B. all want to expand their milk business and therefore buy cows for this purpose.

loans.use: Expand tea stall

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam is a member of Banco Comunal Juan Zaplana Belliza, and is located at Av. Pachacutec Mz A Lt 19, in the Calleria district of Ucayali. She is 37 years old, has 2 children and her husband is a mechanic. Miriam invested her first $100 loan from Manuela Ramos in a shop selling spare parts.

She starts her day at 6am to prepare breakfast for her family, after which she tends to her shop selling spare parts until 8pm.

With this next loan of $1,075.00, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy spare parts for cars, motorbikes and delivery vans, as well as motor oil and so on.

Miriam is very happy because she has managed to set up and run her own business, and can thereby support her family, enabling them to also do well.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Miriam pertenece al Banco Comunal Juan Zaplana Belliza, ubicado en la Av. Pachacutec Mz A Lt 19, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 37 años y es madre de 2 hijos, su esposo es mecánico. Miriam con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en un negocio de venta de repuestos.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con una tienda de venda de repuestos, se levanta a las 6am, para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de su esposo, luego atiende su tienda de repuestos hasta las 8pm.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3000.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará: Repuestos de carro, repuestos de moto y motocarro, aceite de carro, etc.

Miriam esta muy contenta, porque ha logrado formar y manejar su propia empresa, y así puede ayudar a su familia para brindarles un futuro prospero.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for her shop

loans.name: Maria Del Pilar

texts.es:
María del Pilar is a single mother who has two children: Mari José and Gustavo. She launched her business three years ago in order to provide a better education and quality of life for her children. Seeking to generate more income, she launched her business from her home recently selling chemical products for the home.

Now, she is requesting a loan of US $500 which she will repay in 6 months in order to buy a new awning for her business. With your support, María will continue to progress.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

María del pilar es madre soltera tiene dos hijos, Mari José y Gustavo. Emprendió el negocio hace 3 años para dar una mejor educación y calidad de vida a sus hijos buscando generar mejores ingresos emprendió el negocio de bazar en su casa y hace poco venta de productos químicos para el hogar.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US$500 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar un toldo nuevo para su negocio. Con tu apoyo María seguirá progresando.

loans.use: Purchase an awning.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Miss Stella I. is single and 28 years old. She lives in Benin City in Edo state in Nigeria. She sells provisions, a trade she learned for a year before starting her business in 2005. She is requesting a loan of $450.00 to enable her to buy more provisions to sell. She says, “Thank you!” to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more provisions to sell in her store.

loans.name: Kin Nhem Group

texts.en: The group leader of this small group of four is Mrs. Kin N., a housewife and subsistence farmer. The soil in her field is now infertile, so she has asked for a loan to buy fertilizer to make it more productive. Her husband, Mr. Kheang Mich, is also a subsistence farmer. Mrs. Kin N. is 34 and the mother of three children, who are all too young to work or study. Previously, she also obtained a loan from AMK to buy fertilizer for her field.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her field in order to make it more productive

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Maria's husband has a business where he offers data entry services, copies and copies of CDs and DVDs. She helps her husband by making the copies of the Cds and DVDs. She used to have an internet café three years ago. Unfortunately she was the victim of a theft and her business failed. Additionally, she helps her daughter in law sell cosmetics via catalog.

The loans have helped her purchase a printer for her business. She would actually like to set up a printing workshop since there is no competition in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer

El esposo de María tiene una computadora donde ofrece servicios de tipeo, impresiones y copiado de CDs y DVDs. Ella le apoya a su esposo en el copiado de los CDs y DVDs. Hace tres años, ella tenía unas cabinas de Internet en un local propio, sin embargo, fue víctima de un robo, por lo que el negocio fracasó. Igualmente, ella le ayuda a su nuera en la venta de cosméticos por catálogo. Los préstamos le han servido para comprar una impresora para su negocio. A María le gustaría poner una imprenta en su local, ya que no hay competencia por la zona.

loans.use: To purchase a printer for her business.

loans.name: Jesus Adan

texts.es:
Jesús Adan A. P., 37 years old, married and lives in the Paraje Coxom, Cantón Patzarajmac in the Totonicapán province. He currently works as a merchant selling typical clothes for girls and women. He has been doing this for more than five years, selling in the plaza of Totonicapán and Salcaja Municipio de Quetzaltenango and now sees the necessity of requesting a loan to be able to increase his work capital with the idea of having stocked merchandise for the fair in the province of Totonicapán in September, with the objective of improving the quality of life for him and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Jesús Adan A. P. de 37 años de edad, Casado, y con residencia en el Paraje Coxom, Cantón Patzarajmac, del Municipio y departamento de Totonicapán quien actualmente se dedica como comerciante en la venta de ropa típica para niñas y damas ya que tiene mas de 5 años en trabajar en dicha actividad vendiendo en la plaza de Totonicapán y Salcaja Municipio de Quetzaltenango y ahora ve la necesidad de solicitar un crédito en la Institución para poder incrementar su capital de trabajo con la idea de contar con mercadería surtida en esta época de la feria del departamento de Totonicapán en el mes de Septiembre con el objetivo de mejora su nivel de vida y de su familia

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Nazim

texts.en: Nazim Q. is 35 year old. He is married and has three children. He is a small entrepreneur who sells different kinds of foodstuff such as sweets, soft drinks, and juices. Nazim is not alone in his business. His brothers actively help him with sales.  Cureently Nazim requests is a loan of $1200 USD for a term of 15 months to increase and diversify the products he sells. He is ready to work even harder to achieve his aim of becoming a successful businessman. His main goal is to create good conditions for his children and give them a proper education, and for this purpose, he is ready to work as hard as possible.

loans.use: To increase the number of products he sells

loans.name: Bisojida

texts.en:
Bisojida T. is 47 years old. For the last 2 years, Bisojida and her husband have been raising cattle. Bisojida raises cattle and then sells them at the market, and at the same time she provides her family with milk products. 
With the help of the loan, Bisojida plans to increase her livestock and she promises to be accurate in loan repayment.

loans.use: For business expansion

loans.name: Rosalia Elvira

texts.es:
Rosalía pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres al Progreso del distrito y  provincia de Yungay, departamento de Ancash.

Tiene 48 años de edad y dos hijas. Menciona que no ha tenido muchos logros debido a que quedó viuda de un esposo que no se hacía cargo de la familia, es por esta razón que ella siempre vivió como hasta ahora lo hace con su dos hijas. Tiene el negocio de comida que expende en el mercado en el centro ferial de la provincia de Yungay s/n, lugar donde procesa sus alimentos en su puesto, que a la vez aprovecha el lugar de venta para realizar sus compras en el mercado y en especial los días de feria. Menciona que ella empezó con una inversión de S/. 300 y que poco a poco ha ido creciendo, tan es así que actualmente invierte en el proceso de los alimentos y bebidas que tiene en stock en promedio unos S/. 2,000. Día a día sale a vender estos productos con lo cual favorece a toda su familia.

Con el préstamo de S/. 2,500, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, invertirá en la compra de víveres, como azúcar, arroz, fideos y aceite.

Rosalía se encuentra contenta porque menciona que ha sabido salir adelante y día a día va creciendo y saca adelante a sus dos hijas.
texts.en:
Rosalía belongs to the Communal Bank “Mujeres al Progreso” in the district and province of Yungay in Ancash state in Peru. She is 48 years old and has two daughters. She mentions that she hasn’t had many achievements as she was left widowed by a husband who didn’t support the family, so therefore she has always lived as she is living now with her two daughters. She has a food business in the central market in Yungay province, a place where she prepares her meals in a stall, where she takes advantage of the market locale to do her shopping especially on market days. She mentions that she began with an investment of S/.300 and that little by little she has grown. Today she will invest in the preparation of food and beverages that she can stock with a loan of around S/.2000. Day after day she sells these products which benefits her family. With this loan for S/.2,500, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will invest in purchasing supplies such as sugar, rice, noodles, and oil. Rosalía is content because she mentions that she has known how to be successful and day after day she is growing and providing a future for her two daughters.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sugar, rice, noodles and oil.

loans.name: Rano

texts.en:
Z. Rano is 48 years old mother of two children. For most of her family life, she has been dedicated to raising livestock. The self-sacrifice and attention that she brings to raising each one of her young cows has resulted in an increase of the quantity of calves. As a result, she is able to give her children the opportunity to pursue university studies, giving her much pride and satisfaction. 

Her next goal is to expand the business into selling milk. This business would generate enough additional income to sustain her home and enable her to pay the university costs for her children. In order to meet her goals, Rano is asking for a loan to buy more cattle. Rano hopes that her expanded business will help her realize the dream of seeing her children become professionals.

loans.use: Purchasing of cattle for breeding and selling.

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Long C. is 61 years old and a resident of Phnom Penh City. She currently sells clothes. 

She can earn, on average, $3.80 per day and has been running her business for more than two years. She is married and has eight children: six are single and two are married and live away from the family home. 

To help meet her family's needs, two of her daughters are employed as garment workers. Her husband is a retired policeman who earns a salary of $35 a month. 

C. expects to grow her investment, and she would like to ask for a $500 loan to buy more clothes for her business activities.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Shahnaz William Masih Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz baji is a 28-year-old married lady and resides in a city named Borewala, Pakistan. Her parents were not in a position to bear her education expenses; that’s why she left her education after 5th standard. She is the mother of three kids: one son and two daughters. Her elder daughter is 5 years old and reads in kindergarten. Her son and her youngest daughter are not of a school-going age.

Shahnaz baji’s husband's name is W. M. and he deals with wood. He buys wood and sells it in the community, since gas is not available. She helps her husband to tie the wood in bundles and to sell in the community. She successfully repaid her two previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to expand her husband’s wood selling business.

She is the group leader of some more women of her locality. Bushra baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. Tahira parveen baji wants a loan to buy bicycles to resell. Shahnaz begum baji wants a loan to buy clothes to resell. Parveen baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk selling business. Rahal baji wants a loan to buy wood to resell. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy material (cloth, thread and sketches) for her carpet weaving business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy wood to sell

loans.name: Rosmeri

texts.es: Rosmeri de 26 años de edad, es soltera, vive en casa de su madre, con ella y sus dos hermanos. Se dedica a su peluquería, brinda servicio de cortes de cabello, tintes y frisados, en un espacio de su casa que implementó especialmente para este negocio. Esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace un año y le va muy bien. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que conoce mucha gente que acude a ella por su buena labor, además le es rentable porque ya cuenta con una fiel clientela. Para el futuro quiere tener un salón de belleza con todos los servicios, como manicura, pedicura y masajes. Rosmeri ya ha llevado 2 préstamos con MFP, y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque aprende mucho del asesor de crédito y del resto de integrantes. Con el dinero que solicita comprará un gran espejo y materiales de peluquería, así como también mandara a ampliar un poco más el espacio de su local.
texts.en:
Rosmeri is 26 years old, single, and lives at home with her mother and two sisters. She has a salon, which offers haircuts, color and perms, in a part of her house, which she has set up specifically for this business. She has been doing this for one year, and it is going very well. What she likes about her job is that she meets a lot of people who come to her for her good work. Also, it is profitable because she already has a faithful clientele. In the future, she wants to have an a full-service beauty salon with manicures, pedicures and massages. Rosmeri has had 2 loans from MFP. She likes working with her community bank because she learns a lot from her loan advisor and the other members. With the money that she requests, she will buy a large mirror and salon materials in order to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand her business and install necessities for her work

loans.name: Norberto

texts.es: El señor Norberto S. tiene la edad e 46 años habita en la Borgoña ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa la cual le apoya en realizar las actividades del hogar; ellos tiene tres hijos dos de ellos ya son casado y un joven de 18 años que actualmente estudia su secundaria, los planes hacia su familia es logra comprar un terreno  para heredarle a cada uno de ellos. Don Norberto desde hace veinticinco años trabaja como agricultor y comerciante la mayor necesidad es la falta de financiamiento, el inicio la labor de agricultor con sus propios esfuerzos, el necesita financiamiento para la compra de fertilizantes para abonar sus  cultivos de piña y den un  mejor resultado en cuando a la calidad y sean vendido en un mejor precio lo cual esto generaría buenos ingresos.
texts.en:
Noberto S. is 46 years old and lives in Borgoña, located in the municipality of Ticuantepe, together with her wife who helps him with all their home tasks. They have three children, two of whom are already married and the youngest of whom is 18 years old and is currently studying in secondary school. Their plans in regards of their family is to be able to buy a plot of land in order to leave an inheritance to each one of them. Don Noberto has worked for the last 25 years as a farmer and trader. His main problem is the lack of financing. He began his agricultural work with his own resources, but he needs finance in order to purchase fertilizer to cultivate his pineapple crops and give a better quality result, so that the crop can be sold at a better price which will generate a good income.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase agricultural products to improve production.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es: La señora Magdalena R. es madre soltera y  es una mujer emprendedora ya que actual mente tiene un negocio de papelería y renta de computadoras esté es el ingreso de su familia. Actual mente es nuevo negocio le hace falta mas equipo y mercancía  es por eso que esta solicitando nueva mente su cooperación para poder llevar acabo está inversión.
texts.en:
Mrs. Magdalena Rodriguez is an enterprising single mother who supports her family with a stationer's store where she also rents computers. Her business needs more equipment and inventory so she is again asking for help in order to increase her investment.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase computer equipment.

loans.name: Qandia Gul Group

texts.en: Qandia Gul is the group leader of Qandia Gul group. There are two members of this group that would like to expand their businesses and want to take a loan of 20000 Afghani for a term of 8 months. Qandia Gul wants to take a loan for her bakery. Salema wants to take a loan for her brother who has a general store. Salema's brother wants to expand his business and attract more clients. They are very happy for this process of obtaining a loan in Afghanistan because every poor worker can use it and can change their businesses and their lives. They want to thank lenders around the world.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: A resident of Ramallah, Palestine, Mohamed R., 59, has raised seven children with his wife.  An experienced bread baker, for more than 10 years Mohamed has owned a small bakery that attracts many clients from the region.  He is now requesting a loan of $3,000 to fund the purchase of ingredients required for the business. He is grateful to all supporting him and promises to manage the loan with diligence.

loans.use: To purchase flour and other ingredients required for his business.

loans.name: Yawo Ganyo

texts.fr:
ce jeune homme a appris le métier de la couture, à la fin de son apprentissage il a ouvert son propre atelier de couture, il achète des tissus basins et confectionne des vêtements appelés « boubous » qu’il revend à ses clients.
 Il réalise ainsi de grosses recettes. Sa clientèle grandit de jour en jour, il veut par conséquent agrandir son activité raison pour laquelle il sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 20 tissus basins pour confectionner de nouveaux modèles de boubous.
texts.en:
This is a young man who learned the trade of tailoring. After finishing his apprenticeship, he opened his own workshop. He buys damask cloth and makes clothing called boubous (long, loose-fitting outfits) that he sells to his customers. And so his gross income is large. His customers are increasing day by day. He consequently wants to expand his business, and this is why he's requesting his first loan from WAGES to buy 20 lengths of damask cloth to make new styles of boubous.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy damask cloth

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy small fish and sell them.

loans.name: Luz Haydee

texts.es:
La señora Luz Haydee R. D. León    tiene 59 años D. edad, vive en el distrito D. Laredo , provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5to secundaria , tiene 3 hijos pero ninguno dependen económicamente D. ella.
Luz Haydee  se dedica a la confección D. ropa para dama, caballeros y niños .
Con su primer crédito D. 300 soles compro mas telas, hilos, lentejuelas, algodón, blondas, hilos D. bordar, etc.
Con el crédito D. 1,000 soles lo invertirá en su negocio, en la compra D. mas telas ya que también esta confeccionando disfraces y uniformes para profesoras.
Luz Haydee tiene como sueño crear una microempresa D. costura y captar mayor clientela D. diferentes instituciones como colegios, bancos, y instituciones en general.
texts.en:
Luz Haydee R. D. León is 59 years old, and lives in the Laredo district, Trujillo province, in La Libertad, Perú. This entrepreneur studied until the 5th year of secondary school, and has 3 children who no longer depend on her financially. Luz Haydee dedicates herself to making clothing for women, men and children. With her first loan of 300 soles she bought more fabric, thread, sequins, cotton, silk lace, embroidery thread, etc. With the loan of 1,000 soles, she will invest in her business and buy more fabric since she is also making costumes and uniforms for teachers. Luz Haydee’s dream is to create a sewing enterprise and attract more customers from different institutions such as schools and banks. 

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabrics.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es:
Lucy es socia del Bancomunal Melcochita.
Lucy es casada tiene 48 años tiene 5 hijos que son mayores y  trabajan.
Lucy trabajaba cociendo en su casa por muchos años, dejo por que la confección empezó a bajar las clientas preferían ropa hecha y ella decidió vender productos de belleza por catalogo y también da servicio de impresión en su casa.
Desde que Luz esta en Finca  aprendió  la importancia de ahorrar 
Lucy necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles para la compra de una impresora 
El sueño de Lucy es comprar una moto-car, para darlo en alquiler.
texts.en:
Lucy is a member of the Melcochita cooperative bank. Lucy is married, 48 years old, and has 5 children that are grown and working. Lucy worked cooking in her home for many years, but she stopped because demand waned and her customers preferred hand-made clothing. She decided to start selling beauty products by catalog and also offering printing services in her home. Since Lucy has been with Finca, she has learned the importance of saving. Lucy needs a loan of 1,600 soles to buy a printer. Lucy’s dream is to buy a moto-car to rent out for additional income.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a printer.

loans.name: Marythza

texts.es:
Marythza, vende perfumes y cosméticos en todas las oficinas y vecinos de la zona sur de la ciudad de La Paz
Vive en la zona de Alto obrajes de la ciudad de La Paz. En casa de sus suegros..
El crédito será destinado para el capital de inversión (compra de perfumes, cosméticos, y otros productos de belleza).
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. Su historial lo califica como cliente bueno en el pago se sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Marythza sells perfumes and cosmetics in all the offices and to her neighbors in the southern zone of La Paz city. She lives in her in-laws’ home in the Alto area of La Paz. The loan will be used as working capital (to buy perfumes, cosmetics, and other beauty products). This is her 2nd loan with Impro. Her credit history qualifies her as a good client with regard to her previous payments.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: CAPITAL DE TRABAJO

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Weaving is the business of Jane R.. She makes cradles from soft ball thread which is quite difficult to use. She and her husband reside in Santiago City, Isabela. According to her, she can produce at least four bog cradles from the thread. Weaving cradles needs patience in order to produce good quality, she added.

Jane is doing her best to have a good product that she can offer to her customers. She wants to further improve and promote her business, this is the reason why she is taking out a loan of PHP 5,000 from Kiva lenders. According to her, her raw materials are also bought in Manila and this makes her really interested to take out a loan to further maintain the business which is of big help to her family.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Georgina Andrea

texts.en:
Previous loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=97748&_tpos=f&_tpg=h
Georgina is a member of the United Friends village bank. 
She is separated and has two children who are 23 and 30 years-old, they both work. 
Georgina began to sell lunch specials to help her daughter, but it went so well that she decided to continue selling them on her own. Currently, she has grown the place where she sells the specials and is making improvements because things are going so well. 
Georgina needs a new loan of 2600 soles to buy ingredients for her food, utensils for cooking, and to repaint her shop.
Her dream is to finish building her house, to have more clients, and to continue to improve the place where she sells the lunches.

loans.use: buy ingredients for her food, utensils for cooking, and to repaint her shop.

loans.name: Felix Ruben

texts.es: El señor Félix Rubén M. habita en el Km. 10 ½  Carretera a Masaya junto a su esposa e hijos, la esposa trabaja como conserje en el colegio San Antonio Sur, para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar, don Félix M. desde hace 15 años es docente del mismo colegio imparte clases a niños de primaria  por las mañanas y por las tardes es profesor de educación física del mismo colegio. El esta contento ya que tiene cinco ciclos trabajando con la institución ya que los interés son bajos y le apoyan al sector educación, su sueldo no le ajusta para poder mejorar su vivienda de una solo vez, él se siente casi realizado ya que gran parte de su casa esta casi termina, con esta aprobación va a comprar el piso y parte del techo. Agradece ala institución por su buena confianza que le dan a los clientes que son muchas las familias que se benefician con estos préstamos.

loans.use: Comprar piso y zinc para repara el techo de su vivienda

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es: Rosa Argentina García Hernández tiene la edad de 53 años, su estado civil es casada. Doña Rosa tiene 3 hijos. La actividad económica de Rosa es la venta de mercadería en general. Doña Rosa es una mujer muy luchadora y emprendedora, por lo que disfruta mucho de su negocio. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Doña Rosa dio inicio su pequeño negocio por el deseo de superación ya que tenía que mantener a sus hijos. Su financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo y el dinero será utilizado para la compra de ropa, prendas de oro laminado, plata, bolsos, calzado entre otros. El deseo de Rosa es de proporcionarles a sus hijos la educación necesaria para que sea un buen profesional.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Mari

texts.en:
Mari is fifty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to eight children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Ejura in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Mari works to support her husband financially to provide for the family.

Mari is a food vendor. She cooks and sells rice with stew, selling by the roadside from morning till evening. She procures the goods from nearby towns.

Mari has been in business for over fifteen years and wants a loan to procure bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk. She is hopeful to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice to make rice and stew

loans.name: Diana Sebastiana

texts.es:
La señora  DIANA SEBASTIANA S. N., tiene  46 años, vive en el distrito de la Esperanza, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal SANTA ELENA II. Ella presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria y  tiene 3 hijos quienes económicamente de ella porque se encuentra estudiando. La socia se dedica a la venta de arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos, papas, golosinas, cerveza, gaseosas, etc. en la tienda que tiene en su casa.
Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró arroz, azúcar, cerveza, gaseosa, golosinas, leche, fideos, aceite y una vitrina para exhibir sus productos.
Con este crédito de 500 soles, comprará cajas de cerveza y gaseosas al por mayor para generar mayores ganancias.
Ella sueña con ampliar su negocio y tener su restaurante  por lo cual esta ahorrando y así lograr  su meta.
texts.en:
Sra. Diana Sebastiana S. N. is 46 years old and lives in the District of La Esperanza, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She is a member of the Santa Elena II Communal Bank. Diana completed her education through the 5th year of secondary school. She has 3 dependent children who attend school.

Diana sells rice, sugar, milk, noodles, potatoes, candy, beer, sodas, and other products from the store located in her home. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to buy inventory and a display cabinet for exhibiting her products.
