With this loan of 500 soles, she will buy cases of beer and sodas in bulk so that she can generate better earnings. Her dream is to expand her business and open a restaurant. For this reason, she is accumulating savings so that she can achieve this goal.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beer & sodas

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica L. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 31 years old. Veronica is married and has 3 infant children. Veronica has a sari-sari (general) store from which she sells food & daily use products to the local community. Veronica has been in business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (about $106 US) a month for these activities.

In 2008, Veronica joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business.  This loan will be the 5th loan Veronica has taken out from HSPFI. Veronica has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 pesos from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to  expand the business. Veronica is requesting another loan of 11,000 pesos which will also be used to expand the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the business

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Lupita Iris

texts.es:
Lupita es una mujer dinámica y muy trabajadora, vive en el distrito de Campo Verde, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 27 años y es madre de tres hijos menores de edad.
Lupita se dedica a la venta de frutas de la región al por mayor junto a su esposo. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Nazarenas” desde hace ocho meses y el primer crédito que obtuvo fue de 300.00 nuevos soles que invirtió en la compra de limones para vender en el mercado de Bellavista de la ciudad de Pucallpa.
En la actualidad necesita un crédito de 500.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà productos de abarrotes para vender desde su casa. 
La meta de Lupita es llegar a tener un Minimarket y mejorar la economía de su hogar.
texts.en:
Lupita is a dynamic and hard-working woman. She lives in the Campo Verde district of the Ucayali region. She is 27 years old and is the mother of three minor children. Lupita and her husband sell local fruits wholesale. She has been a member of the community bank "Las Nazarena" for eight months. The first loan she obtained was for 300 PEN, which she invested in the purchase of lemons to sell in the Bellavista market in the city of Pucallpa. Now she is applying for a loan of 500 PEN with which she will buy grocery products to sell from her house. Lupita's goal is to have a minimarket and to improve the economy of her household.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grocery stock

loans.name: Sujey Del Carmen

texts.es: Sugey es soltera y no tiene hijos, actualmente vive con sus padres en la zona # 6 de Nueva Guinea donde la población cada dia crece mas,  y les apoya con los gastos familares, trabaja como docente de la Escuela Experimental Jan Amos Comenius desde hace 8 años, está solicitando su quinto crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (Repellar la casa),  por las tardes cuando regresa de dar clase se dedica a terminar los quehaceres del hogar y despues a planear la clase para luego impartirselas el dia siguientes a sus alumnos,  Sugey es una mujer  profesional responsable, honesta, trabajadora,  sueña con  seguir  estudiando, tener salud, tener una casa bonita con todas las condiciones y tener estabilidad laboral para así ayudar a su familia ya son de escasos recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Sugey is single and has no children. She lives with her parents in Zone 6 of Nueva Guinea, which is a fast-growing area. She helps them with household expenses working as a teacher at the Jan Amos Comenius Experimental School. She has worked there for the last 8 years. She is asking for her fifth loan to make home improvements (replastering the house). In the afternoon, when she comes home from teaching, she finishes her domestic chores and then plans her classes for the next day. Sugey is a professional, responsible, honest, hard-working woman. She dreams with continuing her education, with having good health, a pretty home with all the comforts, and to have stable work so that she can continue to help her family, who are of very limited economic resources.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To replaster her house.

loans.name: Rodgers

texts.en:
Rodgers M. is a married man aged 39 years and has three children aged 13, 9 and 1 year old. He lives in Kilifi where he operates a retail shop in a place called Ngerenya business centre. His business is four years old and is doing well.

Rodgers has been a KADET member and is now borrowing his second loan after successfully servicing his first loan of Kshs. 36,500. With the money, Rodgers plans to expand his business premises and to also add more stock into his retail shop.

His dream is to run a wholesale store in future and he is optimistic that this will be a reality.

loans.use: To expand his business premises and to add more stock into his retail shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more second-hand clothing for resale

loans.name: Libertad

texts.es:
Libertad, es una mujer muy emprendedora, vive en el Distrito D. Calleria, región Ucayali, tiene 65 años, es madre D. siete hijos que son independientes, ella se dedica a administrar su bodega, esta actividad la realiza en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo, quien le ayuda en la atención D. su negocio. Libertad forma parte del Banco Comunal Mujeres Solidarias, desD. hace 5 años, el primer crédito que recibió fue D. 300 soles que fue invertido en productos para su bodega.
Actualmente cuenta con otro negocio, brinda servicio D. Internet.
Con este crédito D. 2500 soles, comprará computadoras para su negocio D. cabinas D. internet.
La meta D. Libertad es ampliar su bodega y adquirir mas computadoras para su cabina D. internet.
texts.en:
Libertad is a very enterprising woman. She lives in the District of Calleria, Ucayali region. She is 65 years old and the mother of seven children that are independent. She is dedicated to administering her convenience store. She carries out this activity in her house. She counts on the support of her husband, who helps her in running her business. Libertad has been part of the Supportive Women Communal Bank for 5 years. The first loan that she received was of 300 soles which was invested in products for her store. At present she also relies on another business: that of offering internet service. With this loan of 2500 soles, she will buy computers for her internet service business. The goal of Libertad is to expand her store and to acquire more computers for her internet service.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy computers for her internet service.

loans.name: Clarisa

texts.en:
Clarisa A., 45, is making sure that her family has enough for their daily needs. Married to Wilfredo A., she is blessed with four children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn their living so that their family can have a better life.  Together they have been managing their own variety store for several years.

Clarisa has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow four times through CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to buy added stocks for her store.   Her business lets her earn a profit of PHP 3,900 per month.  

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 10,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added working capital for her expanding business, allowing her to buy assorted products for her variety store.

She dreams that her business will be more successful for a better family standard of living. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buying assorted products for her variety store

loans.name: Becky

texts.en:
Becky A. sells second-hand clothes in Nyamasaria Kisumu, a business she started in 2009 as a source of income since she was tired of just staying idle at home.

Due to her limited stock compared to the high demand, Becky wishes to expand her business by increasing her stock -- something she believes she will be able to achieve once she gets some financial boost.

Becky wishes to own rental houses as her business grows and be able to provide her children with better education. She is married and a mother of two children.

loans.use: To increase her stock.

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.en:
Lucrecia B. is from the village of Brgy. Buliwao, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 52 years old. Lucrecia is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Lucrecia owns & operates a business preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Lucrecia has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 7,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Lucrecia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucrecia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Lucrecia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Lucrecia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Kobu Development Group Of Mukono

texts.en:
N. Harriet remains undeterred, even when the odds of life seem not to be basking in her favor. Her divorce sob-story was ominously threatening to throw her off her feet and she was saddled with heavy responsibilities after her husband left her. However, she took it in her stride, knowing what the implications of not having a steady means of livelihood would have on her four children.

With her naivete, Harriet had to obtain a footing in business. The kind of business she first opted for was at a low ebb and was fraught with heavy competition. With the help of friends, her business journey began.

Harriet ventured into a salon business in her home area in Seeta, Mukono district, Uganda. During her three years experience in this business, her stock in trade has been the cordial working relationship she has established with her client base. With her workers she has established an all-hands-to-the-pump business approach which has, over time, produced results for her business.

In a month, Harriet says she is able to make profits totaling 250,000 Ugandan shillings. The costs of running this kind of competitive business have, however, taken their toll on the business’s annual profits. It’s for this reason that she figures a loan will significantly impact on her business as she will be able to buy more salon equipment. On top of that she also wants to expand her salon.

loans.use: To buy new salon equipment like a dryer, hair chemicals and weaves

loans.name: Khna

texts.en: Mrs. Khna M. was born in 1966 and she lives in Tuol Kandal village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a one point five-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. Now she has a few problems because her field is infertile, it is a long way from an irrigation system, and it has a lot of insects. So to improve production, Mrs. Khna M. is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer, gasoline, pesticide, and to hire farm laborers to plow the rice field. Her husband, Mr. Roeurn Loeng, is a construction laborer and also a fisherman. She is a mother of two children, one of whom is a farmer, while the other is attending the local public school. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, gasoline, and pesticide.

loans.name: Chard

texts.en:
Chard S., 29, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for clay and ceramic products. She is employed at a local garment factory for an income of about $2 per day. Her husband is a police officer, earning an income of $3 per day to help cover the family expenses.  

S. is requesting a loan of $300 to dig a well to water her farming products. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: Dig a well to water the farming products

loans.name: Mrs. Lean Khut Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan has eight people who live in Svay Sar village in Takeo province. They will each use a small piece of the loan for a different purpose to improve their businesses. All the other members have selected Mrs. Lean K. as the village bank president. She was born in 1975. She is a farmer who owns 2.3 hectares of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. She is a pig breeder, too. Now she has a problem because her pigs are too small to sell and she did not have enough money to support them. So to improve this business, Mrs. Lean K. is requesting a loan to buy pig food. Her husband, Mr. Koeun Yim, owns a rice mill at his home. With these businesses, they support four children who are all students in the local public school.

loans.use: To buy pig food

loans.name: H. Antoinette

texts.fr: D. H. Antoinette est née le 23 Mars 1972 à Adjohoun dans le département de l'Ouémé au Bénin. Mariée à LAWANI Arsel, un enseignant, Antoinette est mère d'un enfant qui est scolarisé. Il y a près de quinze ans que Antoinette  vit au quartier Kpondéhou à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Antoinette réside dans ce quartier avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple subvient ensemble aux diverses charges de la famille. Antoinette n'a fréquenté que l'école primaire, mais a appris la couture. Depuis une quinzaine d'année, Antoinette exerce cette activité. Mais de façon secondaire, Antoinette vend des tissus et divers autres produits (sucre, lait, biscuits, bombons, conserves, savons, papier hygiénique, etc.) devant son atelier de couture. Antoinette achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Antoinette avait obtenu une fois déjà de crédit auprès de ALIDé et a bien effectué le remboursement. Antoinette désire agrandir davantage son activité et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle ; raison pour laquelle Antoinette  sollicite pour une deuxième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé.
texts.en:
DOUCHE H. Antoinette was born March 23, 1972, in Adjohoun, in the Ouémé administrative district of Benin. Married to LAWANI Arsel, a teacher, Antoinette is the mother of one child, who is in school. For almost fifteen years she has lived with her husband and child in the Kpondéhou neighborhood of Cotonou, economic capital of Benin. The couple jointly pay the family's expenses. Antoinette did not go to school, but learned to sew, and she has been doing that for about fifteen years. As a secondary activity, Antoinette sells fabric and various other products (sugar, milk, cookies, candy, canned goods, soap, toilet paper, etc.) in front of her workshop. Antoinette buys her supplies in Dantokpa, international market of Benin. She has already received one loan from ALIDé and repaid it in full. She wants to expand her business and better satisfy her clientele, which is the reason she is seeking financial help from ALIDé a second time.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various products (sugar, milk, cookies, candy, canned goods, soap, toilet paper, etc)

loans.name: Janylkan

texts.en:
Janylkan M., 34, is married and is the mother of two school-age children: her daughter is 15 and her son is 12. She’s been married to Emilbek Risbaev for fifteen years. Janylkan is a very persistent, honest and optimistic woman who strives hard to provide her children with everything they need.

Janylkan works in wholesale and retail sales of vegetables and her husband supports her business by collecting goods from different regions. In the summer, when some kinds of goods perish more quickly, Janylkan works day and night to provide good-quality products to her loyal customers.

Janylkan started her business in 2000 with the sum of 1,000 KGS. Now, she earns the sum of 15,000 KGS monthly, which allowed her to purchase a small house in Sokuluk village (near Kyrgyzstan, the capital).

In May, 2010, Janylkan had a car accident and was injured - she hit her head and got a scar on her face. She spent a lot of money for surgery and treatment, which led to a decrease in her working capital. In spite of these complications, she is moving forward and applying for a loan. Using this loan, she plans to increase her current capital in order to purchase carrots to sell wholesale. It will allow her to reach the business level that she had before the accident.

In the future, Janylkan wants to buy a truck to deliver her products in a cheaper and easier way. She also plans to buy sheep for fattening and resale. These investments will help her to support her children and give them a good education.

loans.use: To purchase carrots to sell wholesale

loans.name: Josiane Clarisse

texts.fr: A. Josiane Clarisse est née le 05 Mars 1969 et vit depuis quarante et un an à Ayélawadjè à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Josiane Clarisse est mariée à MICHOZOUNOU Jean, un enseignant. Le couple a quatre enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Josiane Clarisse vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Pour venir en aide à son mari dans les diverses charges du ménage, Josiane Clarisse vend du charbon de bois et de façon secondaire, de l'huile d'arachide à son domicile. Josiane Clarisse a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Dans le but d'élever le niveau de son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Josiane Clarisse sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un troisième prêt.
texts.en:
Josiane Clarisse A. was born on March 5, 1961; she has been living in the Ayélawadjè district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, for 41 years. Josiane Clarisse is married to Jean Michozounou, a teacher. They have four children, all attending school. Josiane Clarisse lives together with her husband and children. To help her husband support the family, Josiane Clarisse sells charcoal and, as a secondary activity, peanut oil out of her home. Josiane Clarisse already received two loans in the past and repaid them well. With the goal of expanding her business and better respond to customer demand, Josiane Clarisse is seeking a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing bags of charcoal and cans of peanut oil

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim is a 38-year-old married woman, resided in a city called Multan famous in Pakistan for its history. She owns a small house of two rooms and has been living in it with her family for over fifteen years.  

A very caring lady, Shamim stays at home to do her best for her family. She cooks food for her family and takes care of her children. This is her daughter who is seated next to her. She has a dream to send her to school to make her future bright.
  
Shamim's husband's name is M. L. and he runs an embroidery business. He makes embroidered dresses and displays them in his boutique which is located in the market. He has two helpers in his shop who help him in completing more varieties of embroidery. He has been doing this work for over ten years. He purchases the cloth from the cities Lahore and Faisalabad because these two cities are famous for their textiles and new designs as well.  

Shamim has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan amount he will purchase embroidery materials such as beads, colored thread and especially cloth of different sorts in bulk, making them unique by  doing embroidery on them. She hopes that this investment will prove successful for her husband’s business and he will be able to sell more of his collection to his customers and generate good profit from it.

loans.use: purchase embroidery materials for her husband's embroidery business

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a married woman who sells new clothes to her neighbors at her home. With the Kshs. 40,000, she wants to buy more new clothes. She has been in the business for over 10 years. Her main challenge is seasonality as she sells less when there are no important occasions such as weddings and also in the middle of the month when her customers have exhausted their monthly salaries.

She owns her home with electricity but does not have piped water. Her greatest expense is food. She decided to work with Yehu so as to obtain a loan. Her aspiration is to grow economically and open a shop where she can sell her clothes from.

loans.use: Buy more clothes

loans.name: Thu

texts.en: Thu T. N. is 52 years old and has one son who is of working age. She opened a shop four years ago that sells handicraft products, fine art bamboo-made products and ceramics. Her shop is crowded with clients and it creates a stable income so that she can manage her family's needs. A client of SEDA since 2007, she is always in a good repayment situation. Currently, she wants to borrow 7,194,000 VND to invest in her shop.

loans.use: to invest in her  shop.

loans.name: Jesus Santa

texts.es:
Jesús Santa C. Y.
Jesús Santa es de 51  años de edad, casada, no  tiene hijos, es trabajadora domestica, y actualmente se dedica como comerciante, en la actividad tiene 12 años de experiencia, solicita su tercer crédito, para surtir su negocio para la venta, el cual es una inversión rentable, sus referencias personales indican que es una persona responsable y trabajadora, por tal motivo no tendrá inconvenientes para pagar el préstamo.
texts.en: Jesús Santa Chaclán Y. is 51 years old, married, and does not have children.  She works hard as a housekeeper, but she is also a merchant who has 12 years of business experience.  Jesús is requesting her third loan so that she can restock her retail business since this opportunity is a profitable investment.  Her personal references indicate she is a responsible and hardworking individual, so she should not have any problems repaying this loan.

loans.use: Operating capital to acquire more merchandise

loans.name: Ntungamo Tukore Twetugure B, Kihihi Group

texts.en: N. Edward, age 60, has been running an agriculture enterprise for over 20 years, and is still at his best proving to fellow agriculturalists in the area that he can make it. Having been inspired by close friends and good market prices for quite some time, hardworking Edward got a vision to grow bananas and coffee and also to venture into livestock farming. He has been farming in Nyakirehe, Kihihi, earning 240,000 Ugandan shillings on a monthly basis out of his produce sales. The main drawback is harvesting low quantities and therefore, with this loan, he will purchase agricultural inputs like manure and more coffee seedlings. This will make it possible for him to get more output and to earn more revenue to care for his family of eight children and a wife at home. It will go further towards his goal of expanding his business and educating his children who are still in school.

loans.use: Purchase farm inputs like manure

loans.name: C4607 Bamporeze Group

texts.en:
Emilienne is 32 years old and she is married.  Emilienne is the leader of a group called 'Bamporeze' which is in the business of selling shoes, this is their fifth year in this business.  The business hours are from 8 am to 6 pm every day.

Emilienne and her team need to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a.  With this loan, Emilienne will expand her business through purchasing different styles of shoes for sale.  With these additional styles of shoes, this team will hopefully earn more profits which in turn will allow each member of this group to keep progressing and in addition to that, they will keep investing in their business for better financial stability.

loans.use: different styles of shoes for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy cartons of fish and meat

loans.name: Lucy Wangui

texts.en:
Lucy, age 34, is a dairy farmer. She has been in this business for a period of four years now and this is her primary business. She is the mother of three children and lives in the Gathangari area of Kiambu. 

She got to know about KADET Ltd through a friend who was already a member, and she has never borrowed from any other financial institution. With the loan she has applied for, she plans to buy another dairy cow so that she can increase milk yields. This increase will ensure a steady income for her family and herself. 

In future, Lucy plans to open a retail shop so as to diversify her trade. She hopes also to educate her children in the best schools possible.

loans.use: To buy a second dairy cow for increased milk production

loans.name: Alex Manuel

texts.es:
Alex de 23 años, tiene un pequeño Cyber-cabinas desde hace años para poder solventar sus gastos de la universidad. Vive en una zona urbana llamada Orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento descubrieron muchas flores y en la actualidad hay un parque de estas flores. 

Comenzó a investigar en el sector donde vive si había algún cyber ya que su sector es urbano y el nunca encontraba un lugar donde hacer sus trabajos. Compro algunas computadoras con sus ahorros y le instalo los programas para que funcionen como el quería.  En la actualidad trabaja desde las 09h00am todos los días ofreciendo la hora del internet a $ 0.60 y servicio de cabinas telefónicas. 

Con el préstamo quiere aumenta su negocio por eso quiere comprar computadoras. En el futuro quiere expandir el negocio y comprar maquinas a un volumen alto.
texts.en:
Alex is 23 years old and has had a small Cyber-cabin (internet café) for a few years to help meet his university-related expenses. He lives in an urban zone called Orquídeas - named "orchids" because when this area was discovered it had many flowers and today there is a park of orchids.

He began to investigate this business idea in his neighborhood by determining if there were an internet business in this urban area as he never found a place where he could do his work. He bought some computers with his savings and installed software so that the computers would function as he wished. Today he works from 9:00 AM every day offering internet service for $0.60 and also telephone service.

With the loan he wishes to expand his business so he wants to buy computers. In the future he wants to expand the business and buy machines in high volumes.

loans.use: Buy computers

loans.name: Yana

texts.en:
Yana is married, with two children. She sells clothing at the main open market in Novomoskovsk town. Yana has been in this business for 9 years. Her hard-working habits and enthusiasm encourage other market venders to continue their businesses in spite of difficult economic times.

Yana has used micro loans before and found them very helpful for her business development. She would like to borrow 15,000 Grivnas to purchase more winter inventory. Yana's business goal is to start a second location to increase sales.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Siguidolo Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Siguidolo sont des femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 38 ans, 4 enfants et vivent avec leurs maris et enfants dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Coulibalyla, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et font la restauration, le commerce de poissons, de l’arachide et des galettes.                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe Siguidolo sont à leur premier prêt solidaire avec Soro Yiriwaso.                                                                          
SITAN F. s’approvisionne hebdomadairement en intrants de galettes avec les grossistes du marché de Dioïla. Elle effectue sa vente au niveau du village, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 25 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer le prêt, et effectuer les dépenses personnelles.
texts.en:
The members of the Siguidolo group are married women, averaging 38 years old and four children each. They live with their husbands and children in traditional extended families in the village of Couibalyla, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrative district of the Republic of Mali).

The women met through family and neighborhood connections and all work in food preparation, selling fish, peanuts and flat cakes. 

This is their first group loan with Soro Yiriwaso. Sitan F. buys the ingredient for flat cakes weekly from wholesalers at the Dioïla market. She sells her goods locally in the village, for cash and on credit, to customers who are both men and women. Sitan expects to make an average monthly profit of 25,000 CFA francs which will be used to pay back the loan and for personal expenses.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for flat cakes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase children's clothing, towels, jeans, and jackets

loans.name: Ishenbubu's Group

texts.en:
Ishenbubu I. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Kochkor, a nice village in the Isykul region. She is 48 and married. Together with her husband, she is bringing up two sons who are both students. 

In order to earn money, the family breeds cattle and then resells them at a higher price after fattening. They started this activity three years ago with an initial investment of 20,000 KGS. With money received from the loan, Ishenbubu wants to purchase more cattle for breeding. 

In the future she wants to build a house in Bishkek for her sons.


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Melvin Salvador

texts.es: Melvin Salvador de 25 años, vive en el barrio Carlos Fonseca. Es hombre soltero casado. Su actividad es brindar el servicio de barbería, hace más de 4 años que tiene este negocio,  el joven comenzó como ayudante y así fue que aprendió este medio de vida debido a su pobreza y la necesidad de buscar el alimento. La mayoría de sus clientes son jóvenes adultos, adolescentes y público en general. Dentro de sus planes futuros esta siempre segur con este negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de cepillos, peines, herramientas, tijeras, guantes entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Melvin Salvador, age 25, lives in the Carlos Fonseca neighborhood.  He is a single man.  His business is providing barber services.  He has had this business for four years.

This young man started as a helper.  He learned this way of life due to his poverty and the need to look for food.

Most of his customers are young adults, adolescents, and the general public.  Among his plans for the future is to always continue with this business.

The loan he is requesting is to buy brushes, combs, tools, scissors, and gloves, among other things.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mrs. Meas Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Sixteen people have requested a village bank loan.  Each borrower will use their portion of the loan for a different purpose, to improve the family's standard of living.  The members have selected Mrs. Meas to be a village bank president. 

Mrs. Meas,  who was born in 1972, sells vegetables and fruit door-to-door to earn some profit to support her family. Now she has a problem because her motorcycle for transportation is broken. To improve this condition, Mrs. Meas is asking for a loan to fix the motorcycle.  With the rest of the loan she is going to buy some piglets for breeding to start a new business. Her husband, Mr. Vuthy, is a construction worker. They have five children.  One is a seamstress in garment factory,  three attend local public school, and the youngest one is 3 months old.

loans.use: to fix the motorcycle

loans.name: 51 Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Gia Đỗ Thị, a 53-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá, is the leader of a three-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 51 Quảng Hưng (18.4.51 Quảng Hưng).

Gia, who is married and has four grown children, has been raising cattle for sale for over 10 years, earning approximately 2.000.000 VND a month. In 2009, she joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 3.079.800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women that was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future, she is now requesting her third loan for 6.000.000 VND for the same purpose. Gia plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1. L. Thị Thảo (66) is a 41-year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

2. N. Thị Tình (67) is a 36-year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. Gia Đỗ Thị (68) là 53 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá. Gia là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 51 Quảng Hưng (18.4.51 Quảng Hưng). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán. Gia thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Gia kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND. Vào 2009, Gia đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Gia đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.079.800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. L. Thị Thảo (66) là 41 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 2. N. Thị Tình (67) là 36 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *L. ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. ."

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Proserfina

texts.en:
Proserfina A. is from the village of Salay, Misamis Oriental. She is 61 years old and separated from her spouse. To make a living, Proserfina owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling canned goods, snack foods, beverages, shampoo, soap and biscuits in the local community. Proserfina has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Proserfina joined Kiva partner, HSPFI ,to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Proserfina is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products such as snack foods and canned goods. This loan will be her third from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as snack foods and canned goods

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace B. is thirty eight years old, and married. Her husband runs a tailor shop and they have four children aged between twelve years old and three years old whom they hope to give good education at the university level.  Her business is located at a residential area known as Mukuru Kwa Njenga and she is served by the Kitengela branch. She sells kales, cabbages, tomatoes, onions and others to the local people a business she has engaged in for the last twelve years. She says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is financial constraints. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more fruits and vegetables to grow her business. She describes herself as an ambitious and humble lady.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to grow her business.

loans.name: Maria Elsa

texts.es:
María Elsa tiene 31 años D. edad.  Vive en una zona D. Jayanca   donD. solo cuentan con  servicios básicos (agua y energía eléctrica). Jayanca es un poblado  pequeño D. aproximadamente  100 familias, esta ubicado a50 minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

María Elsa cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio la cual es atendida por ella misma. Allí ofrece en venta a los vecinos y clientes D. la zona diversos productos D. consumo diario, entre productos D. primera necesidad, abarrotes y bebidas. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida.  Con estas actividades ella solventa sus gastos diarios.
 
Además desD. hace 3 años se dedica también a la cría animales menores, especialmente aves, en algunos corrales situados cerca a su domicilio. El los alimenta D. granos y pastos naturales, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel D. desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentemente visitan la zona en donD. resiD..

María Elsa desea adquirir más animales y alimento balanceado para ampliar su negocio y percibir mayores ingresos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 800 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Elsa es una persona bastante empeñosa y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para poder mejorar la su calidad.
texts.en:
María Elsa is 31 years old. She lives in an area of Jayanca that only has basic services like running water and electricity. Jayanca is a small village of about 100 families, located about 50 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.
María Elsa has a small shop set up in her house, which she runs herself. In it she offers her neighbors and other area customers a wiD. range of products, including household essentials, groceries, and beverages. The business does very well and she is able to cover her daily expenses.
In addition, for the past three years she has been raising small animals, especially barnyard fowl, in some enclosures near her home. She feeds them grains and grasses, and when they're big enough she sells them to dealers who often pass through the area where she lives.
María Elsa would like to acquire more animals and balanced feed in order to expand her business and increase her income, so she's requesting a loan of 800 soles from Edpyme Alternativa that will help her reach her goals.
Elsa is a hard-working person and her greatest wish is to keep growing as a businesswoman to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more barnyard fowl and feed for them.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is divorced and has two children. She sells cooking utensils and cloth at Kwaprow. Ekua uses her income see to the well-being of her home. She will use the loan to purchase cloth for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to save to build a shop.

loans.use: to purchase cloth for resale.

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Saroeun and her husband are farmers. In addition, Saroeun’s husband also builds wooden houses. The couple has been married since 1999 and has four sons. Three are in school and another one is still young. The family lives in a village across the Mekong River and about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Saroeun is asking for a loan of $600 to purchase a motorized hand tiller.

Photo: Saroeun is standing next to the motorized hand tiller which she wanted to buy, but she does not yet have the money to purchase it. She has asked for the loan to pay for purchasing.

loans.use: To purchase a motorized hand tiller.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin, aged 25 is married to Damaris and are blessed with one child.  He sells handicrafts and also does drawing and painting which he has been doing for two years.  The business earns him a monthly income of KES.9,000.

This is his first loan term with KADET LTD with which he intends to purchase handicrafts worth KES.14,000 and the rest he will use for drawings and paintings.  Edwin will use the anticipated profits to educate his child and hopes to start exporting the handicrafts in future.

loans.use: To buy handicrafts for sale

loans.name: Mariela Del Carmen

texts.es: Mariela se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Tiene más de 4 años en su negocio. Su negocio dio inicio porque no tenía la oportunidad de proporcionarle a su familia ingresos diariamente, fue con muy poco capital que logro empezar este medio de vida. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de ropa en general, calzado, perfumes, lápiz labial y más productos. En un futuro quiere ver a sus hijos profesionales y que no pasen por el trabajo duro como ella lo ha hecho.
texts.en:
Mariela sells general merchandise.  She’s been in business for over four years.  Her business started because she did not have the opportunity to provide her family with daily income.  She started this way of life with very little capital.  

The reason for the loan is to buy clothing in general, footwear, perfume, lipsticks and more products.  In the future, she’d like to see her children become professionals so that they won’t have to work as hard as she has had to.

loans.use: to buy clothing, footwear, perfume, lipsticks and more products.

loans.name: Charya

texts.en:
Charya (pictured above) is a weaver, while her husband is a driver for a company. The couple has been married since 2008 and has one young son. They live on an island located fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Charya is applying for a loan of $500 to assist her brother, who is a teacher, in buying a motorbike for transportation to his teaching job.

loans.use: To assist her brother, who is a teacher, in buying a motorbike to for transportation to work.

loans.name: Fight For Poor Group

texts.en:
Hawa is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She is fifty years old and was born in Yoni village. She is married to a nurse, and the couple has four children, one of whom is still attending primary school. For over ten years now, Hawa has been selling palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), foofoo (a food made out of cassava roots) and groundnuts.

Hawa and her group members have applied for a loan from SMT, with 1,000,000 SLL to go to each member. Hawa will use her share of the loan to buy gallons of palm oil, foofoo and groundnuts in bulk. With the help of this loan, Hawa’s group will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy gallons of palm oil, foofoo and groundnuts in bulk.

loans.name: Gulsara's Group

texts.en:
Gulsara, 49, is leader of this group. She has been working in art for 20 years of her life. Her hard work was repaid when she was promoted as a director of the museum where she worked for the most part of her career. While she invested all her abilities and skills in art, Gulsara’s husband was an experienced herdsman, who resold the best cattle in the town. Soon his income allowed him to broaden the household by purchasing more and more livestock. Currently, cattle breeding generates 3,000 soms per month. Gulsara says cattle needs extremely careful treatment including good temperature, food and water. She considers clover the best option. It’s useful for livestock and can be stored for a long time. The purpose of Gulsara’s loan is to buy clover for livestock.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan.

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase clover.

loans.name: Jessebel

texts.en:
Jessebel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling dried shrimps and fish in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years. Jessebel earns additional income from fermented shrimps. She is borrowing 15,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy shrimps and fish to sell.

Jessebel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy shrimps and fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cosmetics and household goods

loans.name: Amartuvshin

texts.en: Amartuvshin is 28 years old lives and with his parents and sister in a house in the Tosontsengel province of Mongolia. He started his business selling livestock to meat traders in 2010. He plans to continue his business operation and expand his business scope in his home town. He also plans to buy land and a yurt for his personal use and business development. He is a diligent man who says "I want to make my business successful with this bank loan. My dreams are to buy a car and have a successful business. I think I am on my way to accomplish my dreams." He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase livestock for his business.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Bayanmunkh

texts.en:
Bayanmunkh is 36-years-old and lives with his wife and two children in Mongolia. His two daughters both attend kindergarten. He has been driving a taxi for one year and his wife runs a tailoring business. He is a very diligent person who always cares about his family's wellness.
 
Recently Bayamunkh has purchased a small sized piece of land in the suburban area of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Now he is planning to build a house on his land but he lacks the money lack to build his new house. The loan he is requesting will be used to purchase construction materials to start building the family house on the land he has just purchased.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to start building a family house on the land he has just purchased.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Jesusa has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. 

Jesusa has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Jesusa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: María Evangelista

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Aníbal San Andrés se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi (Portoviejo), conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María, tiene 54 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre  de la cual tiene cinco hijos ya todos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive en su casa. Su marido es comerciante.

Ella se dedica al comercio, vende artesanías como sillas, muebles y adornos para el hogar, ella compra en Montecristi a los artesanos de esta ciudad y luego una o dos veces por semana lleva a entregar a Guayaquil y otras ciudades donde son apreciados estos productos y donde vende  a muy buen precio. La Señora María es también muy inteligente ya que una vez que está en estas ciudades compra ropa, bisutería y utensilios de cocina los mismos que lleva a vender por su ciudad natal, lleva en este negocio por más de 20 años y siempre le ha ido muy bien ya que tiene clientes fijos.

Este nuevo crédito lo va a emplear en comprar artesanía como sillas, muebles y adornos para el hogar para llevar a entregar a Guayaquil. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que recibe de la institución.
  
Su sueño  tener un camión para llevar sus productos a otros lugares del país.
texts.en:
The Community Bank Aníbal San Andrés meets every fifteen days in the Canton Montecristi (Portoviejo), known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts that are recognized on a national and international level.  It is the home of the famous straw hats.  

In this place we met the lady María, who is 54 years old of age, and is in a common law marriage from which she has five children, already all of legal age, one of whom still lives in at home.  Her husband is a merchant.  

She sells crafts such as chairs, furniture and decorations for the home.  She buys them in Montecristi from the artisans of this city and then one or two times a week she brings them to Guayaquil and other cities where these products are appreciated and where she sells them at a very good price.  María is also very intelligent since once she is in these cities, she buys clothes, costume jewelry and kitchen utensils which she brings back to her hometown to sell.  She has been in this business for more than 20 years and it has always gone very well since she has regular customers.  

She will use this new loan to purchase handicrafts such as chairs, furniture, and decorations for the home to deliver to Guayaquil.  She has been with the Communal Bank since its start and she likes it for the benefits that she receives from the institution.  

Her dream is to have a truck to use to carry her products to other places in the country.

loans.use: to purchase chairs, tables, and decorations for the home.

loans.name: Alba Marina

texts.es: Alba Marina se dedica a la venta de ropa, tiene más de 4 años en este negocio. Ella es una persona muy dedicada la vida es un regalo, ya que está feliz por haber encontrado muchos caminos por elegir y el desenvolverse en lo que más le gusta. En un futuro desea ampliar su negocio, pero necesita mucho capital para realizar este sueño. Este será su primer crédito para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, trajes y vestidos.
texts.en:
Alba Marina has been selling clothes for more than four years. She is a devoted person who believes life is a gift. Alba is very happy that she has had many paths to choose from where she can develop according to what she enjoys the most. In the future she wants to expand her business, but she needs more capital in order to fulfill this dream.

This will be her first loan and she will use the money to buy trousers, shirts, skirts, suits, and dresses.

loans.use: to buy trousers, shirts, skirts, suits, and dresses.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the last two years. He is 42 years old, married to Wambui and they have three school-going children.  

Jackson was introduced to KADET through one of our existing clients and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy farm supplies and to pay for labor.

In the future, Jackson hopes to improve his farming methods and become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: San Salvador Group

texts.es:
El comité “San Salvador“se formo con la union D. varias vecinas D. la ciudad D. Mariano Roque Alonso. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, pero también hacen actividades en conjunto, con las cuales fomentan la unión D. todas.
Paola es una D. las miembros. Ella se dedica a la venta D. bebidas D. todo tipo, nos comenta que este negocio la ayudado mucho, pues gracias a el tiene los ingresos necesarios para cubrir los gastos D. la casa y la manutención D. la familia. Uno D. sus sueños es poder seguir creciendo con su negocio y D. esa forma poder seguir ayudando en la casa.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. cervezas, vinos, licores, whiskys y demás tipos D. bebidas, con las cuales podrá abastecerse y cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The San Salvador communal bank was formed when several neighbors in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso came together. All of the members of the bank have their own independent businesses, but they also conduct some of their activities in common which promotes the unity of all.

Paola is one of these members. She sells all kinds of drinks and states that this business has helped her a great deal since thanks to it she has the necessary income to cover her household expenses and support her family. One of her dreams is to be ale to continue expanding her business and thus continue helping her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy beer, wine, liquor, whisky and other types of drinks so that she is able to meet her customers' demands.

loans.use: to buy beer, wine, liquor and whisky for later sale

loans.name: Francisco Daniel

texts.es:
El municipio de Telica se caracteriza por tener varios puestos de pulpería y son muchas las personas que visitan dichos puestos para las compras necesarias para el hogar.

El señor Francisco Danielposee su propia pulpería y actualmente está solicitando un crédito para la compra de productos como arroz, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, jabón y ace para continuar ofertándolos en su pulpería. De igual manera, con el crédito comprará algunos medicamentos para mejorar la salud ya que ha estado afectado y requiere la compra de dichos productos.

Espera en que Ceprodel le brindará el apoyo y así surtirá su pulpería para beneficio propio y de los clientes.
texts.en:
The municipality of Telica is known for its grocery stalls and many people visit these to buy necessary home products.

Mr. Francisco Daniel has his own stall and is requesting a loan to buy products such as rice, oil, sugar, toilet tissue, soap and bleach so he can have them on hand always.  He also plans to use the loan to buy medicines to improve his health since he has been ill and needs them.

He hopes he can count on Ceprodel for the support so he can stock his store for his and his customers' benefit.

loans.use: To pay for medical visits and exams and buy medicines.  Also to buy rice, sugar, oil, toilet tissue, soap and bleach.

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Mrs. Em, 34, is pictured above in her house. She is a local farmer and hog-raiser living in the Baray district. She has a common-law marriage, and her husband trades animals in the provincial marketplace. Together, the couple earns an income of $6.00 per day from their businesses. Mrs. Em has saved some of this income and kept it for future business. She’s a hopeful mother who always takes care of the family and maintains her business growth. 

With a loan of  3,000,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) from Kiva partner HKL, Mrs. Em will buy a rice-husking machine for her family's use and to provide rice-husking services to local villagers in exchange for money. She will also use the loan to purchase 10 heads of piglets to raise in her wooden pigpen. In the future, she hopes to be able to attain a better quality of life and provide her children with further education.

loans.use: to buy a rice-husking machine and piglets

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Madame Awa est une femme âgée de 28 ans. Elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois depuis le 22 octobre 2007. Elle fait partie du groupe de solidarité "BOK JOM"

Elle fait du petit commerce de tissus et de parfums. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d'activité pour l'avoir menée depuis plusieurs années.

Avec son nouveau crédit de 500.000 francs cfa elle va renforcer son activité de vente de tissus et parfums pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. 

Son objectif est de renforcer ses revenus financiers et de participer à la prise en charge de son fils.
texts.en:
Ms. Awa is 28 years old, married, and has one child. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois (local village fund group) since 22 October 2007. She belongs to the "Bok Jom" solidarity group.

She runs a small business selling fabric and perfume. She has gained lots of experience in this field, having run this business for several years.

With her new loan of 500,000 francs CFA, she is going to strengthen her fabric- and perfume-selling business in order to better satisfy her clientele.

Her goal is to increase her income and contribute to the care of her son.

loans.use: To buy fabric and perfume.

loans.name: Sururu

texts.en:
Sururu is a 32-year-old married man with two children, one of whom attends school while the other is still young for school. His wife is a business lady who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. He owns a house with electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for his family and school fees for his child. 

Sururu has operated a butchery shop business for the past four years. His potential clients are the local area residents. He faces a major challenge of seasonality. He dreams of expanding his business into a well furnished butchery in the future.

With the KES 20,000, he wants to purchase two meat cows for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access funds to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase two meat cows for resale.

loans.name: Kanara Rice Farmers Growers Group

texts.en:
Johnson is a hardworking married man with four children aged 16, 13, 9 and 4 years. He lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in farming, where he grows rice, tomatoes and maize.

He started his farming business to improve his standards of living. He earns additional income from a saloon business. He hopes to own a good commercial house and to educate his children; however, his main challenges are weather changes and price fluctuations. He is a member of Kanara Rice Farmers Growers Group, where members guarantee each other in order to access credit.

Johnson is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and pay his workers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay his workers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Set up a fish processing and selling unit

loans.name: Penina

texts.en: Penina is twenty five years old.  She lives in a small seaside village with her husband and two children.  Penina’s husband does not have a job and thus the whole family relies on Penina’s beach fales for income.  Her beach fales are small, open huts with thatched roofs built in the style of traditional Samoan homes.  Penina’s fales sit on one of Samoa’s beautiful, white sandy beaches.  As there is competition from other beach fale owners in the area, Penina is applying for a loan to do some renovations and upgrade the services she provides to her guests.

loans.use: to renovate beach fales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Susan would like to purchase a pig.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe is a hard-working woman from the town of Apodaca in the state of Nuevo Leon. She is separated and has four children, three of them married and the youngest still studying and in the house. To help the youngest with school expenses so he can continue studying, two years ago Guadalupe started her own business selling shoes. She started selling among neighbors and family, but now has a solid number of clients. Sometimes she has the help of her son, who delivers client orders .

To cover the demand for her shoes and continue offering a good service Guadalupe is applying for a US$ 325 loan. She will use the loan to buy more merchandise, and promises to pay the loan back in 4 months. Guadalupe is very grateful for the opportunity that you give her to grow with her business.

Translated by Nathan, Kiva Volunteer.

Guadalupe es una mujer muy trabajadora, es originaria de la localidad de Apodaca, Nuevo León, está separada y tiene cuatro hijos, tres de ellos ya casados, sólo el más pequeño aún vive con ella y está estudiando. Para apoyarlo con los gastos de su escuela y que pudiera continuar Guadalupe inició su propio negocio con la venta de calzado hace dos años, empezó entre sus vecinos y familiares pero ahora ya tiene un buen número de clientes y en ocasiones cuenta con la ayuda de su hijo para repartir los pedidos.

Para poder cubrir la demanda por sus productos y ofrecer un buen servicio Guadalupe está solicitando un préstamo de $ 325 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en 4 meses. Guadalupe agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas de crecer con su negocio.

loans.use: Buy more merchandise for her shoe-selling business

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a loving mother who, thanks to an excellent seasoning that possess, sells ka-bobs in the front door of a market. She has three young children whom are the source of her daily motivation, her motivation to continue working every day and night. Thanks to her work she has become very popular, such that at times she needs more space in order to fully attend her clients. For this reason she would like to purchase a small cart for frying potatoes and other things. This will enable her in time to open her own restaurant. Working like this she will be able to complete the construction of her house. They now live in the house of a friend which they pay rent to. With the crystallization of her desire, the construction of her home and a quick move will better the lives of her children and allow them to free themselves to happiness and liberty. The value that she asks for is $200, with this amount she will be able to begin to organize these new goals and with your help, to achieve them in little time.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

Martha, es una amorosa madre de familia, que gracias a la excelente sazón que posee se dedica a la venta de anticuchos en la puerta de un mercado, tiene 3 menores hijos, que son su fuente de motivación diaria, para seguir trabajando todos los días por las tardes.Gracias a esta actividad se ha hecho muy conocida, de manera que a veces necesita un espacio más amplio para poder atender a sus clientes, por lo cual ha pensado en comprarse una salchipapera (carrito para freír papas y demás), para poder aperturar en determinado momento su propio restaurante.De esta manera podrá concluir con la construcción de su casa ya que ahora viven en casa de un familiar, al cual le pagan el alquiler del mismo. Con la cristalización de su deseo además de culminar con la construcción de su vivienda para mudarse pronto incrementará la calidad de vida de sus pequeños a fin de que estos puedan desenvolverse con mucha alegría y libertad por los rincones de su hogar.El monto que solicita es de 200 dólares, con los cuales podrá empezar a estructurar estas nuevas metas y que con tu colaboración podrá observarlas en poco tiempo

loans.use: Purchase of a small cart to fry potatoes

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio is 30 years old, he is separated and has a 1 year old daughter who is cared for by his ex-wife.

Antonio is a photographer: he began to work with his father in the business from when he was very small, until he managed to establish himself independently 7 years ago. He acquired the knowledge, skills and techniques of the profession when he used to accompany his father to social evens where they required his services.

Toady he has managed to establish his own business and he has very good clientèle: he recounts that all is going well and he is very happy with his profession. Antonio, thanks to his work, is also managing to meet all the expenses of university, where he in the third year of a law degree.

He needs a loan to buy film for his camera, photo alums and also blank CDs, which he already uses to record different social and family events such as weddings, birthdays, end-of-year celebrations etc.

Translated by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Antonio tiene 30 años, es separado y tiene una hija de 1 año que quedó al cuidado de su ex-esposa.

Antonio es fotógrafo, empezó a trabajar con su padre en la profesión desde muy pequeño, hasta que logró independizarse hace 7 años. Adquirió los conocimientos y las técnicas de la profesión cuando acompañaba a su padre a los eventos sociales en donde requerían de sus servicios.

Hoy día ha logrado montar su propio negocio y tiene muy buena clientela, él cuenta que le va muy bien y que está muy feliz con su profesión. Antonio además, gracias a su trabajo, está logrando costear todos los gastos que demanda la universidad, en donde está estudiando el 3er. Año de la carrera de Derecho (Leyes).

Necesita el crédito para la compra de películas para su cámara fotográfica, álbumes de fotografías, además de CD vírgenes, ya que también realiza filmaciones de diferentes acontecimientos sociales y familiares, tales como bodas, cumpleaños, clausuras de fin de año, etc.

loans.use: Purchase camera film, albums, blank CDs

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Maria was born in the Huarochiri province in the department of Lima. She is married, has 4 children and is 37 years old. Currently her husband's work is temporary. He is a bricklayer and the money that he receives in exchange for his work is insufficient to cover all of the basic necessities. It is because of this that Maria maD. the decision to help with the expenses. She remembered that from the time she was very little her mother taught her that all work is dignified. It is due to this that she began to sell plants and natural products since the late 90s. Thanks to the good use of her earnings she has been able to make her business bigger and help with the expenses of the home.

Maria's dream is to have her own place to sell her items that is much bigger and more secure, as well as to acquire more merchandise to be able to fulfill the requests of her clients. This will enable her to have more money and to invest it in the most important thing for her and her family, the education of the children, so that they can finish their basic studies in primary and secondary school and continue with higher education so that they don't repeat the same history as EsteL..

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Conover, Kiva.org volunteer.

María nació en L. Provincia D. Huarochiri – Departamento D. Lima. Es casada, tiene 4 hijos y tiene 37 años D. edad. Actualmente el trabajo que tiene su esposo es eventual, realiza trabajos D. albañilería y el dinero que recibe a cambio es insuficiente para cubrir todas las necesidades básicas; es por ello, que Maria toma L. decisión D. colaborar con los gastos; recordó que desD. muy pequeña L. madre les enseño que todo trabajo es digno es por ello que empieza a vender plantas y productos naturales caseros desD. fines D. los años 90. Gracias al buen uso que le está dando a sus ingresos ha podido ampliar su negocio y ayudar con los gastos del hogar. El sueño D. María es contar con un puesto propio mucho más amplio y seguro, además D. adquirir más mercadería para poder cumplir con los pedidos D. sus clientes y que eso le permita tener mas dinero e invertirlo en lo mas importante par elL. y su familia, L. educación D. los hijos, para que ellos puedan concluir sus estudios básicos D. primaria y secundaria y seguir estudios superiores para que no se repita L. misma historia D. elL..

loans.use: To acquire merchandise for her plant and natural products business.

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en:
Nasiba C. is 24 years old. In spite of her young age, she is already the mother of two wonderful kids and is a real expert in her business.

Nasiba produces jewelry in the national style. She has been in this business for nine years already. Nasiba started as an assistant to a goldsmith; however, with time she has gained enough experience to be able to run her own shop. Nasiba’s husband is a lawyer; however, Nasiba’s business brings a substantial income to the family budget.

Nasiba has received loans from IMON for several years and has proven herself to be an honest client. Today Nasiba requests $1,000 to purchase input materials such as fragments, precious and semi-precious stones, and reagents, to use in manufacturing jewelry.

loans.use: To purchase materials such as fragments, precious and semi-precious stones, and reagents, for making jewelry

loans.name: Juana's Group

texts.en:
Nancy, Francisca, and Juana have been part of the community bank “Virgen de Cocharacas” for 4, 1, and 7 years respectively. In the community bank they have learned values, how to treat others with kindness, and how to have healthy relationships with their husbands and children.

Nancy is 37 years old. She is married and has four children. Nancy sells candies, toys, and school supplies. She buys products in bulk and sells them to smaller stores. She took over this business from her parents.

Francisca is 41 years old. She is married and has two children. Francisca lives in the district of Acosyinchos where she sells candy, fruit, and food in the school. In addition, Francisca has a small stO. where she sells food staples such as flour, rice, and sugar from her home. Francisca also makes typical breads that she sells in her stO..

Meanwhile, Juana is 52 years old. She is married and has two children. Juana sells vegetables, fruits, and other food staples from a kiosk located in front of her home.

Nancy, Francisca, and Juana need loans of 1000, 600, and 1400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying toys, rulers, notebooks, rice, sugar, flour, oil, potatoes, and vegetables.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest-earning savings account each associate has. Nancy, Francisca, and Juana plan to use their savings to make mO. capital available to their businesses. Their dreams are to own a larger stO., that their children will be professionals, and that they will have own their own homes.

loans.use: Nancy, Francisca, and Juana need loans of 1000, 600, and 1400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying toys, rulers, notebooks, rice, sugar, flour, oil, potatoes, and vegetables.

loans.name: Abibatou

texts.fr:
Located in COTONOU for more than 10 years, Mrs M. Abibatou is originally from the North of BENIN where she was born August 18, 1975. She is married and mother of 2 children. Right now she is living in SEKANDJI, a popular neighborhood in COTONOU with her husband and 2 children. Not far from her house she has rented a shop where she has set up her different products and clothing for children and men. M. Abibatou has already received four consecutive loans which she has always paid back. The demand for certain products, such as bags of rice, corn and wheat and other articles of clothing requires her to ask for a fifth loan to be able to diversify her business and satisfy the demands of her clientele.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Installée à COTONOU depuis plus de 10 ans, dame M. Abibatou est originaire du nord du BENIN où elle est née le 18 août 1975. Mariée, elle est mère de 2 enfants. Actuellement, elle vit à SEKANDJI, un quartier populaire de COTONOU avec son époux et ses deux enfants. Non loin de sa résidence elle a loué une boutique où elle a installé ses produits divers et également des articles vestimentaires pour enfants et pour hommes. M. Abibatou a reçu déjà quatre prêts successifs et elle s’est toujours bien comporté. La demande de certains produits tels que les sacs de riz, de maïs, de blé et autres articles vestimentaires l’oblige à solliciter son cinquième prêts dans le but de diversifier son activité et de satisfaire aux demandes de sa clientèle.

loans.use: purchase of 5 bags of rice, a ton of oil and articles of clothing

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos is 38 years old and he has been married to 35 year old Sonia for 17 years. From their union they have given birth to three children, now 16, 11, and 8 years old respectively. All of them are students and they still live with their parents.

Carlos said that he began selling 18 years ago, beginning work as an employee. But after 10 years as a prize for this dedication and sacrifice he obtained his independence. Today he has his own established company. Nevertheless he remembers that his beginnings were very hard because he made his routes on foot. At this time, he has his own truck that makes his work much easier. He carries merchandise of all the types there are: shirts, jeans, jerseys, jackets, etc. of many brands to different interior cities.

He has already achieved a good number of clients, who each time have a greater demand for his merchandise. It is for this opportunity that he needs a loan in order to complete all his orders.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Carlos tiene 38 años y está casado hace 17 años con Sonia que tiene 35 años. De la unión de ambos nacieron tres hijos que hoy tienen 16, 11 y 8 años respectivamente. Todos ellos estudian y aún viven con sus padres.

Carlos comenta que se dedica a la venta hace 18 años, comenzó a trabajar como empleado, pero hace 10 años como premio a esa dedicación y el sacrificio logró independizarse. Hoy día ya tiene su propia empresa formada, sin embargo recuerda que sus inicios fueron muy duros debido a que sus recorridos los hacía caminando.

Actualmente ya cuenta con una camioneta propia que le facilita mucho su trabajo. Lleva mercaderías de todo tipo como ser: remeras, jeans, championes, camperas,etc.de diversas marcas hasta distintas ciudades del interior.

Ya cuenta con buena cantidad de clientes por lo cada vez tiene mayor demanda de sus mercaderías. Es por eso que en esta oportunidad necesita de un crédito para cumplir con todos sus pedidos.

loans.use: To buy jackets, jeans, jerseys, etc.

loans.name: Policarpa

texts.es:
