Señora Policarpa M. Z. is a native of the city of Bluefields.  She is 60-years-old and is a single mother of 6 children.  Señora M. has sold butane gas for 15 years.  Her customers are people who live in her neighborhood and prefer her for offering good service.  Señora M. doesn't have enough capital to be able to purchase more cylinders of butane gas, and it is for this reason that she needs to buy 20 cylinders of butane gas at $16.25 each.  With this investment, she will be able to satisfy her clients' demand, which increases every day.Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer
La Sra. Policarpa M. Z. es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 60 años de edad, es madre soltera de 6 hijos. La Sra. M. vende gas butano hace 15 años, sus clientes son los habitantes de su barrio que la prefieren por brindar un buen servicio. La Sra. M. no cuenta con el suficiente capital para poder comprar más cilindros de gas butano y por esta razón necesita comprar 20 cilindros de gas butano a $ 16.25 dólares cada cilindro, con esta inversión podrá satisfacer a sus clientes que cada día aumenta.

loans.use: To purchase cylinders of butane gas

loans.name: Muhammad Ashraf

texts.en:
35-year-old Muhammad Ashraf, son of G. A., is one of the people who has returned to his own country, Afghanistan, after the Taliban regime. He currently lives in district Shewa of the Ningarhar province, and he has been working as a miller for the last four years.

Muhammad Ashraf is married and has four children. He cant solve all of his financial problems with his current income because it's about $100 (5000 Afghanis), so he thought about how to find a solution for his problems. When he heard about AFSG, he requested a loan of 50,000 Afghanis to buy some necessary equipments for his mill and raise his income through that. He is an expert man in this field, and it seems that he can achieve his target. He promised that he would repay this loan in 18 months.

loans.use: To buy some necessary equipments for his mill

loans.name: Jesabell

texts.es:
Together with her husbad Roger Chacon, who works as a FAMA salesperson, Mrs Castellon S. has established a small shop in her home. She sells clothes, shoes and cosmetics to her customers who pay in cash or in credit.

She has an eight year old child that attends second grade in elementary school. She directly takes care of her business and upon request, she also home delivers the products to her clients. Thanks to her efforts and hard work, Mrs Castellon Seballos’ customer-base has been steadily growing.

Today, she requests a loan in order to diversify her offer to include merchandise for children.

Mrs Castellon S.’ dream is to have a shop that will allow her to provide a better service to her customers and to improve the standard of living of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Castellon S. por esfuerzo propio y el de su marido Roger Chacon, quien labora como promotor de FAMA, han logrado establecer en su casa de habitación una tiendita de ropa nueva, zapato y cosmeticos, con clientelas de crédito y contado lo que ha venido fortaleciendo a trávez de trabajo y esfuerzo; hoy solicita un refinanciamiento para reforzar su pequeño negocio con oferta para niños. Tiene un niño de 8 años de edad, actualmente cursa su segundo grado de primaria. Su negocio es atendido personalmente por ella, ademas brinda atención a domicilio si el cliente así lo solicita; su sueño es montar una tienda que le permita garantizar condiciones para sus clientes y mejorar las condiciones de vida familiar.

loans.use: To diversify the products she sells and also includee merchandise for children

loans.name: J. Antonio

texts.es:
“Hello to the Kiva people that help other people. My name is J. Antonio H. González, I am retired and this is my house. Through this project I request a loan to be able to build a wall in front of my house and install a cement floor so that my wife and I may have more safety and comfort.”  Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer. 

“Hola gente de Kiva que se dedica ayudar a las demás personas, mi nombre es J. Antonio H. González soy pensionado y esta es mi casa, les pido por medio de este proyecto un préstamo para poder levantar una barda en el frente de mi casa y un piso de cemento para tener mas seguridad y comodidad  mi esposa y yo.”

loans.use: Build a wall and install a cement floor.

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en:
Augustina T. is a busy trader in the local market of Obuasi in the Ashanti Region of Ghana, where she sells smoked fish on top of a table in the market. She is 34 years old, married, and the mother of six children who are currently in school. Augustina has been in this business for the past six years, and she has earned enough to enable two of her children to complete junior high school.

However, Augustina does not have sufficient working capital to run and improve her business. With this loan, she wants to purchase additional stock to invigorate her business. She believes the loan will enable her to purchase good quality stock to upgrade her inventory. She would be grateful for that assistance.

Augustina belongs to the community group Isaiah Trust Group. The group members guarantee for one another as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase increased stock of smoked fish.

loans.name: Im

texts.en:
Mrs. Im H., 54, has a grocery sales business which she runs from her home. She also helps provide food to the people in her community. Mrs. Im H. started her business in 2004, and by now it has become profitable. As a result of her business activities, she typically makes around US$10 per day. 
To meet the growing customer demand, however, Mrs. Im H. would like to request a loan of US$700 to be able to expand her grocery inventory by adding more products.

loans.use: Purchase of products for a grocery store

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor S., married with three children and educated through Senior High, has prepared yam balls and sausage for sale for the past five years. Victor uses his income to pay school fees and other family expenses. His wife is a caterer.

Victor is requesting a loan to purchase more ingredients and supplies to increase food production to meet market demand. He plans to invest the new profits from his expanded operation back into his business.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients and supplies to increase food production to meet market demand.

loans.name: Yawo

texts.en:
Yawo B. is 39 years old and a married father. In the local language, Ewe, his first name indicates that he was born on a Thursday. Yawo lives in Wome, a small town approximately 130 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. Wome is situated in a lush and beautiful area of Togo near the border with Ghana and is somewhat isolated.

Yawo operates a taxi-moto business to take many residents of Wome to nearby villages. Yawo picks up passengers along the road and drops them off at their destination. His services are always in demand.

To better serve his clients, Yawo hopes to use this loan from Kiva to buy a newer, more comfortable motorcycle. With the profits he will earn with the new motorcycle, Yawo can better provide for his wife and children and save money to send them to school.

loans.use: Buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Mrs. Kong T. is a villager in Tbeng village in Kampong Speu province. She is a farmer who owns small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Cheun  Thuon, is a cow breeder. Because this business is going well, he wants to expand it; so Mrs. Kong T. decided to ask for a loan to buy one more cow for her husband's business. She hopes to increase her income after she sells the cow.  Mrs. Kong T. is 33 years old and the mother of six children, four of whom are attending the local school while the remaining two are too young to work or study because they are only one and four years old. Mrs. Kong T.'s husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy one more cow for her husband's breeding business.

loans.name: Anwar Ghulam Fareed Group

texts.en:
Anwar baji is a 38-year-old married woman and has lived in Borewala, Pakistan for the past 20 years. Her husband, G. F., drives a rented auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). He has 15 years of driving experience.

Anwar baji is a mother of nine children: six daughters and three sons. Her first three daughters are involved in a carpet-weaving business. Her eldest son is a cobbler. The others are free and don’t do anything. Anwar baji helps her daughters in their carpet-weaving business. They weave carpets based on orders that they collect from the carpet sellers. Anwar baji charges 4,000 Pakistani rupees (~ $50 USD) per carpet. 

Anwar baji successfully repaid her two previous loans from Asasah, a microfinance institute in Pakistan. Now she is applying again for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) for her husband so that he is able to get the full reward for his work. 

She is a the group leader of a group of women of her locality. Sugran baji wants a loan to buy mobile phones for her mobile phone shop. Parveen baji wants a loan to buy fertilizer to resell. Zahida baji wants a loan to repair her tractor. Another woman, also named Sugran baji, wants a loan to buy seasonal vegetables to sell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: "Baji," which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
El Sr.Daniel S. R. tiene 27 años de edad, vive en concubinato  con la Sra.Lilian Bogado,viven en el Barrio San Josè de Carapeguà y  tienen una hija de 3años de edad.
                   
                 Ambos desde muy jòven comenzaron a trabajar vendiendo remedios yuyos en el mercado de la ciudad de Asunciòn,viendo siempre buenos resultados y asi ivan  adquieriendo comodidades para  uso domèstico.

                  Gracias a su dedicaciòn al trabajo,lograron  construir para su casa  propia y contar con las  comodidades  bàsicas  para sobrevivvir.
 
                  Con el credito adquirido compraran coco .
texts.en:
Mr. Daniel R. S. is 27 years old and lives with his domestic partner, Ms. Lilian Bogado, in the San Josè de Carapeguà neighborhood. They have a 3-year-old daughter. They both started selling herbal remedies at a young age in the Asunciòn city market. Since they have always gotten great results, they have been able to pay for the household expenses. Thanks to their dedication to their work, they managed to build their own house, along with the basic amenities needed to survive. With this loan, they will purchase coconuts.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase coconuts

loans.name: Josephine B.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Josephina N. from Mbeya. She is married and has three children between the ages of 1 and 13. She is also responsible for supporting one dependent whose parents cannot care for her. 

Josephina has been running a genge business since 1999. "Genge" is the Swahili word a type of outside shop or stall. A genge is usually a very basic structure made of wood with a tin roof where the proprietor sells general items such as onions, tomatoes, chilli, oil, rice, and dried fish. It is the kind of place where local people send their children running to fetch something when they are in the middle of cooking the evening meal and don’t have time to go all the way to the market to buy the missing ingredient.

Josephina works at her business for 12 hours per day, 7 days per week, and is assisted by two employees. Josephina currently earns about $51 USD each month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $800 USD to purchase more sugar, kerosene, soap and cooking oil in bulk. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity of goods in order to get more profit from her business . Josephina thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more sugar, kerosene, soap and cooking oil in bulk

loans.name: Edmundo

texts.en:
"I started my business with a small farm. I till 1 hectare of land which I use to feed and clothe my family. Farming is very interesting work. It's really fulfilling when you see all your children able to attend classes in school because you can easily provide for their needs because you have a farm", says Edmundo M., a father of 9 children from Bunawan, Agusan del Sur.

Now, he is requesting a loan of PHP12,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy fertilizers and other farming products for his farm. The loan will help him protect his rice from insects and achieve the desired harvest from his farm.

CEVI is reaching out to more farmers, especially the poor, to sustain their livelihood. They help people start and maintain their own business too. CEVI gives their clients credit, training, and insurance coverage to help their small businesses grow.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, herbicides and other farming products.

loans.name: Anh's Group

texts.en:
Anh Thị Vân Nguyễn was born in 1984. She has a shop in the market. She lives with her husband and 2 young children. Her family has a monthly income of about 4.000.000 VND (224 USD). She wants to borrow 6.758.000 VND ( or 380 USD ) to buy clothing to re-sell in the market.

There are 4 other Fund participants in her group :,P> Hoạch Thị Nguyễn was born in 1953. She wants to borrow 6.322.000 VND ( or 380 USD ) to expand her confectionery.

Cúc Thị Nguyễn was born in 1946. She wants to borrow 6.322.000 VND ( or 380 USD ) to expand her stationery store.

Hoa Thị Nguyễn was born in 1970. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND ( or 282 USD ) to to buy pigs and chicken to raise.

Huyền T. Lương was born in 1974. She wants to borrow 654.000 VND ( or 37 USD ) to buy feed for her pig.

loans.use: to buy clothing to re-sell in the market

loans.name: Parveen Nazir Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Parveen baji has been a resident of the city of Borewala, Pakistan for the last 10 years. Borewala is famous for its shrines. Parveen baji couldn’t get education due to limited financial resources, but she made a commitment to herself that she will give her son a good education and a bright future.

Parveen baji sews clothes day and night and pays off the school fees of her son from the income. Her husband's name is N. A.; he operates a wood selling business. Parveen baji successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy wood to increase the profit of her husband.

She is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Mussarat baji and Raja kosar baji each want a loan to buy bed sheets to sell. Sakina baji wants a loan to change the body of her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Kaniz baji wants a loan to buy ice to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy wood for resale

loans.name: Bariatou

texts.fr: D. Bariatou est née en 1972 à BASSILA une ville du Nord du BENIN dans le Département de la Donga. Bariatou est mariée à YACOUBOU Mohame. Bariatou est mère de cinq (5) enfants dont quatre (4) garçons et une fille tous scolarisés. Bariatou réside avec sa famille à Suru Léré, un quartier très populaire de la ville de Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Bariatou vend devant son domicile des sacs de charbon de bois depuis douze (12) ans ainsi que de la nourriture (riz). C’est  dans le Centre et au  Nord du BENIN que Bariatou achète ses sacs de charbon. Quand au riz et condiments pour le préparer, Bariatou les achète à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. Bariatou a déjà eu quatre crédits de ALIDé ; crédits qu’elle a très bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu amener son activité à un stade supérieur. Aujourd’hui encore Bariatou sollicite un cinquième crédit de ALIDé pour augmenter le volume de son activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle sans cesse croissante.
texts.en:
D. Bariatou was born in BASSILA, a city of northern Benin and in Donga County. She is married to YACOUBOU Mohame and is the mother of five children, four boys and a girl who are all in school. Bariatou resides with her family in Suru Léré, a highly-populated district of the city of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. For twelve years, Bariatou has been selling sacks of charcoal, as well as rice, in front of her home. Central and northern Benin are where she purchases her sacks of charcoal. As for the rice and the condiments for cooking it, she purchases them at Dantokpa, the grand international marketplace of Benin. Bariatou has already had four loans from ALIDÉ and has indeed repaid them, having used them to raise her business to a higher level. Today, she's requesting a fifth loan from ALIDÉ to augment her business volume in order to respond better to the demands of her ever-increasing customer base.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy forty sacks of charcoal, a sack of rice, and ingredients that go into making tomato sauce

loans.name: Juana Rafaela

texts.es: La señora Juana Rafaela A., tiene la edad de 61 años, reside en el barrio Acahualinca en la capital de Managua, casada y con ochos hijos mayores de edad, su esposo es cadete de taxi, su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano, lleva cuarenta años en las ventas, el cual inicio con capital propio y con necesidad de invertir mas, con este préstamo quiere comprar materiales de construcción para terminar de construir su humilde casa y poder tener una casa digna. Sus planes en el negocio es seguir comprando pacas para ofertar a sus clientes la variedad de ropa a buen precio.
texts.en:
Juana Rafaela A. is 61 years old and she lives in the Acahualinca region of the capital city of Managua. She is married and has eight grown children. Her husband is a taxi driver and her business is selling second hand clothing. She has been selling for fourty years, a business she started with her own savings. She sees a need to invest further. This loan will be used to purchase construction materials to finish building her humble home so that she might have a dignified home. Her plans are to keep purchasing packages of clothing to provide her clients with the variety of clothing they seek at a good price.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to improve her home.

loans.name: Alfredo Antonio

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua, el señor Alfredo Antonio A. se dedica a laborar arduamente en su negocio de pulpería vendiendo diferentes tipos de productos los cuales comercializa muy alegremente en su localidad donde es visitado por sus clientes.

Es de importancia destacar que a pesar de las difíciles situaciones económicas que ha atravesado, ha logrado salir adelante y es por esta razón que hoy en día tiene muchas más ganas de mejorar su pulpería y para ello ha solicitado un crédito en Ceprodel para dar lugar a la compra de los productos para surtir el negocio y así percibir mejores ingresos en su negocio.
texts.en:
In the wholesale market in Managua, Mr. Alfredo Antonio works hard in the grocery business selling different types of products that are gladly sold to customers that visit there. It is important to note that in spite of the setbacks of the difficult economic situation, he has continued to move forward. For this reason today he has much desire to improve his grocery business. He is asking for a loan from Ceprodel to buy more products for his business. In this way he will provide revenue for his business.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products for his grocery business.

loans.name: Nyame Nhyira Group

texts.en:
Mary is 40 years old. She is married and has three children. They are all boys and are in school. Her husband is a trader who works hard to support his wife in talking care of the home. She sells food items such as maize, rice, plantain, cassava etc. She has been in this business for over fifteen years now. She says she sells at the market square during their market days. She wants a loan to increase her working capital so that her dream of buying goods in bulk can be achieved. In this way, she can supply to a large number of customers to increase her market size, hence increasing her profit margin to care for her children.

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Nyame Nhyira’ which literary means God’s Blessing. She is the one sitting in front in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and/or farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs for resale

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: El Señor Julio Pérez tiene 32 años de edad, soltero, habita en Villa del Carmen, vive con su madre en casa propia, trabaja en la Alcaldía de Villa del Carmen en el cargo e concejal desde hace seis meses, con muchos esfuerzo ha ido cambiando madera por paredes seguras, ladrillando  y realizando modificaciones por la gran falta de créditos que no le permite terminar su casa. Gracias al préstamo en Afodenic comprara materiales de construcción: cemento, hierro, ladrillo, zinc y otros materiales. Brindando seguridad y protección a su familia. Se siente contento por el apoyo y por la seguridad de lograr tener una casa digna.
texts.en:
Señor Julio Pérez is 32 years old, single, and lives in Villa del Carmen. He lives with his mother in his own home. He has worked in the city Hall of Villa del Carmen in the office and council for six months. With much effort he has worked changing wood to more secure walls, laying bricks and making modifications. But the severe lack of money does not permit him to finish his house. Thanks to the loan from Afodenic, he bought building materials such as: cement, iron, brick, zinc and other materials. He is anxious to offer security and protection to his family. He feels happy for the support and security to manage to have a worthy house.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy building materials for his house

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina and her family live in the small village of Sitio Anguapan Tumauini, Isabela. She is 44 years old and is married to Dominador, a 50-year-old farmer. They are blessed with two children who have finished high school but have not been able to pursue their college education due to lack of financial resources.

Catalina manages a duck-raising business in her village. She also sells rice to provide an additional source of income. She hopes that her business will grow and be able to provide sufficient income to meet her family's daily needs. Catalina also dreams of having a more stable livelihood project in order to improve their poor living conditions. She hopes that her loan proposal of 7,000 PHP will be approved to further maintain and expand the business she manages.

loans.use: As additional capital

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr:
MBTH/1339
aissatou S. est une commerçante âgée de 39 ans qui vit à mbour à 80km de dakar la capitale du senegal.sa principale activité est la vente de legumes .ce prêt lui servira d'accroitre son stock et de faire face à ses besoins quotidiens

loans.use: COMMERCE

loans.name: Rojo Group

texts.es:
El Grupo Rojo está conformado por Silvia Gabriela O. M., Jahiro Antonio Sevillana y Emma Ramira Sánchez M.. Ellos son provenientes de la zona 2 de Nindiri.

La coordinadora del grupo es Silvia Gabriela O. M. de 34 años de edad, ella desde hace dos años empezó en su hogar con el negocio de recargas y ventas de teléfonos de la compañía telefónica Movistar. O. a segura que ha tenido varias mejoras en su negocio gracias a los créditos  y desea que en un futuro no muy lejano esta sea una gran destruidora de celulares. 

Los otros integrantes del grupo son Jahiro Antonio Sevillana  de 40 años quien tiene un pequeño bar  y Emma Ramira Sánchez M. de 22 años quien vende licor. Todos ellos necesitan del crédito para invertir en la materia prima para su negocio.

loans.use: Para comprar telefonos y recarga

loans.name: Estebana De La Concepcion

texts.es: Estebana de la Concepción L. V. tiene la edad de 42 años, es una mujer casada. La actividad económica de Doña Estebana es una pulpería. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio. La ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda, ya que inicio para generar ingresos para su familia. Los propósitos de Estela para con su negocio son de darle al cliente lo que solicita ya que muchas veces, no posee los productos que sus clientes piden. Con el financiamiento que será utilizado para capital de trabajo comprara productos como arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, jabón, café, detergente, gaseosas y refrescos naturales. El sueño de Estebana es convertir su pequeño establecimiento en una distribuidora y proporcionarles una mejor atención a sus clientes.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Working In Harmony Group

texts.es:
DesD. muy jovencita Victoria Gómez  era dedicada a los estudios es así que pudo tener una carrera como auxiliar contable se dedico a trabajar en una empresa por mucho tiempo lamentablemente esta empresa quebró y  debido a ello quedo sin trabajo,  por esa misma época consigue un terreno en santa Ana los Olivos un lugar nuevo donD. iba a empezar D. cero, con la mudanza D. lo que seria su nuevo hogar también había la preocupación que buscar una forma D. ganarse la vida, es así  que pensando en un negocio sale al mercado que estaba en una calle cerca D. su nueva casa y empieza en el negocio  venta D.  especerías (ají , condimentos, aderezos molidos. etc.)
Al inicio le fue mal pero poco a poco fue ganando clientela lo mas difícil para ella era vender informalmente pues era riesgoso vender en la calle,  tener que sacar y guardar sus cosas todos los días era doble trabajo, por otro lado los policías municipales los echaban del lugar muchas veces quitándoles su mercadería. Para ella era un dolor D. cabeza realmente fueron momentos muy difíciles es por ello que deciden agruparse y formalizarse compran un local granD. para el mercado y con mucho sacrificio y ahorro adquiere su propio puesto D. especerías, ahora se siente feliz pues tiene su propio negocio en un lugar bonito y seguro. Por las tardes cuando cierra el mercado también se ayuda con otro negocio D. venta D. comidas (anticuchos  y  parrilladas) ubicado en su casa.
Victoria realmente es muy trabajadora  todo lo que hace es  por sus hijos a quienes ella sola a podido darles una buena educación  su esfuerzo es doble porque no tiene la ayuda D. su esposo por que es separada lo cual es doble merito, con su préstamo va a comprar mas especias para vender y lo que  mas desea en el futuro es comprarse otro puesto en el mismo mercado para eso esta ahorrando D. sol en sol sabe que lo lograra por eso trabaja sin descansar.

*la Señora Victoria aparece en la foto parada detras con chompa a cuadros en blanco y negro
texts.en:
From a young age, Victoria Gómez devoted herself to her studies so that she could have a career as an accountant. She went to work for a company and became a long-time employee. Unfortunately, she lost her job when her employer went bankrupt. Around the same time, she acquired a piece of property in Santa Ana Los Olivos so that she could start over. While moving into her new home, Victoria worried about how she was going to earn a living. During a visit to a street market near her new home, she thought of starting a business selling condiments (chili peppers, spices, ground seasonings, etc.).

Her business started off badly. She gradually gained a few customers, but being an informal street merchant is a risky proposition. Having to acquire and guard her merchandise created double work for Victoria. The municipal police would often come by and throw out her merchandise instead of asking her to remove it. This created headaches for her because she had to deciD. between making a large purchase of inventory or make the sacrifice to save enough money to acquire her own spice stand. Fortunately, Victory is happy to have her own business in an area that is well-kept and secure. In the afternoons after the market closes, she opens her other business selling food (grilled and roasted meats) outsiD. of her home.

Victoria continues to work hard so that she can proviD. her children with a good education. She feels she has to work extra hard because she is separated from her husband and does not have the luxury of a second income. Her loan will be used to buy more spices to sell. One of her greatest goals is to acquire another vending post in the same market, so Victoria is saving as much money as possible and working as long as she can without resting.

In the photo, Victoria is the woman standing in the back wearing a black and white checkered sweater.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase inventory & supplies for their respective businesses

loans.name: Claudia Banessa

texts.es:
la sra. Claudia Banessa G. tiene 30 años de edad, vive en el Barrio San Antonio de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, Claudia se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tiene varios años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, la cual es muy buena ya que este alimento es muy consumido por el pueblo hondureño, se come en el desayuno, almuerzo y cena, ademas tambien sirven para hacer varias golosinas, este producto lo vende en deferentes casas y caserios, tambien lo reparte en pulperias y negocios.
ella esta solicitando el credito para comprar mas materia prima para la fabricacion de las tortillas.
texts.en:
Claudia Banessa G. is 30 years old; she lives in the neighborhood of San Antonio in San Lorenzo. Claudia prepares and sells tortillas, an activity she has done for many years. It is good work because tortillas are in high demand in this Honduran town: they are eaten for breakfast, lunch and dinner. They are also used to make various snacks. She sells her tortillas door-to-door, and also distributes them to local stores and businesses. Claudia is requesting this loan to buy ingredients for making tortillas.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of maize flour, firewood, whitewash, water, and matches.

loans.name: Oladipupo

texts.en: Oladipupo is 48 years old and married with 4 children. His eldest child is 19 years old. He has a bakery where he bakes bread to sell at wholesale and retail to his customers. He is a hard-working man and he hopes to lift his business and family above poverty. He hopes for loan amount of 100,000 to purchase more bags of flour to bake more bread to sell. He is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of flour to bake more bread to sell

loans.name: Espifania

texts.en:
Espifania A. is from the village of Yumbing, Mambajao, in Camiguin Province. She is 44 years old. Espifania is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Espifania owns & operates a retail business selling dried seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Espifania has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Espifania joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Espifania is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan Espifania has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by this loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Uila

texts.en:
Uila is 38 and married with 2 children (ages 2 and 9).  She owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  She has many years of experience in this business.    Uila needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Uila joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Uila's 3rd loan with SPBD. 

Falefia, a loan manager at SPBD, asked Uila a couple of questions about her business.  Here are her answers:

Overall Social Metric Score of Uila V. provided by SPBD:*               1.5 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita L. is from the village of Dimalco Bonifacio, Mis.Occ. She is 39 years-old and married with two school-aged children. Teresita owns and operates a  specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as sugar, snack foods, canned goods, candies, shampoo,  soap and toothpaste in the local community. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Teresita joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Teresita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products.

loans.name: Nidal

texts.en: NidA., a 34-year-old single woman living with her mother and eight siblings, has worked as a beautician for the past seven years. After gaining experience in this field, she started working from her home where she set aside a speciA. room for the business. Over time, she has built up a good customer base, and with her business income, she helps her older brother take care of the family and its needs. Today, NidA. is asking to borrow $800 to renovate her beauty implements.

loans.use: To renovate her beauty implements

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
Luzmila es una mujer muy trabajadora, tiene 40 años y está separada de su pareja. Con él tuvo 3 hijos, pero sólo vive con una de ellos, Joselin de 15 años.
Su vida siempre estuvo recargada de trabajo, logros y decepciones, que la convirtieron en una persona luchadora y optimista. Desde hace 20 años vende comida en un puesto de un mercado de la ciudad, donde cuenta con la ayuda de su madre y paralelamente comercializa productos fabricados a base de plástico. Ambas actividades que le permitieron educar a sus hijos y brindarles lo mejor, al no tener que pasar necesidades.
Lo que más le gusta de su labor es ser atenta con los clientes para que regresen, pues considera que es una estrategia que nunca falla. Por tal motivo, viene ahorrando para que más adelante pueda implementar en su vivienda una tienda de plásticos y ya no tener que ofrecer su mercadería caminando o en las ferias de su zona.

Este es el cuarto préstamo que tiene con MFP y está más que feliz porque ya conoce la metodología de trabajo de su banco comunal y le agrada mucho. Para cumplir con sus planes, con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará variedad de productos plásticos para incrementar sus ventas y seguir ahorrando para su futura tienda.
texts.en:
Luzmila is a very hard working woman, she is 40 years old, and is seperated from her partner. She his three children with him, but only she lives with them. Joselin is 15 years old. Her life was always increasing work, achievements and disappointments, that converted her into an optimistic and successful person. For twenty years, she has sold food in a market stall in the city, where with the help of her mother she also sells manufactured products made from plastic. Both activities permit her to educate her children and bring them a better life, although never beyond the necessities. The thing she likes best about her work is being attentive to her clients so that they return, which she considers a strategy that never fails. For this reason, she has been saving so that in the future she can implement in her house a store of plastics, and so that she no longer has to offer her merchandise walking or in the market zone. This is the fourth loan that she has had with MFP, an affiliate of Kiva, and she is more than happy because she already knows the methodology of work of her communal bank and pleases her a lot. In order to complete her plans, with the money that she is asking for now, she will buy a variety of plastic products in order to increase her sales and continue saving for her future shop.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing merchandise.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a single lady who lives and operates her business in Machakos.  She operates a retail shop selling sugar, cooking fat, salt, soap, flour, rice etc. She has been in this business for two years.  She hopes to own a wholesale shop and a supermarket in future.  She also dreams of buying a plot of land and a vehicle in future.  She has requested a loan of Kes. 20,000 to add more stock to her inventory.  She describes herself as hard-working and sociable.

loans.use: Add stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of palm nuts

loans.name: Blanca Alicia

texts.es: Blanca Alicia A. D. C. D. 55 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. Usulután, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo. La señora Blanca posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos perecederos y D. primera necesidad, negocio gracias al cual ella pueda contar con una entrada extra D. dinero que le permite poder contar con todo lo necesario para sostener su hogar. Ella solicita un préstamo a Integral a través del cual pueda surtir su tienda con productos nuevos los cuales han sido lanzados al mercado recientemente pero que cuentan con mucho demanda como bebidas y golosinas, así mismo comprar mayor cantidad D. pan, leche, granos básicos y jabón, entre otros más. El mayor deseo D. Blanca es el D. poder superarse y poder seguir adelante, mejorando su negocio y D. esta manera poder contar con una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Blanca Alicia A. D. C. is 55 years old and she lives together with her husband in the region of Usulutan. Blanca runs a store from where she sells basic needs items. Thanks to her business she can depend on another source of income so that she will be able to get all that she needs for her home. She requests a loan from Integral (Kiva Field Partner) so that she may stock her store with new products, such as drinks and snacks, recently introduced into the market and are highly sought out. She would also like to restock her store with a greater selection of breads, milk, basic grains, soaps, and other items. Blanca's greatest dram is to improve herself and find success, to improve her business and gain greater financial stability.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic needs products.

loans.name: Tipapa Ole

texts.en:
Tipapa Ole N. is 28 years old. He is married to Kingasonyi N. and together they have two school-going children. Tipapa is a cash crop farmer and he has been working at this for the last seven years.

He learned about KADET from other members who had already registered as clients. This will be his first loan. He is planning to plant twenty acres of wheat which does very well in this area. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to hire more land for farming to increase his wheat output.

His future dream is that he will be able to buy a bigger piece of land so he can plant more wheat and other farm produce on a large scale.

Tipapa believes he is hard-working and he only needs the resources to attain his goals.

loans.use: To plant twenty acres of wheat

loans.name: Christie

texts.en:
Christie L. is a 31-year-old married woman from Lanang, Morong, Rizal. She is blessed with one son, Dave, who is 7-years-old. She is a member of the Lanang Center in Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI) Rizal Central Branch. 

With her husband’s support, she is a very strong-minded woman and she notes that she works hard to better her life. Despite hardships brought about by poverty, Christie remains strong and dedicated in her pursuit to improve her family’s standard of living. Her aspiration to give her family a brighter future is what motivates her all day. To make a good living, she operates a farming business. She has been engaged in this business for four years. 

She joined ASHI, a micro-finance institution and Kiva partner in the Philippines, in 2009. During the course of her membership, she has been a good performer with respect to her credit rating (basis of loans). She is now applying for her third loan; this time in the amount of 15,000 PHP to pay for raw materials including inventories of rice seeds, fertilizers and other supplies. She is positive that, with access to additional working capital through ASHI and Kiva, her dreams of building a comfortable house and funding her son's education needs will be achieved.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials including inventories of rice seeds, fertilizers and other supplies.

loans.name: Pat

texts.en:
Pat M., 31, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for clay and ceramic products. 

She is a chef for wedding parties and earns an income of about $2.30 per day. Her husband performs recycling services, earning an income of $9.50 per day to help cover the family's expenses.  

M. is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase a motorbike to transport recyclable materials for resale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: Buy a motorbike

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn D. G. is from the village of Brgy.Buliwao,Quezon,Nueva Vizcaya. She is 34 years old. Jovelyn is married and has four infant children. To make a living, Jovelyn raises livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for breeding. Jovelyn has been engaged in her business for more than eight years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jovelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Jovelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Jovelyn is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Jovelyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers, and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
La señora Laura S. de 32 años de edad esta acompañada desde hace 16 años con el sr. Edgar Zena, la pareja cuenta con dos hijas de 15 y 16 años, la primera está cursando el 9no. Grado y la otra está en la 1ra. de la media.
La señora Laura se dedica a la venta de ropas nuevas y usadas desde hace 4 años, tiene su puesto de trabajo dentro del mercado municipal de Caaguazú y cuenta con clientela formada. 
Mediante eso esta creciendo y ampliando su negocio, su pareja es transportista y juntos se ayudan a llevar adelante los gastos familiares y asi poder ofrecerle a los hijos un bienestar mejor, que sigan con sus estudios y que puedan estudiar carrera superiores.
Solicita este préstamo para la  compra de abrigos en general, championes, pantalones para ambos sexo, medias, guantes  , y con eso cumplir con su clientelas.
texts.en:
Señora Laura S. is 32 years old has been married to Sr. Edgar Zena for 16 years. The couple has 2 daughters that are 15 and 16 years old. The first is in the 9th grade and the other is in her first year of secondary school. Señora Laura has been selling new and used clothes for 4 years now. She has a spot in the Caaguazú city market and has steady customers. Because of this her business is growing and expanding. Her husband is in the transportation business and they both contribute to the household expenses so that they can give their children a better life. This way their daughters can continue their studies and they can study to have high ranking careers. She is requesting a loan to buy coats, athletic shoes, pants for men and women, hosiery and gloves so that she can satisfy her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy winter coats, pants, jackets gloves for her business.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes D., 35 years old, is currently in the business of selling maize, millet, sorghum and peeled, dried cassava at the market.  She is taking out a loan to stock bags of maize flour and beans to sell.  

She is married to a businessman and has three children, two of whom attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a store for selling her products.

loans.use: Stock bags of maize flour and beans to sell

loans.name: Gertrude Matilde

texts.fr:
femme de 40ans,mariée et mère 4 enfants dont l'âge varie de 20ans à 5ans et dont 4 sont scolariser. ayant un niveau secondaire et ayant 8 personnes à charge elle se lança dans le commerce d'alimentation en 2001 avec un capital de 50000.Son revenu moyen est de 100000frs par jour.
Avec ce prêt elle compte renforcer son activité en achetant des cartons de bôite de lait, boîte de conserve(exeter,bull boeuf,rio),pâte alimentaire,sucre,friandise,jus de fruit(ceres) et d'autres produits de premiers necessité.
pour l'avancement de son activité elle épargne tout les jours,à avoir un bon acceuil,s'efforce à avoir un bon étallage et cela en dépit de la hausse des prix des marchandises sur le marché.
son ambition est d'avoir une gande boutique si possible en avoir plusieurs dans la ville afin d'être grossiste dans les jours futurs.
son plus grand rêve est d'améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants afin qu'il poursuivent leur études et s'aqurir d'un terrain. dans son quartier estune bonne femme.
texts.en:
This lady is a 40 year-old married mother of four, whose children are aged 5 to 20, and four of whom attend school. Having completed secondary education and with 8 dependents, she entered the food retail business in 2001 with initial capital of 50,000 FRS. Her daily revenue is now 10,000 FRS. She aims to use this loan to boost her business by purchasing boxes of milk, jars of jam (exeter, bull beef and rio), pasta, sugar, biscuits, fruit juice and other staple foods. She saves money every day in order to help grow her business and so that she will have a good display of goods for potential customers, despite a rise in prices. Her goal is to have a large shop, and if possible eventually several others in the town, so that she can be a wholesaler in future. Her dream is to improve her children's living conditions so that they can continue their studies, and also to buy a plot of land. She is seen as a good woman in her quarter.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of biscuits, jars of jam, milk and sugar

loans.name: Rysalat

texts.en: Rysalat A., a 57-year-old widow, is a resident of Balykchi, a nice town in Isykul region. She has raised two daughters, both of whom work as cook assistants in a restaurant. For 15 years, Rysalat takes orders for and prepares various foods at her home, and she has developed her own permanent client base. She is requesting a loan to purchase flour and vegetables oil for making cookies and to begin repairing and installing new gates in her house. In the future, she plans to open a café near her home. ====================================== --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase flour,oil and to install new gates in home

loans.name: Lilias

texts.en: Lilias D.  is currently in the business of selling food in a restaurant in a Bussy market and is requesting a loan to stock more foodstuffs to cook and sell.  Lilias is 35 years old and is married to a husband who is a peasant. She has six children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy more chairs and tables for better accommodation.

loans.use: Stock more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Mopel Ole

texts.en:
Mopel has practiced livestock farming for 12 years.  He buys, rears, and sells the animals later at a profit in Naivasha town.  He is 37 years old, married to Rerai ene Mopel and they have two children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to buy more animals which he will sell later at a profit.

Mopel is also planning to open a factory where he will process and sell animal skins and hides.

loans.use: To buy more animals to fatten and sell

loans.name: Lucio Valerio

texts.es: Lucio Valerio F. de 60 años de edad, ha sido un hombre muy responsable durante toda su vida, quien siempre se ha esmerado por darle lo mejor a su familia. Él reside en Izalco, en el departamento de Sonsonate en donde vive junto a su esposa y una hija de 15 años de edad. Lucio se dedica a la venta de mochilas, carteras, cinchos bolsones y otros productos similares, el negocio se encuentra ubicado en su casa de habitación en donde desde hace más de 18 años que trabaja de esta manera, por lo que la mayoría de personas de Izalco lo conocen y cuenta con las recomendaciones de ellos. Su esposa le ayuda a atender el negocio, haciéndolo la única fuente de ingresos que poseen, por lo que desea poder mejorarlo. Lucio solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir su negocio con nuevos estilos de bolsones y mochilas, así mismo poder comprar cinchos de diferentes materiales y de esta forma abarcar diferentes tipos de mercado para mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en: Lucio Valerio F. is 60 years old; he has been a very responsible man for all of his life and has always worked hard to give the best to his family. He lives in Izalco in the Sonsonate department where he lives with his wife and a 15 year old daughter. Lucio sells backpacks, purses, belts and other similar products. The business is located in his home, he has worked for 18 years in this field and the majority of the people in Izalco know him and he depends on their recommendation which is why he wants to improve his business. Lucio needs the loan to stock his business with new styles and varieties of purses and backpacks as well as belts in different materials to improve his sales.

loans.use: To buy backpacks and belts to sell.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 34-year-old married man with two children. He has been selling fish for two years in Nairobi City center after moving his business from a different city. His business is located in a very competitive area. He says that he has learnt a lot from the training offered by Faulu Kenya. He has learnt how to manage his business in a better way and has become more focused.  

He has requested 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy fish and fish products. He sees himself opening two more outlets for his business so that he may employ at least ten people.

loans.use: To buy fish and fish products

loans.name: Uaminifu Renové Group

texts.fr: Kahambu Muhondo est  présidente du groupe Uaminifu Renové, âgée de 48 ans, mariée, mère de 5  enfants.  Son mari est  cultivateur. Tous ses enfants étudient. son fils ainé est déjà médecin, le second infirmier, le 3e fait la faculté d’économie. Les autres sont aux études secondaires. Elle  commença son business  avec son fond propre. Elle fait le commerce général de divers.  Elle a une boutique/kiosque dans la ville de Goma. Avant de s’installer dans la ville de Goma, elle venait du village de Kibirizi, dans l’intérieur du territoire de Rutshuru  en fuyant la guerre et l’insécurité des rebelles Rwandais  FDLR.  Elle bénéficia de crédit de l’IMF  Hekima de 50$ vers les années 2007. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner son stock  avec les farines, huile de table Rina, sucre, savon, produits  manufacturés, etc. La cliente Kahambu Muhondo remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique.  Il sied de signaler que ce groupe Uaminifu Renové est  composé de 7 membres.
texts.en:
Kahambu Muhondo is the president of the Uaminifu Renové group. She is 48 years old, married and the mother of 5 children. Her husband is a farmer. All of her children study. Her eldest son is already a doctor, the second is a medical assistant, the third studies economics at university. The others are in secondary school. 

She started her business with her own funds. She sells various goods. She has a shop/booth in the town of Goma. Before settling in the town of Goma, she lived in the village of Kibirizi, inside the Rutshuru territory. She fled the war and insecurity caused by the Rwandan rebels from the FDLR.  

She received a loan of $50 from the microfinance institution Hekima around 2007. This new loan will allow her to stock up on flour, Rina edible oil (a brand of oil), sugar, soap, manufactured goods etc. Kahambu Muhondo thanks Hekima for its actions in favor of the poor who are excluded from mainstream banking.  It must be noted that the Uaminifu Renové group is composed of 7 members.

loans.use: flour, Rina edible oil, sugar, soap, manufactured goods etc.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, a 43-year-old businessman, is requesting a loan of Kes. 20,000 to add stocks of charcoal and firewood. He sells charcoal and firewood in Kiambu and to neighbourhood residents. He also practices farming and plumbing to earn more income. 

A married father of four, Joseph plans to be a large scale distributor of charcoal and firewood in five years time. His business has improved greatly since joining Faulu Kenya and he describes himself as very determined.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal and firewood for resale

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana lives in Vehari, a small city located in the province of Punjab, Pakistan, and famous for its agricultural industry. She lives there with her family in a two-room brick house.
 
Her husband’s name is M. A.. He operates a grocery store. He has a shop in the market from which he sells daily-use items, such as sugar, tea, spices, cooking oil, and rice, to his customers. He has been doing this business for over five years.
  
Rukhsana herself is a housewife and also a businesswoman. She has a set routine that involves getting up early, finishing the household chores, and getting milk from the buffalo which she keeps at her home. She has a good clientele base in her neighboring areas and sells them milk to supplement the income of her family. She has been doing this work for over three years.
  
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy more groceries to improve his grocery store. Rukhsana is hopeful that a loan investment will take her husband’s business to a more profitable position.

loans.use: To buy groceries for a grocery store

loans.name: Mr. Toem Ten Village Bank Group

texts.en:
In Trapeang Ta Moung village, Takeo province there are eighteen people who are made up a village bank loan group. They have selected Mr. Toem T. to become a village bank president. They will use their portion of the loan for different purposes which can improve their family living standard. 
Mr. Toem T. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where he grows rice to sell to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Chy Khoem, owns a general store in the local village where she is able to earn a profit to support the family. Since his wife’s business is going well, he wants to expand its sales. To improve this business, he is asking for a loan to buy more groceries to sell. He is a father of four children, one of whom is a student while the other two are employed in a garment factory. Another child  is employed in at private compaN..

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Eduvigis

texts.es: Eduvigis, de 40 años convive con Fredy, de 45 años. Ambos tienen una hija,”Fiorela”, de 6 años de edad. En unión familiar los tres viven en su casa propia, ubicada en Playa Hermosa – San Ramón (selva central peruana). La principal actividad de esta talentosa mujer es, la agricultura, donde siembra una variedad de cítricos; en todo estos años de dedicarse al cuidado de sus cultivos, logró obtener muchas ganancias; ya que no solo comercializa sus cosechas en la zona, también lleva a diferentes lugares del Perú mediante sus intermediarios. Pero conocedora del potencial turístico de la catarata,” Tirol”, ella hace poco instaló un negocio de venta de artesanía típica del lugar, como también una variedad de bebidas, que por el calor del lugar, tiene mucha demanda, según cuenta en temporadas de excursión estudiantil, los alumnos de las diferentes escuelas del Perú, comprar casi toda la mercadería que tiene. Es por ello que visionando el movimiento del lugar, ella desea comprar un terreno amplio, para construir un recreo turístico. Es el noveno crédito con MFP, y espera seguir trabajando junto a los integrantes de su banco comunal, que son personas responsables y muy dedicadas. Con el crédito solicitado, ha pensado comprar una variedad de artesanía, para surtir su negocio, y si el dinero le alcanza también invertirá en la compra de abono orgánico.
texts.en: Eduvigis, age 40, lives with Fredy, who is 45 years old. They have a daughter together, "Fiorela", who is 6 years old. As a family, the three live in their own house, located in Playa Hermosa [Beautiful Beach] - San Ramón (in the central rainforest of Peru). The main activity of this talented woman is agriculture, where she plants a variety of citrus plants. In all these years of taking care of her crops, she has managed to obtain many earnings. She not only sells her harvests in her area, she also takes them to different places in Peru through a middleman. But aware of the tourist potential of the waterfall "Tirol", she has set up a business of common artwork of the area. She also sells a variety of drinks, that because of the heat of the place, has much demand. According to her, she counts on the seasonal field trips, the students of the different schools in Peru, to buy almost all of the merchandise that she has. It is for them that she is seeing the movement of the place. She wants to buy a large piece of land to build a tourist site. It is her 9th loan with MFP, and she hopes to continue working together with the members of her communal bank, which are responsible and very dedicated people. She has thought about buying a variety of crafts to stock her business with the loan. And if the money lasts, she will also buy organic fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy hand-crafted ornaments to sell, as well as organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Kotognontala Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Kotognontala, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 35 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et font la restauration, le commerce d’habillements et des fruits.                                                                         
Les femmes du groupe Kotognontala sont à leur quinzième prêt solidaire et tous les quatorze précédents furent remboursés sans aucune difficulté.                                                                          
AWA C. s’approvisionne en fruits au marché de Massigui hebdomadairement avec les forains. Elle effectue ses ventes à domicile et au marché de Massigui, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer le prêt, prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women who form the Kotognontala group are all married, averaging 35 years of age with four children, and live in traditional extended families in the town of Massigui Prefecture of Dioila, Region of Koulikoro (the second administrative region of Mali). They know each other as relatives and neighbors. They cook food for sale and retail clothing and fruits. The Kotognontala group members are on their 15th group loan, having repaid the previous 14 loans without any issues.

Awa C. buys her stock of fruits from the sellers at the weekly Massigui market. She sells retail out of her home and at the Massigui market,   for cash and on credit, to a customer base composed of women and men. She plans to achieve an average monthly income of 30,000 West African Francs, which will be used for repaying the loan and  covering healthcare and food expenses, with the rest reinvested in her business.

loans.use: Purchasing fruits

loans.name: San Nicolas Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama San Nicolás, se encuentra localizado en la comunidad de Tlalnepantla, en el estado de Morelos, México. está conformado por 5 integrantes mujeres que se conocen y son vecinas ellas son la señora Guadalupe Ávila M. va a comprar con su préstamo abono orgánico para fertilizar su producción de nopal, la señora Leticia L. C. va a comprar abono orgánico para fertilizar su nopal para que de mas producción, la señora Marquelia R. Díaz va a comprar perfumes de dama y caballero, cosméticos y compra de kid de cosméticos para surtir su negocio, la señora Herminia R. M. va a comprar frutas, chirimoya, níspero, aguacate para surtirse y vender su producto, la señora Guadalupe R. Ávila va a comprar penca de nopal y abono por bulto para iniciar su propia producción. La señora Guadalupe Ávila M. es la representante del grupo, ella tiene 56 años de edad, estudio hasta el 5º. Año de primaria. Ella es casada tiene 5 hijos 1 mujer y 4 hombres sus hijos son campesinos, su esposo se decida a la venta de leña se va al campo a traer leña para vender. la señora Guadalupe tiene su terreno donde siembra el nopal, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar abono  para su siembra de nopal y produzca mas nopales, ella inicio con el negocio hace 5 años, anteriormente sembraba maíz y frijol ya les repartieron a sus hijos terreno ellos también siembran nopal , ella aprendió este negocio desde pequeña su papa siempre se dedico a sembrar nopal y sus hermanos y ella trabajaban en el nopal deshierbándolo, des pencarlo, picarlo con ese nopal picado se tapa con tierra  para que sirva como abono, el nopal grueso se le quita, en la actualidad utilizan la renta de motocultor que va picando y quitando la hierba pero es cara la renta, el terreno donde siembra nopal lo compro, su papa le heredo la casa donde está viviendo, su  terreno está en el campo llega a su siembra de nopal caminando o en taxi la dejan a bordo de carretera y caminan para el terreno, su negocio es importante y especial porque en temporadas buenas si pagan bien el nopal, su parte favorita es trabajar en el nopal y se siente orgullosa cuando recibe buen dinero del nopal, sus clientes son  el que llegue primero a compra su nopal se ponen las camionetas y el que llega primero paga más se lleva el producto cada ocho días o quince día corta el nopal para vender y entrega el producto, los desafíos que enfrenta el negocio es que en tiempo de fríos no crece el nopal, su negocio es muy conocido por que el nopal se come del diario para acompañar a la comida y también es curativo, su negocio enfrenta la competencia de varias personas productoras de nopal pero cada quien es libre de vender su producto donde mejor le convenga, las ganancias del negocio las va volteando, se van invirtiendo en la siembra compra el abono para su nopal y para la comida. Le ayudan en el negocio su hija corta el nopal y su esposo cortan el nopal y saca las cajas de nopal. Tlalnepantla es un pueblo muy bonito porque aquí vivo el paisaje se ve verde se ven las siembras de nopal, se ve el volcán y el cL. es frio y templado. Su negocio ha ayudado a su familia económicamente cuando no tiene dinero van a cortar nopal para vender y ya tiene para los gastos para la comida o alga que falte en la casa. Ella quiere componer su vivienda ponerle loseta y pintarla para que se vea bonita, sus planes y sueños son tener una vida mejor tener dinero para hacer unas cosa más, hacer otro cuarto mas para los hijos de su hija porque es mama soltera y tiene dos hijos, las mejoras que desea para el futuro de sus hijos son dejarlos bien que tengan donde vivir y estén tranquilos, ella está muy contenta con este préstamo por que le va a ayudar mucho a su cosecha de nopal para que produzca mas y espera pagarlo bien para que le vuelvan a prestar. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “Gracias por los préstamo que nos dan ya que nos ayuda mucho a realizar lo que uno piensa y crecer los negocios y las familias.”
texts.en:
This communal bank is called San Nicolás and it is located in the village of Tlalnepantla, in the State of Morelos, Mexico.  It has five female members who all know each other and are neighbors.  The members are as follows: Guadalupe Ávila M., who will use her loan to buy organic fertilizer to fertilize her 'nopal' (prickly pear) crop; Leticia L. C., who will buy organic fertilizer to fertilize her prickly pear crop and improve her production; Marquelia R. Díaz, who will buy men's and women's perfume, cosmetics and cosmetic kits in order to stock her business; Herminia R. M., who will buy fruit such as custard apples, loquats and avocados, to stock her business, and Guadalupe R. Ávila, who will buy prickly pear stalks and fertilizer in bulk, in order to start her own production.

Guadalupe Ávila M. is the group's representative.  She is 56 years old and studied up to the fifth year of elementary school.  She is married and has five children: 1 daughter and 4 sons.  Her sons are agricultural workers.  Guadalupe's husband sells firewood.  He goes out to the countryside and gathers firewood to sell.  Guadalupe herself has a plot of land where she grows prickly pears.  She has requested this loan to buy manure for her prickly pear crop so that she can produce more.  She started this business 5 years ago.  Previously, she used to grow corn and beans.  She provided her children with some land and they also grow prickly pear cacti.

Guadalupe learned her business as a young child.  Her father always used to grow prickly pear cacti and she and her siblings worked with him, weeding, removing the stalks and chopping.  They would cover the chopped prickly pear with soil so that it served as fertilizer and they would remove the fleshy pads.  These days, they hire a rototiller that chops the plants and removes weeds but it is expensive to hire.

Guadalupe bought the plot of land where she grows her prickly pear crop and her dad left her the house where she is currently living.  Her plot of land is in the countryside.  She either walks there or takes a taxi which leaves her on the edge of the road and she then walks to her plot of land.  Her business is important and special to her because in good seasons, if they pay her well for her produce, she enjoys working on her crop.  She feels proud when she receives good money for it.  Guadalupe's customers are those who arrive first in their trucks to buy her produce.  Those who arrive first and pay the most take the produce.  She cuts her prickly pear to sell every week or two weeks.

The challenge that Guadalupe faces in her business is that during periods of cold weather, the cacti do not grow.  Her business is very well known because people eat prickly pear every day with their meals and it also has healing effects.  Guadalupe faces competition from other people who produce prickly pear but everyone is free to sell their product wherever they most like.  Guadalupe re-invests some of the profits that she makes back into her business, investing in buying fertilizer for her next sowing season and she also buys food.  Her children help her in the business.  Her daughter and husband cut the cacti and her husband also carries the boxes of produce.

Tlalnepantla is a very pretty village.  The countryside is very green and covered with prickly pear cacti.  You can also see the nearby volcano.  The climate is cold and temperate.  Guadalupe's business has helped her family financially.  When they don't have any money they go and cut some prickly pear to sell and then have enough to cover their food expenses or anything else they might need at home.  Guadalupe would like to repair her home, laying floor tiles and painting it so that it looks nicer.  Her plans and dreams are to enjoy a better life and to have money so that she can do more things.  She would like to have another bedroom for her daughter's children as her daughter is a single mother and has two children.  The improvements that Guadalupe would like to make for her children's future is to ensure that they have somewhere to live and for them to be content.  She is very happy to be receiving this loan because it will help her a lot with her harvest.  It will help her to produce more and she hopes to pay it back properly so that she can access more loans in the future.

The members of this group would like to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad "We thank you for the loan that you are giving us because it will help us a lot.  It will help our businesses and families to grow".

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her prickly pear crop

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a 47-year-old married man, with six children living in an owned house in Fort Portal, Uganda. The responsibility of looking after the family solely rests on him and his wish is to build a permanent house for the family. Stephen has been growing maize for a living for fifteen years and he is still successful. His hardships include price fluctuations and diseases. His dream is to have at least ten acres of land. Stephen needs the loan to prepare land for planting maize.

loans.use: to prepare the land for maize planting

loans.name: Lucia Lourdes

texts.es: El señora Lucia dedicada a la venta de ropa, tiene su puesto de venta en el mercado central de la ciudad teniendo una venta mas efectiva por las noches ya que existe mucha mas afluencia de personas por ese mercado. Ocupando su tiempo por el día en la supervisión y cuidado de sus pequeños quienes se encuentran en edad escolar y ella los lleva a la escuela y ayudarlos en sus tareas, y por las noches los deja con su padre para ella poder ir a vender su mercadería, el crédito que solicito es para poder incrementar su mercadería comprando ropa por docena, la Sra. Lucia es una persona muy trabajadora y esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Lucia sells clothing. She has a stall in the central market in the city and she sells more in the evenings, when the influx of visitors is higher. During the day she supervises and looks after her children of school age, taking them to school and helping them with their homework. In the evening she leaves them with their father and goes to sell her merchandise. She is requesting a loan to increase her stocks by purchasing clothes by the dozen. Lucia is a very hard working woman and she is grateful to the institution for the support received.

loans.use: Purchase clothing by the dozen.

loans.name: Kalembubu's Group

texts.en:
Kalembubu K. is the leader of this group. She is 58 and married to a builder.  Together with her husband she is bringing up two sons and two daughters. The first son is handicapped; the older daughter studies at university and the other children are at school.  Kalembubu herself works as a cleaner at school. 

In order to earn additional money she breeds livestock. She started this activity seven years ago and now she earns 2000 soms per month. She hopes to obtain the loan because she needs money to increase the number of livestock.  In the future Kalembubu wants to provide her children with a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily D., 46 years old, is a married woman with four children. Her oldest child is 25 years old. 

Emily is engaged in farming. She grows rice, fruits and vegetables. She sells her harvest to her town's market. 

Emily has been in this business for more than 20 years now. She works hard to build her business and earn better.

Emily's loan will be used to purchase farm fertilizers and other supplies. In the future, she hopes for their living conditions to improve.

loans.use: to purchase farm fertilizers and other supplies

loans.name: C6307 Dufatanye Group

texts.en:
Edmond is 29 years old and is single. He is the representative of a group which is called "Dufatanye" in the local language. Edmond owns a small shop which sells green bananas and he has four years of experience in the business. He employs two persons in his business as helpers so that his business will run well.

Edmond and his group has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more green bananas for the purpose of earning more profits.
