With the profits, they expect to improve their businesses. Eduard, in particular, needs a fridge which will allow him to create a new business of selling cold soft drinks.

loans.use: to purchase more green bananas to sell.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia W. K. is sixty years old. Her husband is a businessman and they have two children, aged twenty six years old and sixteen years old. Her business is located at an area called Uthiru in Nairobi, along the road where there are many passersby and it is well known as Bethsaida Bakers. She makes and sells baked food to the local people in wholesale and retail. Virginia says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is shortage of capital. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of KES 20,000 to buy flour, yeast, cooking oil and others to grow her business and to meet the demands of her customers. In future, she hopes to open other outlets and become a major cakes supplier in Uthiru. She describes herself as a very focused lady.

loans.use: to buy flour, oil, yeast, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For the purchase of reeds for the manufacture of mats.

loans.name: Amanda Andrea

texts.es:
La cliente Amanda es de la ciudad de San Estanislao, del Barrio Virgen de Fátima, tiene 24 años de edad, es separada y tiene un hijo. Lucha día a día para solventar los gastos de la familia.
Tiene una carnicería en el Mercado Municipal de San Estanislao, además vende empanadas, con clientela formada, buen ingreso, buenas referencias comerciales y personales.
La señora empezó con el crédito solidario o créditos de comités, ahora ya accede con el crédito individual, por el hecho de que ya mejoró su ingreso.
La cliente con este crédito adquirirá más capital para la venta (carnes en sus variedades) y así tener mejor ingreso.
texts.en:
The client is Amanda.  She is from the city of San Estanislao’s Virgen de Fátima neighborhood.  She’s 24 years old, separated and has a son.  She struggles daily to meet her family’s expenses.

She has a butcher shop in the San Estanislao Municipal Market.  She also sells turnovers.  She has a well established clientele as well as good personal and business references.

She started out with communal loans but is now applying for an individual one because her income has improved.  She will use this loan to acquire more working capital (assorted meats) in order to earn better income.

loans.use: to buy meat.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 47 years old and married. She has 5 children. She earns a living by leasing farm equipment in the Philippines. Eva is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional farm equipment to lease.

Eva has been leasing farm equipment for 10 years and also earns additional income from rice retailing and pig fattening. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save money and to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional farm equipment to lease.

loans.name: Neamah

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 40 years old, married and has 3 children.

Neamah has had a barber shop since 1995. He has more than 15 years experience in his field, has a good reputation, and is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $2100 loan to renovate his shop and to tile the floor. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality life.

loans.use: To renovate his shop and to tile the floor.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria, 29, is married and has four children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Maria has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years.

Maria requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her stall.

In the future, Maria would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.en: Santiago is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married, with 6 children. Santiago provides videoke or karaoke services. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy tools & to pay for the utilities for the service.  Santiago has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Santiago hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools & to pay for the utilities for the service

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid is forty years old, married and the father of four children. He runs a carpentry workshop in Mariakani, Mombasa.

Rashid has been in business for the last fifteen years, and his shop has been a success. This request for a loan is his third from KADET LTD to finance his business. With this loan, Rashid plans to purchase more timber. The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and gradually expand his business.

Rashid’s dream is to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase more timber for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Yevgeniy

texts.ru:
Евгений женат. У него есть сын Глеб, ему 10 лет. Он занимается реализацией нижнего белья, чулочно-носочных изделий и трикотажа на местном рынке города Мелитополя. Евгений занимается этим бизнесом уже 12 лет и, причем, достаточно продуктивно. У него есть свой реализатор. В товаре у него уже 50 000 гривен, а чистая прибыль составляет 7 000 гривен в месяц.  

Евгению нужен кредит в 20 000 гривен, чтобы приобрести сезонный товар, а именно закупить нижнее белье по оптовым ценам для последующей продажи на центральном рынке, где он торгует. Евгений хотел бы расширить свой бизнес и, по возможности, открыть еще одну точку реализации. Более того, кроме торговли на рынке, Евгений еще подрабатывает таксистом в свободное время, желая обеспечить свою семью всем необходимым и зарабатывать достаточно для этого.  

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en:
Yevgeniy is married. He has a son named Gleb, he is ten years old. Yevgeniy sells underwear, socks, stockings and hosiery on the local market of the town of Melitopol. He has been in this business for almost twelve years and actually very productively. He has his own sales person. His inventory is now worth 50,000 hrivnas and clean profit is 7,000 hrivnas a month.

Yevgeniy needs a loan for 20,000 hrivnas to buy seasonal merchandise namely underwear at a wholesale price for further resale on the central market where he sells. Yevgeniy wants to expand his business and if possible to open another vendor location. Furthermore, besides selling on the market Yevgeniy also works part time as a taxi driver in his spare time because he wants to provide his family with all the necessary things and make enough money to do so.

loans.use: to buy underwear at wholesale price for further resale on the central market

loans.name: Philipina

texts.en:
Philipina is 45 years old, married, and a mother of four children. Philipina runs a retail shop in Mtwapa, Mombasa. Her business has been in operation for the last 10 years. 

She has been a KADET client and this marks her second loan to finance her business. With this loan, she plans to expand her business by purchasing more flour and sugar and to use the remaining amount to renovate her business. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to expand her business further. Her dream is to own a mini-shop.

loans.use: to purchase more flour and sugar and to renovate her business

loans.name: Rod Darwin

texts.en:
Rod Darwin and his family live happily in a village. He is 37 years old and has five school-age children. He and his wife aim to educate all their children so that they will become professionals someday. Despite the hardships of life, they are striving hard to earn and save for education purposes. They own and manage a butcher shop in the market selling fresh meat of pigs, cows and goats. 

Rod Darwin aims to improve this business so that he will earn a higher income. He is requesting for a loan of P20,000 to buy pigs, cows and goats to butcher and sell in the market. He hopes that this loan will help him to improve his business. 

In the future, Rod Darwin is hoping that his business will grow and expand so that he will become financially stable and give his children a bright future.

loans.use: to buy pigs, cows and goats to butcher and sell in the market

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is from the village of Cabisera 17-21. She is 28 years old. Angelina is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Angelina owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Angelina has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

Angelina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like vinegar, soy sauce, rice and drinks for her sari-sari store (small store). Angelina is a very responsible mother and wife. She hopes that her store will be expand in the future.

loans.use: to buy vinegar, soy sauce, rice and drinks for her store.

loans.name: Fatou Binetou

texts.fr: Madame  Fatou  vit au Sénégal. Elle est âgée  de 35 ans.  Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 3 et 11 ans.  Depuis plus de 10 ans elle s’adonne   au commerce d’habits.  En même temps elle pratique l’activité de couture.  Elle a opté pour cette activité dans le but de soutenir son mari dans la gestion des besoins familiaux.  C’est le fait de gagner beaucoup de bénéfices qui l’intéresse  dans son activité. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis mars 2002. Elle sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs  prévu pour  ses frais de voyage vers 2 pays limitrophes du Sénégal et l’achat de  tissus et d’habits destinés a la vente. Elle souhaite rentabiliser son activité e avec l’accroissement  de ses profits améliorer les conditions de vie sociale de sa  famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatou lives in Senegal. She is 35 years old and married with three children ranging in age from 3 to 11 years old. She has been selling clothing for over 10 years. As a secondary activity, she is also a seamstress. She does this to support her husband in taking care of their family. What appealed to her in this choice of activity was the ability to earn substantial profits. 

She became a member of a U-IMCEC branch in March 2002. She is seeking a loan of 500,000 francs to travel to two neighboring countries of Senegal and purchase fabrics and clothes for resale. She hopes that a boost in revenue will help to make her business profitable and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy clothes and fabrics for resale

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en: Noemi is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. She has a shop that sells used clothing or ukay-ukay. She has had this business for five years. Noemi has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. She requested a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos to buy stock of used clothing to sell. In the future, Noemi hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of used clothing to sell

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
48-year-old Felomina is a married woman with 6 children. The oldest child is 26 years old. Her husband works as a farmer.

Felomina has been in the business of raising pigs for 5 years. She plans to use her loan to purchase piglets and feed. Each month, Felomina earns 3000 PHP with her business. Felomina hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Roberto Antonio

texts.es: Roberto de 34 años de edad, habitante de la comunidad llamada El Rodeo localizada en Pueblo Nuevo municipio Estelí, el es agricultor, es casado, padre de 3 hijos, su nivel académico es básico solo finalizo el cuarto grado de la primaria. El empezó a aprender las labores de agricultura a temprana edad con su papa poco a poco con la ganancia de la venta de su producción de hortalizas  logro comprar su propio terreno, actualmente se dedica a sembrar hortalizas y también a la crianza de ganado. El requiere el préstamo para comprar 2 vaquillas, pues con esta compra podrá mejorar las ventas de leche, pues en esta época la venta de leche tiene mucha demanda y no quiere perder la oportunidad de producir y vender leche. El esta ahorrando para pagar los estudios de sus  hijos para que estos sean profesionales  y salgan adelante esto representa para el su mayor prioridad, le gustaría componer su casa, hacerle mejoras a su finca y ampliar sus áreas de siembra.
texts.en:
Roberto is 34 years old and a resident of the community of El Rodeo, which is located in Pueblo Nuevo in the town of Estelí. He is a farmer who is married and the father of three children. Roberto only has a basic education since he finished elementary school through the fourth grade. He began learning to farm at an early age from his father. Over time, he used his earnings from selling vegetables to buy his own land. Roberto currently grow vegetables and raises cattle.

He is requesting a loan to buy two heifers because he believes this purchase will improve his milk sales. There is great demand this season, so he does not want to lose this opportunity to produce and sell milk. Roberto is saving for his children’s education so that they can become professionals and move forward. Therefore, this has become a high priority. He enjoys home repair projects, making improvements to his farm, and expanding the land on which he grows his crops.

loans.use: to purchase two heifers.

loans.name: Violetas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VIOLETA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Elvira. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de comida, venta de dulces de todos santos, tejido de guantes, manta de vicuñas, tejido de chompas, carpintería, tienda de barrio, venta de tarjetas de llamadas..

La señora Elvira,  indica que hace tres años que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de carpintería que viene trabajando hace años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de madera) que adquirirá de las barracas y posteriormente lo venderá en Cochabamba. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta trabajar en grupo.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Violetas” (Violets) is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Community Center. This group consists of nine members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Elvira. The members of this Communal Bank engage in different businesses in order to get ahead such as selling food, selling candy for All Saints Day, knitting mittens, making blankets out of vicuña wool, knitting sweaters, carpentry, managing a neighborhood store, and selling calling cards.

Sra. Elvira says that she started working with Pro Mujer three years ago after receiving an invitation from the organization. She currently has a carpentry business where she has worked for many years.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for purchasing wood. She acquires her supplies at the lumber yards and then sells her products in Cochabamba. By working in this manner, she is able to earn income to support her family. Elvira is married and has one child.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Elvira said that she enjoys working as part of a group.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: María Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Maria Rosa se dedica a la confeccion de ropa, tiene un taller de costura el cual se encuentra ubicado en su casa de habitación, Maria cuenta con clientes fijos para la confección de trajes, vestidos, blusas y otras prendas de vestir, Maria los fines de semana hace trabajos especificos para una señora que tiene otro taller de costura, Maria se encarga de darles el acabado final a las prendas, ahi le pagan por trabajo terminado,  gracias a estos ingresos ha logrado ir realizando mejoras a su vivienda, en donde vive con su mama, su hijo y sus hermanos.
Maria utilizara el credito para la compra de materiales para construccion, desea terminar un cuarto que hace meses esta haciendo en su casa de habitacion.
texts.en:
Señora María Rosa is a dressmaker. She has a sewing workshop in her home. María has loyal customers who order suits, dresses, blouses and other garments. In the weekends María performs specific works for the owner of another sewing workshop, where she gives the final touch to garments and is paid per finished item. Thanks to this income María could improve her home, where she lives with her mother, her son and her siblings.

María will use her loan to buy construction materials. She wants to finish a room that she has been building in her home for months.

loans.use: to buy cement, gutters, iron bars, metal sheets and blocks.

loans.name: Jairo José

texts.es:
Jairo José vive en la ciudad de Managua, es conocido como una persona trabajadora de buenos valores morales, es soltero y labora como operador de montacargas desde hace veintidós años en una institución del estado.

Actualmente solicitó crédito a Ceprodel, este crédito  lo utilizara para pagar deuda  en casa comercial y abonarle al banco de finanza de un crédito de consumo y así poder ir saliendo de su deuda.
texts.en: Jairo José lives in the city of Managua.  He’s known as a hardworking person of good moral values.  He’s single and has been working as a forklift operator in a state institution for 22 years.  He asked Ceprodel for this loan to pay off a debt in a store and to make a payment to a consumer credit bank so that he can start to get out from under his debts.

loans.use: to pay off some personal debts.

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan is 41 years old and married. She lives with her husband and two children in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works as a driver for hire. 

For four years, Loan has earned a living by running a general store. She would like to take out a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods, candies, and soft drinks, to stock her store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income. This would help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods, candies, and soft drinks, to stock her store.

loans.name: Cándida Rosa

texts.es:
La Sra. Cándida tiene su negocio de venta de ropa usada en unos de  los mercados de la capital desde hace más de veinte años, ella trabaja con unas de sus hijas quien se encarga de atender a la clientela. 
Cándida trabaja de lunes a domingos desde las ocho de la mañana hasta las seis de la tarde, ella acude nuevamente a las oficinas de ceprodel para solicitar un nuevo préstamo para la compra de mercadería para su negocio como son una paca de ropa interior y ropa para niños, ya que para este mes de diciembre las ventas son muy buena para este tipo de negocio.
texts.en:
Cándida has a business selling used clothing at one of the markets in the capital city. She has been doing this for more than 20 years, and she works with one of her daughters, who takes care of the customers.

Cándida works from Monday through Sunday from eight in the morning until six in the evening. She has come again to Ceprodel's offices to ask for a new loan to buy merchandise for her business, items like a bundle of underwear and children's clothing. She is asking for this because in December sales are very good for this type of business.

loans.use: to buy a bundle of used bras and used children's clothing.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en: Benard is 48 years old, married with 10 children. He sells fish to earn a living. He has been in the business for one year and employs one person. His other source of income is from his employment. He describes his business environment as busy because of the big population. Since he  joined Faulu Kenya he been able to build his own house. He hopes to expand his business and be financially stable in the future. He has applied for KES 20,000 to buy 2 sacks of fish to sell.

loans.use: To buy 2 sacks of fish to sell.

loans.name: Lizete

texts.en: Lizete is applying for a loan of $1,000 to repair her car. She is married and she has three children. She is using the loan to buy tires, oil, fuel and the items that needed for car to be repaired. Her husband is a driver and uses the car to carry the passengers from the town where they live to the market. She is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) that offered loan for poor people.

loans.use: To buy a mini bus

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 54 years old from Cordon, Isabela. She is married and they are blessed with six children. They earn through their sari sari store and her husband works as a carpenter. Despite having some extra income, they still sometimes face difficulties in regards with financial matters. That’s why Josephine wants to avail an education loan of PHP 200,000 from the KIVA lenders to be utilized in sending her daughter Mary Valen to college. Mary Valen is taking up BS in Agricultural Engineering.

loans.use: to pay for daughter's education

loans.name: Norma Isabel

texts.en:
My name is Norma and I have been selling groceries such as milk, eggs, bread, coffee, sugar and other items of daily consumption. My business is located in my house in the community Quebrada Larga, I am a single mother and with my earnings I help my three children, who are all school aged.

Loan Use: Purchase of eggs, sugar, coffee, bread, beans, rice, butter and other items.

Me llamo Norma y me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo basico como leche, huevos, pan, cafe, azucar y otros productos de consumo diario. Mi negocio esta ubicado en mi casa de habitacion en Quebrada Larga, soy madre soltera y con los que vendo ayudo a mis tres hijos que estan en edad escolar.

loans.use: Compra de huevos, azucar, cafe, pan, frijoles, arroz, manteca y otros

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a plot to grow fruit

loans.name: Siavii

texts.en: Gathering coconuts is not an easy or safe job.  But for Siavii, it is a way to ensure that she can fund the education of her children.  She is thirty-six years old, and she is able to run her business gathering and selling coconuts with continuous help from her four children.  Her husband works at one of the supermarkets in the capital, but his income is not enough to support their large family.  So Siavii has requested a loan to invest in some tools that will help make her work more productive, hopefully enabling her to increase her sales.

loans.use: Machetes and other tools

loans.name: Marciana

texts.es:
Mrs. Marciana is 49 years old. In her business she sells essential food products. She started selling products she grew at her own farm such as potatoes, eggs, corn, poroto, and cheese. With the profits she was able to grow the business little by little, and now she owns a General Store with a set clientèle.

With this activity and with the help of her husband, who works in a textile manufacturer, she was able to proviD. her 4 children with the education they deserve.

Her project is to increase the variety of products in her store, since she wishes to sell carbonated drinks, ice creams and milk-based products which her clients generally request. In order to do this, she needs to acquire a refrigerator which will allow her to keep these products cold since the heat in Paraguay is overwhelming and hot days are prevalent throughout the year.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


La Sra. Marciana tiene 49 años D. edad, su negocio se dedica a la venta D. productos D. primera necesidad, ella empezó vendiendo pruductos traidos D. su propia granja como papa, huevo, maíz, poroto, queso y con las ganancias pudo ir ampliando poco a poco el negocio, en la actualidad ya es una Despensa consolidada con clientela formada. Con esta actividad y con la ayuda D. su marido, quien es empleado D. una empresa textil, pudo darle la educación merecida a sus 4 hijos. Su proyecto es aumentar la variedad D. mercaderías, pues ella desea vender también bebidas como gaseosas, helados y productos lácteos que generalmente solicitan sus clientes, para ello desea adquirir un refrigerador que le permita mantener estos productos bien refrigerados, pues en nuestro país el calor en muy agobiante y los días calurosos son los que más abundan durante el año.

loans.use: Purchasing a refrigerator

loans.name: Daisy

texts.es:
TRANSLATED BY MATT FLANNERY

Daisy Patricia is 20 years old, is unmarried mother of one  of 8 months of age.  She lives with her parents and brother.She sells sweet cakes and Paraguayan soup (it is a typical food of Paraguay that is made with maize flour, eggs, milk). From very young she learned from her mother since they came from a very humble family and the little . With time Daisy  acquired experience and at the moment all their neighbors of the district consider her  an expert in the culinary arts. 

Each afternoon she crosses the District Apua Valley, a district of Asuncio'n and its neighborhoods with a product tray (their clients already wait for the moment to taste). The Lady wishes to use the loan to buy ingredients like eggs, cheeses, flour of maize, milk and also to be able to acquire trays for better presentation of its products this way will be able to increase its sales to obtain a greater margin of profit. 

The lady belongs to the Group "Kuña Katypyry" that means "Intelligent Woman" and comprises of the Program Committee of Enterprising Women of the Paraguayan Foundation, that consists of 16 women who to conform a shared in common group of work.



ORIGINAL SPANISH
Daisy Patricia tiene 20 años, es madre soltera de una beba de 8 meses de edad, vive con sus padres y hermanos, se dedica a la venta de  tortas dulces y sopa Paraguaya (es una comida típica de Paraguay que está hecha a base de harina de maíz, huevos, leche). 
Desde muy niña aprendió el oficio de su madre ya que provenían de una familia muy humilde y el poco ingreso que obtenían no les alcanzaba para cubrir con todas sus obligaciones. Con el tiempo Daisy fue adquiriendo experiencia y actualmente todas sus vecinas del barrio la consideran como una experta en el arte culinario.
Todas las tardes recorre el Barrio Valle Apua, un barrio de Asunción  y sus alrededores con  su bandeja de productos (sus clientes ya esperan el momento para degustar la merienda con sus ricos productos).
La Señora desea utilizar el crédito para comprar ingredientes como huevos, quesos, harina de maíz, leche y también poder adquirir unas bandejas para mejor presentación de sus productos de esta manera podrá  aumentar sus ventas para obtener un mayor margen de utilidad. 
La señora pertenece al Comité “Kuña Katypyry” nombre en guaraní que significa "Mujer Inteligente"  y forma parte del Programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya, que consta de 16 mujeres que conformar un grupo solidario de trabajo.

loans.use: huevos, quesos, harina de maíz, leche y también y varias bandejas.

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
Estela is a loving mother of two children; one is in high school and the other child sadly cannot study due to a permanent disability. She lives with her husband who has worked by her side for many years in the Bellavista market, where they have their own sales space, earned after long years of work and dedication. She began selling charcoal for her mother, because her family used to live near a sawmill and took advantage of the leftover wood to make this fuel that is so useful to other families in the community. With her mother as a teacher, she learned to run her business. Now, much later, she relies on the support of her husband, who is in charge of this work in one part of their home. Due to the demand that they have, they added a a small store to the house to meet the demands of their customers, local as well as those from the capital. And to meet the requirements of their project, they are requesting a $700 loan, promising to pay it back in six months. That way they can continue working and looking out for the well being of their family, particularly the needs of their little one at home. Let's help make Estela's dreams a reality so she can keep up her interminable energy for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer

Estela es una amorosa madre de dos hijos, uno está en el colegio y el otro hijo lamentablemente no puede estudiar debido a que padece de invalidez permanente; vive con su esposo quien trabaja con ella desde muy temprano en el mercado de Bellavista donde cuentan con un espacio propio de ventas adquirido a través de largos años de trabajo y dedicación.Empezó en el negocio del carbón por su mamá porque anteriormente su familia vivía cerca de un aserradero y aprovechaban los pedazos que sobraban de las maderas para fabricar este combustible tan apreciado por las familias de su comunidad. Es así como con esta importante maestra aprendió como era el negocio, ahora después de mucho tiempo cuenta con el apoyo directo de su esposo quién es la persona encargada de esta labor en un espacio de su hogar. Debido a la demanda que tienen adicionó en su casa un pequeño almacén para poder satisfacer los pedidos de sus clientes locales así como los de la capital; y para cumplir con sus proyectos solicita la suma de 700 dólares, en calidad de préstamo con un compromiso de devolución de seis meses para seguir trabajando, continuar velando por el bienestar de su familia y seguir con el tratamiento que demanda su pequeño en casa.Ayudemos a que se hagan realidad los anhelos de Estela para que siga conservando su interminable energía para bienestar de su familia.

loans.use: Purchase and supply of wood to make charcoal and increase sales.

loans.name: Blasina De La Cruz

texts.en:
Blasina is 45 years old, married, with eleven children. She dedicates herself to the sale of the Avon products, specializing in makeup, hair care, and skin care products. Avon is a global company with a very large range of products such as fragrance, bath and body products, as well as the products that Blasina sells.

Blasina started her business because her husband’s income is not enough to support the family. Blasina sells her goods in the afternoon, since she works in the morning as a housekeeper. She says she doesn’t feel bad about doing these jobs since the most important thing for her is to assure the well-being of her offspring.

A few months ago, Blasina took a loan from our organization which she invested in a large amount of products. With her daughter’s help, she was able to sell off all the goods and made great profits. She said with the additional income, it was easier for her to pay the tuition for her children’s school, pay the rent for her house, and now she is able to prepare meals in the morning before the children go to school.

Blasina hopes her business can keep on growing so that she can increase her sales volume and thus her income. She is requesting a second loan to invest in the purchase of a larger amount of goods to sell. She hopes she can attract new customers and hold them. Blasina’s family is very needy. Obtaining the loan will help her to save her children from poverty.

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of beauty products to supply her store

loans.name: Noel

texts.es:
Mr. Noel T. sells and repairs jewelry for a living. He started his business 9 years ago with $1,000 Nicaraguan Cordoba that he was able to save while working as a jewelry shop assistant.

Over the years, Mr. T. has invested more and more into his business, buying materials and upgrading his shop. In order to achieve these goals, Ceprodel has provided him with a total of 15 loans in the past 2 years. These loans have made a great impact on his business because he has been able update his work tools and has obtained a shop in which to run his business. Mr. T. stands out as being an excellent worker in the jewelry business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La venta y reparación de joyas es el negocio al que se dedica el caballero Noel T.. Inició hace 9 años con un capital propio de C$ 1,000 productos de ahorros que realizó cuando trabajaba de ayudante en otra joyería.

A medida que han venido transcurriendo los años, el señor T. ha decidido invertir cada vez mas en su negocio con la compra de nuevos materiales de trabajo y la remodelación de su negocio. Para poder haber realizado este avance, el señor T. se ha apoyado de los créditos que le ha brindado Ceprodel (15 créditos) desde hace 2 años. Cabe señalar que esto ha realizado un fuerte impacto en el negocio porque ha podido modernizar sus herramientas de trabajo y además ha adquirido un local donde realizar su trabajo que por cierto se destaca por ser un excelente trabajador en este ramo.

loans.use: Purchase of materials

loans.name: Kirinyabigo I(A) Group

texts.en:
Milly has a restaurant business. With the extra business profits, she intends to buy a plot of land and build a house. Harriet and Grace sell raw foods in the market and want to use the loan to expand the business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy food warmers.

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida P. A. is married, has three children and makes a living preparing kenkey, a native food made from corn. This product is in high demand, and Vita wants to increase production to meet the needs of all of her costumers. She has applied for a loan of $525 to buy more corn and other materials needed to prepare kenkey.

loans.use: To buy more corn and other items used to prepare a local dish.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.es:
Mrs. Rosalinda V. I. is a member of the communal bank "Alfonso Ugarte". She lives at the San Martín apartments, in the San Martín province, Tarapoto district. Her business is based out of her home, which is located on Alegría Arias de Morey, # 351. For ten years now, she has been selling different brands of perfume and cosmetics such as Esika, Avon, Unique in addition to clothing, wallets and shoes. She sells her products by catalog and special order; her main clients are workers of public and private institutions. With a loan of 1,000.00 Soles ($355 USD), which she will pay in 6 months, she will buy various items such as perfumes, lotions, shampoos, soaps, makeup, deodorant and other products like women's, men's and children's clothing, and accessories like wallets, and shoes of various models and colors that she brings from Lima. She is single and lives with 2 nieces. She is 54 years old and is very articulate; she makes friendships quickly which allows her to win over large quantities of clients. Her dream is to own a mini- mart.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

La señorita Rosalinda V. I. ,es socia del banco comunal “Alfonso Ugarte ” vive en el departamento de San Martín, provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto , su negocio se ubica en su propia casa Alegría Arias de Morey N° 351, se dedica hace 10 años a la venta de artículos de perfumería y cosméticos de diferentes marcas como Esika, Avon, Unique, y prendas de vestir, carteras y zapatos, que lo vende a través de pedidos y por catalogo,siendo sus principales clientes los trabajadores de instituciones públicas y privadas. Con el crédito de S/.1000.00 que será pagado en 6 meses, comprará diversos artículos como perfumes, cremas, champús, jabones, maquillajes, desodorante y otros productos mas, así como ropa de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños, accesorios como: cartera, zapatos en variedad de modelos y colores, que los trae desde la ciudad de Lima. Es soltera y vive con 2 sobrinas, tiene 54 años, es muy comunicativa hace rápidamente amistades lo que le permite ganarse gran cantidad de clientes, sueño con tener un minimarket.

loans.use: Purchase items to sell

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.es:
Cynthia is 25 years old and she has been married to her husband Cándido for 5 years. From this union they have given birth to two children, 4 and 3 years old respectively.

Cynthia's work is to make cigars (made with tobacco and branded as habanos). She began this activity 13 years ago helping her mother in the beginning, who also does the same work. Later, and with practice, Cynthia also acquired the profession.

This was how she took over the business when her mother moved away, looking for work. Today, she has a good clientele formed, and it is going well.

Cynthia's dream is to build her own house. For this reason she has acquired land where she is thinking to build in the near future. For this opportunity she needs the loan in order to buy the tobacco in large quantities as there is a large demand.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Cynthia tiene 25 años y está casada hace 5 años con Cándido de dicha unión nacieron dos hijos de 4 y 3 años respectivamente.

Cynthia se dedica a la fabricación de cigarros (hecho a base de tabaco y parecido al habano). Cuenta que comenzó hace 13 años en la actividad ayudando en un comienzo a su madre que también se dedicaba a lo mismo. Más adelante y con la práctica ella también fue adquiriendo la profesión.

Fue así que cuando su madre viajó al exterior en busca de trabajo ella se hizo cargo del negocio.

Hoy día ya cuenta con muy buena clientela formada y le va bastante bien.

El sueño de Cynthia es construir su casa propia, para tal efecto ya ha adquirido un terreno en donde piensa edificar en un futuro no muy lejano.

En esta oportunidad necesita de el préstamo para la compra de tabaco en grandes cantidades debido a que cuenta con una gran demanda.

loans.use: To buy bundles of tobacco

loans.name: Martha Patricia

texts.es:
Between my husband and myself, we are making it possible to expand our house. It is very small, and we are very crowded since the family is growing more. This is why I am requesting a loan of $1,200 to construct a room and to have more space in the house and for the children.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Entre mi esposo y yo estamos haciendo lo posible para ampliar mas la casa. Ya que esta muy reducida y estamos muy apretados ya que la familia esta creciendo mas. Es por eso que solicito un préstamo de $1,200.00 Dlls. Para la construcción de un cuarto. Y tener mas espacio en la casa y para los niños.

loans.use: Expansion of a room

loans.name: Urunboy

texts.ru:
Urunboy S. lives in the Rudaki region. He is in the business of children's clothing sales. He imports his inventory from China. He is married and has 2 children. His wife stays at home and takes care of the children. However, they have a garden, where they grow vegetables. They have a friendly and strong family, where everyone likes to work.

Urunboy does not have enough money to increase the inventory assortment and turnover. For this reason, he would like to obtain a loan. He plans to pay it off within the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Шокиров Урунбой живет в районе Рудаки. Занимается бизнесом в сфере торговли. Ездит в Китай за товаром. Торгует на рынке детской одеждой. Он женат и имеет двоих детей. Жена не работает. Но у них есть огород , где они выращивают овощи. Вся семья дружная и все любят работать.Но для оборота не хватает немного денег , поэтому он хочет получить кредит и таким образом увеличить товарооборот.Погасить кредит он исможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Neema is 30 years old. She is a single woman. She became a crops seller in 1997. Every day, she works from 7am to 5pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

In the past, Neema has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Neema now hopes for a loan to buy more crops like rice, maize, and millet for her business.

loans.use: To buy more crops for her business

loans.name: Kalsoom's Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom baji is married to S. M. and is a mother of eight children: four sons and four daughters. She lives in a small city named Arifwala, Pakistan. She owes a two room brick house and has been living in it for the last 20 years. Kalsoom baji is a housewife and sews clothes for her neighbors. Her elder son sells cigarettes. None of her children are getting education. Her husband has a business of livestock, buying and selling goats and cows. He has been in this profession for the last five years. She successfully repaid two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more cattle to resell.

She is joined in her loan group by four other members. N. baji wants a loan to buy more garment inventory to sell. Parveen baji wants a loan to buy more sweetmeat to re-sell. Parveen baji wants a loan to buy vegetables to re-sell. Shazia baji wants a loan to buy crockery to re-sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more cattle to resell

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en: For the past eight years, Gifty A., 31, has been trading in the local market of Obuasi in Ghana. She is married and has two children who are in school. She is a busy petty trader who sells palm kernel oil as her major source of income. She sells from a table in the local market. She does not have sufficient working capital to run the business. With the loan, she wants to inject more working capital into the business. She believes the loan will enable her to purchase good quality palm kernel stock so that she can process it into palm kernel oil and upgrade her inventory. She would be grateful for your assistance. She is a member of the group called Gospel Light Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee the loans for one another.

loans.use: To purchase palm kernel stock.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: FATOU G. COMMERCIALISE DES PRODUITS LOCAUX (ARACHIDE,MIL,MAIS,NIEBE ETC.....)DEPUIS 10 ANS.ELLE EST MARIE, ET HABITE AU QUARTIER CHAMP DE COURSE A DIOURBEL.
texts.en:
FATOU G. has been marketing local produce (peanuts, millet, corn, black eye peas, etc...) for ten years. She is married and lives in the CHAMP DE COURSE district in DIOURBEL.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell local produce

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Doña Maria tiene 43 años de edad vive en barrio de la capital de Managua llamado Memorial Sandino, tiene dos hijas de 12 y 15 años de edad. Es casada y su esposo es guardia de seguridad es un trabajo, en los cuales trabaja las veinte cuatro hora y el día siguiente lo tiene libre lo cual ocupa para ayudar  ayudar a sus hijos a estudiar y hacer parte de los aseo de la casa . Doña Maria trabaja como cajera en una comida rápida desde hace diez meses tiene como metas terminar hacer un cuarto,  para eso va a comprar materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento para poder estar en  mejores condiciones con su familia. Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic cada día mejora su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria is 43 years old and lives in a neighborhood of the capital city of Managua called Memorial Sandino. She has two daughters who are 12 and 15 years old. She is married and her husband is a security guard; at his job, he generally has to work 24 hours straight then has the following day free in which he helps his children to study and helps with the housework. Maria has worked as a cashier at a fast food restaurant for the past 10 months. She has the goal of finishing building a room in her home. In order to do it, she needs to purchase construction materials such as bricks, sand, and cement; in that way, she will be able to improve the living conditions of her family. Thanks to the loans from Afodenic, each day her living conditions improve.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to put up concrete walls

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: Elsa tiene 23 años de edad, tiene un hijo pequeño y vive junto a su conviviente que siempre la ayuda en todo. Ella se dedica a la venta de pescado en un puesto del mercado, desde hace seis años atrás, lo que le  gusta de su trabajo es dar una buena atención a sus clientes. Le es muy rentable porque sus pescados salen como pan caliente, nos dice, además cuenta con una clientela selecta y fiel a su puesto. Lo que dificulta su labor es durante las temporadas de lluvias porque no cuenta con un kiosco que la pueda cubrir. Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP, y ha demostrado ser responsable con sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita quiere  mandar a construir un kiosco y así protegerse de las lluvias, a ella y a su producto.
texts.en:
Elsa is 23-years-old. She has a young son and lives with her husband, who always supports her in everything. She has sold fish at a stand in the market for 6 years. What she likes about her job is giving good attention to her customers. She tells us that her business is profitable because her fish sell like hot cakes. She also has a select and loyal clientele that buy from her stand. The difficult part of her work is during times of rain because she doesn't have a kiosk that she can cover her fish with. This is her third loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she has proven to be responsible with her payments. With the money that she is requesting, she wants to have a kiosk constructed to protect herself and her products from the rain.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a kiosk to sell her products

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana is 35 years old and married with four children.

Christiana sells juice, drinks and bottled water. She has been in this business since 2002. She is an LAPO client. She purchases her drinks, juice and bottled water from distributors to sell to her customers. She hopes to expand her business.

She needs a loan of 70,000 so she can purchase more drinks and juice to sell. She is indeed grateful to all who will make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and juice to sell

loans.name: Naseem M. Ramzan Group

texts.en:
Naseem baji is a 33 year old married lady who has resided in a city named Arifwala in Pakistan, for the past 15 years. She is an uneducated lady. She is married to M. R., who is a cobbler by profession. He makes shoes for men and children, and he learned this art from his father. Naseem baji is the mother of two sons, who both help their father in his shoemaking business. Naseem baji also helps her husband make the shoes. This business has become their family business. She is applying for a loan to buy material (leather, nails and polish) to complete the orders of customers.

She is a group leader of some more women of her locale. Jannat baji wants a loan to buy remote controls for televisions to resell. Naheed baji wants a loan to buy material (biscuits and chips) for her canteen. Aroosa baji wants a loan to buy material (colored thread and tools) for her carpet weaving business. Shamim akhtar baji wants a loan to buy material (cloth, colored thread and sketches) for her embroidery business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy materials for shoemaking business.

loans.name: Estela De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
En el municipio de San Rafael del Sur la señora Estela de los Angeles se dedica con mucho esfuerzo a su negocio de venta de golosinas y en ocasiones venta de ropa con el propósito de mantener su núcleo familiar e ir mejorando las condiciones de su casa de habitación favoreciendo a sus pequeños hijos el cual requieren de su apoyo.

Se ha caracterizado por ser una excelente madre y excelente trabajadora que dedica el tiempo necesario a su trabajo para llevar el sustento a su hogar y mejorar las condiciones de su casa. La razón por la que espera en Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito que le permita la compra de las golosinas y la ropa para seguirlas comercializando ya que se le han agotado y requiere de ellas para que  de esta manera continúe en el mejoramiento de sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
In the municipality of San Rafael south, Estela works very hard at her business selling sweets, and sometimes selling clothing as well, in order to help support her family, make improvements on their home, and continue to improve the quality of life for her young children.

She is an excellent mother and hard worker, dedicating the necessary time to her business so she can maintain her home. She works with Ceprodel so that she can receive a loan to purchase more sweets and clothing to sell, as she has used up her inventory. In this way she can continue to grow her business and improve the conditions for her family.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more sweets and clothing to sell

loans.name: Rejoice

texts.en:
Rejoice Y. sells bread and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Rejoice is 36 years old and is married. Her husband is an administrator. She has three children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build studio for printing photos.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To build a studio for printing photos

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria T., 31, is married with 4 children. She has 5 years of experience in the fishing and plantation businesses. She sells to the general public 5 days per week. She has had 2 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 187 Tala. SPBD loans are Vitoria’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase a new fishing net, spears, goggles, a new boat, gromozones, weedkiller, and bushknives.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia S. is a 41-year-old mother of three. Her husband Dante is a tricycle driver. She buys and resells bangus fry (bangus is a local name for milk fish) to help support the family. She started getting loans from ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.) in 2002. Her past loans have been used for many things for the house and for the education of her eldest daughter who just graduated with a degree in Hotel and Restaurant Management.

She applied for this loan to finish paying off the old tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar) from her previous loan and to make a partial payment on a brand new motorcycle. She hopes that in the future she will be able to save enough money to expand her business and build a better house. She also dreams of sending her other two children to college.

loans.use: To be used to finish paying off the old tricycle and partial payment on the new motorcycle.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama I. is married with 2 children and has received no formal education. Mariama is a petty trader selling rice, corn and gari (cassava grits) at Siwdo in Cape Coast. While Mariama works as a petty trader, her husband is employed as a dentist.

Mariama uses her income to pay for her family’s food and also their water and light bills. Mariama will use the loan to support her business in the buying and selling of food supplies. With her newly gained capital, she plans to reinvest back into her enterprise.

loans.use: to expand her business in the buying and selling of food supplies

loans.name: Sabine

texts.fr: S. Sabine est née vers 1973 à Ekpè dans la Commune de Sèmè-Kpodji. Sabine est mariée à HOUESSOU Tierrie, un mécanicien de profession. Sabine est mère de trois enfants tous scolarisés. Sabine vend de l'huile en bidons de vingt cinq (25) litres et en bouteille d'un litre ainsi que du maïs en détail à domicile. C'est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Sabine va s'approvisionner en ses différents produits. Sabine n'arrive pas à satisfaire toutes les demandes de sa clientèle par manque de moyens financiers suffisants. Alors, Sabine s'est rapprochée de ALIDé pour avoir de crédit afin de mieux répondre à la demande de ses clients.
texts.en:
S. Sabine was born around 1973 in Ekpè in the township of Sèmè-Kpodji. Sabine is married to Houesou Tierrie, a professional mechanic. Sabine is the mother of 3 children, all enrolled in school. She sells oil in jerry cans of 25 liters and in bottles of 1 liter, as well as selling maize retail, out of her home. She goes to Dantokpa, the big international market of Benin, to stock up on her products. Sabine is not able to satisfy the needs of her clientele because she does not have sufficient financial means. So she has come to ALIDé to have a loan so as to better serve her clients.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of four jerry cans of 25 liters of peanut oil and a sack of 50 kg of maize

loans.name: Mario De La Cruz

texts.es: El señor Mario de la Cruz Rodríguez, tiene la edad de 47 años, reside en un bario de la capital de Managua que se llama Laureles Sur, casado, el negocio de don Mario es la venta de productos químicos junto a su esposa que le ayuda a vender desde hace nueve años, inicio este negocio con prestamos financieros en Afodenic es su décimo crédito el cual invertirá en la compra de un caballo que le ayude a agilizar sus gestiones. Sus planes es poder mejora su casa, e incrementar su inventario para vender más y obtener mejores ganancias. Da las gracias a la institución por los logros obtenidos.
texts.en:
Mario de la Cruz Rodríguez is 47 years old, married, and lives in a neighborhood of Managua called Laureles Sur. Mario’s business is the sale of chemical products, which he has carried out together with his wife for the past nine years. He started his enterprise with loans with Afodemic. This is his tenth loan, which he will invest into the purchase of a horse to help him to expedite his deliveries. His plans include making improvements to his home, and to increase his inventory so he can sell more and augment his earnings. He gives thanks to the institution for the strides he’s made.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a horse to help expedite his sales.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda G. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 54 years old and married with 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Leonarda prepares and sells a variety of food products in the local community. Leonarda has been in this business for over 22 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

Leonarda joined PMPC in 2000 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonarda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC, which she had used to purchase additional products to sell.  Leonarda is now requesting her 20th loan from PMPC in the amount of of 30,000 PHP.  She will use it for working capital and to purchase additional inventory, and plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her family's living conditions. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory.

loans.name: Maria Rosa Dolores

texts.es:
María Rosa es oriunda de Zhidmad, comunidad de Santa Ana, provincia del Azuay, tiene 48 años de edad, es soltera y tiene un hijo de 15 años de edad, su hijo estudia en el colegio de Santa Ana (Técnico Daniel Ermida), vive en casa de sus padres ya que fue la última hija de cinco que les acompañó hasta su muerte, tiene animales como vacas lecheras, cerdos, pollos, cuyes, gallinas, y los vende según como se presenta la oportunidad. 
Se dedica al comercio informal en los mercados de la ciudad de Cuenca vendiendo legumbres, frutas, verduras, y cualquier cosa que pueda negociar, de Lunes a Sábado, tiene un horario aproximado de 7 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde, según como este la venta. Luego de esto se traslada a su casa para hacerse cargo del cuidado de sus animales, los fines de semana comercializa ganado vacuno, los compra flacos y luego de unos tres a cuatro meses los engorda para  nuevamente sacarlos a la feria o los vende en su propia casa. Lo que le preocupa hoy es la enfermedad que están teniendo los animales (fiebre aftosa) lo que dificulta el libre negocio del los animales.
María Rosa es socia de la Fundación  espoir aproximadamente unos 3 años y ahora solicitó un crédito de 440 dólares para comprar abonos para su terreno y también un torito para hacer yunta ya que se acerca la  temporada de siembras, luego de terminar las siembras nuevamente pondrá a la venta los animales.
Su meta en la vida es seguir comprando animales y comprar más terrenos para sembrar diferentes productos como maíz, fréjol, papas y muchos productos más.
texts.en:
María Rosa is from Zhidmad, community of Santa Ana, province of Azuay. She is 48 years old, single with a 15-year-old son who studies in the school of Santa Ana (Técnico Daniel Ermida). She lives in her parents' house as she was the oldest daughter of five who stayed with them till their death. She keeps animals such as milking cows, pigs, chickens, guinea pigs, and hens which she sells whenever there is an opportunity.

She is an informal vendor at the markets of the town of Cuenca. She sells vegetables, fruits and whatever can be sold from Monday through Saturday from approximately 7 am to 5 pm, depending on sales. After work she takes care of her animals and on week-ends she sells cattle, which she has bought and raised for three-four months, at different markets or from home. At the present she is worried about the disease attacking the animals (foot and mouth disease) which makes business difficult. María Rosa has been a partner of "Fundación Espoir" for approximately 3 years, and is requesting a loan of US$440 to buy fertilizers for her land as well as a young bull for a yoke as the sowing season is getting close. After the sowing season she plans to sell the animal. It is her life goal to continue buying animals and more land to be able to sow different products such as corn, beans, potatoes, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers as well as a young bull.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
This is Sofia G., who is a 46-year-old woman living in the town of Lalovaea B. She is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Sofia operates a family member's business venture in the manufacturing sector, manufacturing and selling leather products to local businesses and community members. Sofia has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 600 WST a month.

In 2009, Sofia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and to increase her ability to engage in business activities. Sofia is now requesting her first loan from SPBD in the amount of 1,000 WST, which will be used for working capital and to purchase additional inventory. Sofia plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive, and self-esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To gain working capital and to purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Jubel

texts.en:
Jubel O. is from the village of Zions Canituan, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 22 years old and single. To make a living, Jubel owns and operates a business providing pedicab services, transporting members of the local community from place to place. Jubel has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Jubel joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jubel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Jubel is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide his pedicab service. This loan will be his third from HSPFI. Jubel plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide his pedicab service

location.town: Zions, Canitoan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es: La Señora Maria del Socorro P. Ruiz tiene la edad de 64 años, su estado civil es casada, esta Señora tiene 5 hijos que trabajan de manera independiente, sus deseos son de prosperar en el negocio que tiene actualmente ya que este es el que le ha ayudado a salir adelante por lo que le proporcionado que sus hijos puedan estudiar. La actividad económica a la que se dedica brindar los servicios de costura, la ubicación de su negocio es en su humilde vivienda, hace más de 10 años, que se dedica a esta actividad. Ella inicia este negocio porque tenía que proporcionarles a sus hijos el alimento diario. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo destinado para la compra de productos como hilos, tela, botones, agujas entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Ms. Maria del Socorro P. Ruiz is 64 years old, is married, and has 5 children who work independently. She wants to succeed in the business that she currently has because it is the one that has helped them to get ahead by allowing the children to study. The business that she runs provides sewing services and is located in her humble home. She has been running the business for 10 years. She started the business because she had to provide food daily for her children. The loan is to be used for working capital to buy products such as wire, fabric, buttons, and needles, among other things.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma M. is from the village of Biasong. She is 53 years old. Norma is married and has 1 school-aged children. To make a living, Norma owns & operates a business venture in the manufacturing sector operating a manufacturing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from manufacturing & selling clay products to local businesses and community members. Norma has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Norma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Norma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Norma is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Norma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Almira

texts.en:
Almira B. is from the village of Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 40 years old. Almira is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Almira owns & operates a retail store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Almira has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Almira joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Almira has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Almira is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Almira from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: María Celia

texts.es: María Celia R. reside en el municipio de Colon en el departamento de La Libertad. María tiene 43 años de edad, es soltera y vive solamente con su madre. María tiene veinte años de experiencia en su negocio, ha montado una venta de tamales, una costumbre de generación, ya que su madre era antes la que llevaba adelante el negocio y ahora es María, quien se dedica a la elaboración de los mismos, pero ahora ella esta solicitando un crédito para insumos utilizados en su negocio, como maíz, pollo y otros.
texts.en:
María Celia R. lives in the Colon municipality in the La Libertad department. María is 43 years old, is single, and lives just with her mother. María has been working in her business for twenty years, which is the sale of tamales (a regional food). This business is a family tradition – previously her mother ran it, but now it is María who makes her living from making the tamales. She is seeking a loan to buy her business's ingredients, such as corn, chicken, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for cooking tamales (food)

loans.name: Sadith

texts.es: Sadith es una mujer dinámica y trabajadora, vive en la ciudad D. Pucallpa región D. Ucayali, tiene 48 años, es madre soltera D. cinco hijos todos mayores D. edad, Sadith se dedica a la venta D. zapatos. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Corazón D. Jesús” desD. hace seis años,  el primer préstamo que recibió fue D. 300 soles que le permitió invertir en zapatos. En la actualidad requiere un préstamo D. 1400 soles, monto que será utilizado para comprar D. zapatos. La meta D. Sadith es  tener una tienda D. zapatos con diferentes diseños y tallas.
texts.en:
Sadith is a dynamic and hard-working woman, who lives in the Pucallpa region of Ucayali. She is 48 years old, and the single mother of five children who are now grown. Sadith dedicates herself to selling shoes. She has been a member of the “Jesus’ Heart” cooperative bank for six years, having received a first loan of 300 Peruvian soles that allowed her to invest in shoes. Currently, she requires a loan of 1,400 soles, an amount that will be used to purchase more shoes. Sadith’s goal is to have a shoe store with different styles and sizes.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Her loan will be invested into the purchase of shoes.

loans.name: Dulam

texts.en:
E. is a 37-year-old widow who lives with her three children in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. She and her three children live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. All three of her children attend university and E. operates a meat retail business out of a rented stall in a local market. She began her business in 1998 and in her eleven years in operation, she has gained many loyal customers and much experience. She is planning on building and opening a small grocery store next year so that she can increase her income and pay for her children’s tuition fees more easily. E. is requesting a 3,770,000 tugrug (~2650 USD) loan to purchase a large amount of meat for her business during the upcoming winter months.

About XacBank XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save. To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of meat for her business during the upcoming winter months

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene D. is from the city of Biray Ozamiz City. She is 33 years old, married and has an infant child. Arlene's main source of income comes from her food production and retailing business which she has operated for over two years. She makes foods such as bananacues (grilled banana), hot cakes, and binignits. Her business generates approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Arlene joined GDMPC to access their financial services in an effort to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Arlene is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be Arlene's first GDMPC loan. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business.

loans.name: Horn

texts.en:
Horn S., 42, is married and lives with her three school-aged children and husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She used to sell groceries in her village but business was not good. As a result, she started a new business selling fruit in the city. She has been involved in this business since 2008 and is able to earn US $5 per day. Her husband (in the photo) drives a motorbike in the city earning US $4 per day. Her husband helps with her business every morning, preparing to sell to their regular customers, then he travels around the city offering his transportation services.

S. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living. As a result, she is requesting a loan of US $500 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. This is her first loan from CREDIT. She wants to use the loan to purchase a new motorbike for her husband because the old motorbike often goes broken.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy motor spare-sparts in bulk

loans.name: Sou

texts.en:
Sou S., age 38, is married and resides with her children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. She has two children. She is engaged in a business selling various kinds of groceries in the city, earning approximately an income of US$ 5 per day. By doing so, she is able to cover her family expenses, especially the children’s education. She has been in this business since 2000. Her husband is a construction worker, earning a gross income of US$ 15 per day.

The standard of living of the family has improved since she has been in this business, so she wants to have a loan to expand her business. S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to buy more groceries to stock her store. This is her first loan from CREDIT, partnered with Kiva.

loans.use: buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase food products

loans.name: Amenaghawon

texts.en: Amenaghawon sells planks. She has been in this business for eight years. She is a friendly and happy woman. She loves her business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She is 49 years old and married with three children. Her husband is a businessman. Amenaghawon is requesting a loan amount of NGN 150,000 to purchase more planks to sell. She says thank you to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Analia Mabel

texts.es:
La Srta. Analía M. es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, es soltera, vive con sus padres, en la compañía de Caazapá.

   Analía manifiesta que desde muy jóven empezó a trabajar en el oficio de la artesanía junto con su madre, hoy día ella lo realiza sola ya que su madre sufre de una enfermedad.

  Debido a la gran aceptación que tiene sus productos y teniendo en cuenta que se acerca el invierno, se acercó a la Fundación Paraguaya para solicitar un nuevo préstamo para la compra de hilos y color que son los materiales necesarios para la fabricación de sus sobrecamas ya que ha recibido muchos pedidos y de esta manera podrá satisfacer demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Analía M. is from the city of Carapeguá. She is single, and she lives with her parents in the Caazapá neighborhood. Analía says that when she was very young she started working in the handicrafts field with her mother. Now she does it alone because her mother is ill. Due to the great acceptance of her products, and keeping in mind that winter is coming, she approached the Fundación Paraguaya to ask for a new loan. The loan is to buy thread and color, which are the materials needed to make her bedspreads. She has received a lot of orders, and this way she will be able to satisfy her customer demand.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy thread

loans.name: Osaretin

texts.en:
Tailoring is a business that has brought joy to Osaretin. All these are seen in the success the business has brought to his life. People from different parts of his city patronize his business. He also sells tailoring materials and sarongs to boost his profit. He hopes for a loan of NGN100,000 to purchase more tailoring materials and sarongs to sell.

At 26, Osaretin is married with 2 children. They live in Edo State, Nigeria. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials and sarongs to sell

loans.name: Daariimaa

texts.en:
Daariimaa B. is 40 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional nomadic housing tent. Her oldest two daughters attend a local secondary school and her youngest son is in primary school. Her husband, Balsanjav, works as a solderer for a private company.
Daariimaa operates a shoe trading business at Narantuul market, the largest outdoor market in the city. She started her business in 2005 with capital of 500,000 MNT after moving to the city from Hovd province in far western Mongolia where she operated a cashmere business. Since 2005, she has grown her business successfully and today her working capital exceeds 3,000,000 MNT.
Daariimaa is an industrious person with good business sense. She has used her business to greatly improve her family's quality of life. She has used her profits to build a new house for her family. Daariimaa has many plans for the future and hopes to save money this summer so she can pay her children's education fees. She is requesting a 4,000,000 MNT loan to purchase another counter at the market as well as new shoes to sell that she will import from China.

loans.use: To purchase another counter at the market and new shoes for resale

loans.name: Hing

texts.en:
Mrs. Hing M. is 39 years old and is a villager who lives in Andoung Samretth village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 2 hectare of land where she cultivates rice and vegetables. Her husband, Mr. Samnang Brakk, is a police officer who receives a small salary to support his family.

In order to increase income to improve the family's living standard, Mrs. Hing M. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. With the rest of the loan she wants to buy fertilizer and pesticide to support her farming crops.

The couple has two children who are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding and also to buy fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
