Maria plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Jenipha

texts.en:
Jenipha is a member of the Nyamwenda 2 borrower group in Himo,Kilimanjaro,she is 30 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 4 children.Her children are aged 14,10,7 and 3 years.

Jenipha started her own clothing business selling clothes 3 years ago,she works 7 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 130,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Jenipha first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes for sale .

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Jenipha hopes to save money,pay school fees and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: CONSTRUCCION

loans.name: Horlinda

texts.es:
Horlinda tiene 55 años, es una mujer muy alegre y entusiasta, vive en su casa propia donde acoge a la familia de sus dos hijos, con quienes comparte momentos agradables junto a sus nietos. Durante todo el día vende deliciosos dulces y golosinas en la puerta de su domicilio, donde instaló un pequeño puesto y donde espera con mucha alegría a sus clientes, que en su mayoría son niños y escolares de su localidad. Lo que más le agrada de su trabajo es la sonrisa de los niños, quienes la contagian con su buen sentido del humor, ella lleva 27 años vendiendo en su casa y considera que lo difícil es atender su puesto con sus nietos alado, pues no desea que sus pequeños consuman demasiados dulces que perjudiquen su salud. Para el futuro, Horlinda espera ampliar su negocio y tener un local donde pueda vender frutas y bebidas, productos que son muy consumidos en el verano.
Este es su tercer préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y sabe que su puntualidad es una de las garantías que la respaldan. Con los tres mil soles solicitados implementará su puesto con nuevos productos.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Loa

texts.en: Loa S., 25, is married and has a three-year-old child. She resides in Kompong Chnang Province, Cambodia with her husband (pictured). To make a living, she is currently employed in a local garment factory, earning an income of US $2 per day. Her husband is employed in a private company, earning approximately an income of US $7 in revenue per day, which they use to cover their household expenses. This primary source of income helps his family a lot. This couple tries to work hard every day for the sake of their child. S. is seeking to improve her standard of living by starting another business, so she is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase animal food for her pigs. By doing so, she hopes that she will be able to generate more income.

loans.use: purchasing pig food

loans.name: Alain Alonso

texts.es:
Alaín tiene 20 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres y cuatro hermanos en el pueblo joven San Martín, ubicado en la ciudad de Lambayeque, a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Hace tres años su madre adquirió una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utilizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros) y se la entregó para que trabajara en ella. Durante todo este tiempo el ha estado trabajando en la mototaxi y con ella ha estado apoyando a su familia, asimismo también se ha pagado sus estudios de mecánica automotriz en un Instituto de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El continuo uso otorgado a su unidad móvil ha hecho que empiece a sufrir fallas y para repararlas es preciso comprarle nuevas piezas a su motor, por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la reparación de su vehículo y en la legalización de los papeles de propiedad y licencias necesarias para ganarse el sustento de forma segura.

Alaín desea seguir estudiando para asegurarse su futuro y seguir apoyando a su familia. El es un joven muy querido y estimado por los vecinos de la zona en donde vive.
texts.en:
Alaín is 20 years old, single and lives with his parents and four brothers in the town of San Matrín, located in the city of Lambayeque, 15 minutes from Chiclayo city.

Three years ago his mother bought a mototaxi (a motorized taxi vehicle used for transporting cargo and passengers) and gave it to him so he could use it to work. During this time he has been working with the mototaxi and with it has been able to support his family, as well as pay his auto mechanic studies in Chiclayo Institute.

The continuous use of his mobile unit has caused malfunctions and to repair it he needs to buy new parts for the engine. This is the reason he needs to request Edpyme Alternativa 1000 soles (Peruvian currency) to repair his vehicle, to legalize his documents of ownership, and the necessary licenses to earn his living securely.

Alaín wishes to continue studying to secure his future and continue to support his family. He is a well-loved young man and appreciated by his neighbors in the area he lives in.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair his vehicle's engine.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
la sra. Adriana Z. se dedica al comercio, cuenta con un negocio de venta de refrescos, agua, jugos etc. Adriana Vive en la aldea de Lajero blanco carretera a Cedeño, este lugar es muy caliente, ya que cedeño es una playa de la costa del pacifico de Honduras.
este tipo de producto se vende mucho aqui en esta localidad ya que hace mucha calor en todo el dia y las personas buscan tomar algo helado y refrescante para calmar la sed. 
Adriana busca comprar mas mercaderia ya que tiene una refrigeradora vacia y necesita llenarla de prodcuto para tenerlo bien helado y asi mejorar sus ventas, ademas que los carros que reparten los refrescos llegan una vez por semana y su producto se le termina muy rapido y para comprar mas tiene que viajar a la ciudad de Çholuteca es por tal razon que ella necesita el credito.
texts.en:
Adriana Z. is a merchant. She sells soft-drinks, water, juices, etc. Adriana lives in the Lajero Blanco village, located along the Cedeño highway. The climate here is very hot since Cedeño is a beach on Honduras' pacific coast. This type of product sells well due to the daily heat and folks look to drink something cold and refreshing to quench their thirst. Adriana seeks to buy more merchandise since she has an empty refrigerator and she needs to fill it with product to have nice and cold and improve her sales. Also, the soft-drink distribution trucks only come by once a week and they run out of product quickly so, if she wants to buy more stock, she has to go to the city of Çholuteca. This is why she needs this financing.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft-drinks, juices, bottled water, bagged juices, vegetable juices.

loans.name: Kesia

texts.en:
Kesia L. is a woman living in the town of Sataua Uta. She is married and has 3 young children. To make a living, Kesia owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting taro for sale. Kesia has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 300 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Kesia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Kesia is requesting a loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Kesia plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Sharavdorj

texts.en:
S. Sharavdorj is 39 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in a house in Zavhan province, Mongolia. His girls, ages 12 and 6, both attend secondary school and his wife is the director at the local tax office. Sharavdorj manages a raw materials trading business in his town. He collects raw materials, such as animal skins and products, from the countryside and transports them to Ulaanbaatar, the largest city and capital of Mongolia, to sell. Sharavdorj has been in business for 12 years now and has built a consistent operation over the years. He is focused on growing his business and hopes to expand in the near future. He says, “I am working hard to improve my business.” He is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase raw materials to sell in his business.

About XacBank
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here:http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&queryString=Mongolia&status=fundRaising&gender=All&sectors[]=All&regions[]=All&sortBy=Expiring+Soon

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to sell

loans.name: Lutgarda

texts.en:
Lutgarda P., 56 years old, is a farmer in Banga, South Cotabato. Her parents taught her everything she knows about planting corn and maintaining a good and quality harvest. Her farm is earning very well but she admitted that she still needs additional capital to grow her business.

Lutgarda joined the loan program of Community Economic Ventures, Inc. in 2008. She likes the program very much and that is why she is still a member of the CEVI cluster association.

Lutgarda would like to apply for another loan of Php 10,000. She will use the loan to buy farm inputs and supplies. In this way, she believes she will be able to obtain a greater harvest and more income for her family.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs and supplies

loans.name: Twegatte Association, Jinja Group

texts.en:
I. Paul is 28 years old and the leader of his lending group in Jinja. He is a married man with three children aged 6, 4, and 2 years and he helps to care for his sister who is in school.

Paul is a businessman dealing in the sale of clothes, maize, beans and coffee from Namulesa; for eight years he has been dealing in all these businesses. The main challenge that he faces, especially with his clothes business, is that some customers take the goods on credit and fail to pay, hence having a bad effect on his cash flow.

On average, Paul makes 90,000/= as weekly profits and one of his strong points is that he is a hardworking man with a strong drive to invest more in his businesses. He needs a loan to help him restock all his businesses with more goods and produce.

loans.use: To buy more farm produce to sell and more new clothes for his shop

loans.name: Blanca Mirian

texts.es: Blanca  Mirian   C.  M. de 57 años de edad, reside en Lourdes colón, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo el cual es jubilado, y quien le ayuda a ella con el negocio. Blanca posee una venta de tortillas, en la cual se encarga de elaborarlas y venderlas. El negocio está ubicado en su casa, lugar en el cual las personas llegan a comprar las tortillas, las cuales las prefieren, debido a que blanca cuenta con 8 años de experiencia. Así mismo ella se encarga de llevar tortillas a los trabajadores de una fábrica que está ubicada cerca de su casa, labor en la cual su esposo le ayuda cargando las tortillas hasta la fábrica. Por esta razón Blanca solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda obtener el dinero necesario para comprar mayores cantidades de maíz, cal, y gas propano, para la elaboración y cocción de las tortillas, esto le será de mucho beneficio para ella debido a que le permitirá hacer mayor cantidad d producto y así podrá atender mayor cantidad de pedidos. Blanca es una persona muy trabajadora a quien le llena de mucha ilusión el poder atender más clientes y aceptar más pedidos, lo cual se convierte en mayores ganancias para ella y su esposo.
texts.en:
Blanca Mirian C. M. is 57 years old and lives in Lourdes Colón, in the La Libertad zone. She lives with her husband, who is retired and helps her with the business. The business is located in their home, where people go to buy their favorite tortillas (as Blanca has 8 years of experience). She is also in charge of delivering tortillas to the workers at a factory that is located close to her home, and her husband helps her by carrying the tortillas to the factory. Blanca is asking for a loan to obtain the money needed to buy greater quantities of corn, lime, and propane gas for making tortillas. This would be of great benefit to her since it would let her make a greater quantity of her product and be able to fill more orders. Blanca is a very hard-working person who is full of hope because she will be able to attend to more customers and accept more orders, which will result in higher earnings for herself and for her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, lime, and propane gas

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia A. is from the village of Aguada, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 60 years old. Virginia is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Virginia owns and operates a curtain and dress making business. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 8,500 PHP a month for these activities.

 In 2008, Virginia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used as additional capital to her curtain and dress making business. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional curtain and clothing materials. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Virginia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

 About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pruchase additional clothing materials.

loans.name: Dembagnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les 4 femmes du groupe Dembagnouma  sont toutes mariées. Elles ont en moyenne 37 ans, 4 enfants et vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Dibida, un des villages de Fana, préfecture de Dioila, deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali.
Ces femmes du groupe Dembagnouma qui se sont connus à travers des liens de voisinage, font essentiellement l’achat et la vente des articles divers tels les habits les cosmétiques et des  grains de céréales.
Après avoir correctement remboursés les cinq prêts précédents, elles  sont à leur  sixième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter, une grande quantité de grains de céréales sèches (fonio, petit mil, maïs, haricot) estimée à 19 sacs de 100 kg. 
Elles s’approvisionnent essentiellement auprès des producteurs du village et environs et effectuent leurs ventes au marché de Fana, à domicile,  généralement au comptant, à une clientèle composée de femmes, d’hommes et de revendeurs venant des grandes ville telles  Bamako, Ségou et Koulikoro.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen mensuel de  22.500FCFA qui sera  utilisé pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The four women of the group Dembagnouma are all married. On average, they are 37 years old, with four children each and they live in traditional extended families in Dibida, one of the towns of Fana, a county of Dioila, the second administrative region of the republic of Mali. The women of the group Dembagnouma know one another through neighborhood connections. Their business is essentially re-selling various items, such as clothing, cosmetics and cereals/ grains. Having fully repaid their five previous loands, they are requesting their sixth loan, with they will use to purchase a large quantity of dried cereals (fonio (a millet-like grain), small millet, corn and beans) - approximately nineteen 100 kilograms sacks. They mostly supply themselves from farmers in and around their own town. They sell their goods in the market of Fana and from their homes, generally for cash, to a clientele composed of women, men and re-sellers in the large towns of Bamako, Ségou and Koulikoro. They envision each earning an average monthly income of 22,500FCFA, which they will use to pay for the needs of their families and invest the rest in their businesses.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cereals

loans.name: Darlin Maria

texts.es: Darlin tiene 28 años, es madre de 3 hijos menores de edad que están a su cargo. Desde hace mas de 12 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que sus inicios son con esfuerzos propios, pues desde muy joven su Mama le enseño a ganarse la vida vendiendo refrescos, Darlin no tuvo la oportunidad de finalizar sus estudios, por lo que tenía que ayudar a su Mama a vender es por eso que lucha todos los días para darle esa oportunidad a sus hijos, a pesar de las difíciles situaciones que ha enfrentado sigue con esta actividad. Ella invertirá el financiamiento en materia prima pues así comprara azúcar, bolsas, pajillas y las frutas. Sueña con mejorar su vivienda, pues todavía no tiene ciertos servicios básicos.
texts.en:
Darlin is 28 years old and the mother of 3 children who are minors and in her care. She has been in the business of selling soft drinks for over 12 years and started with her own efforts, since her mother taught her how to make a living selling soft drinks.

Darlin didn't have a chance to finish school, since she had to help her mother to sell soft drinks. This is why she struggles every day to give that opportunity to her children, despite the difficult situations she has faced, she remains in this activity.

She will invest the money as working capital to buy sugar, bags, straws and fruit. She dreams with improving her house since it doesn’t have the basic services.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet G. is from the village of Bolao, Iponan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 31 years old. Juliet is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Juliet owns & operates a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling children's clothing, DVD players, and food for the children such as biscuits in the local community. Juliet has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Juliet joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juliet has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Juliet is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Juliet from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Bolao, Iponan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro Chavarría Gonzales  es un señor de 57 años de edad el cual vive con su esposa  y sus 2 hijos en una comunidad llamada Caño Negro localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja.

Desde muy joven don Pedro se ha dedicado a la ganadería, de esta forma ha mantenido a su familia. Comenta que tiene ya 40 años de estar en este proyecto por lo que ha podido experimentar todos los cuidados que demanda y la instrucción adecuada. Dice que se siente muy orgulloso ya que ha visto como poco a poco ha salido adelante.  

Don Pedro desea obtener un micro crédito de ¢666,000 (seiscientos sesenta y seis  mil colones) para comprar más terneros y poder hacer crecer  su negocio ya que desea ser un microempresario exitoso y  así poder ayudar a que su familia siga adelante ya que ellos representan la motivación para esforzarse cada día y trabajar con esmero.

Don Pedro  forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal EMCRECOBA, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su tercer préstamo y asegura que estos le han ayudado muchísimo para llevar a cabo sus proyectos.
texts.en:
Pedro Chavarría Gonzales, 57, lives with his wife and two children in a community called Caño Negro located in Los Chiles, Alajuela province. This community is notable for being a mountainous area very close to the country’s northern border. Its main economic activities are farming, specifically basic grains, sugar cane and oranges, and cattle-raising. Pedro has raised cattle since he was very young; this is how he has supported his family. He tells us that he’s been in this line of work for 40 years so he has experienced all the cares it demands as well as adequate training. He says that he’s very proud because he has gradually gotten ahead in life. Pedro wants a 666,000 colones loan to buy young calves to raise so that his business will succeed; he wants to be a successful micro entrepreneur to help his family get ahead because they are his motivation to continue his daily efforts to work hard. Pedro is a member of EMCRECOBA communal bank, one EDESA’s 100 member organizations in Costa Rica. This will be his 3rd loan and he assures us that loans have been of great use to him in reaching his goals.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy six calves.

loans.name: Kiden

texts.en:
Kiden B. is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs at her restaurant and is requesting a loan to import more chickens and bags of cassava flour from Uganda.

Kiden is 41 years old and is married to a watchman. She has five children, two of whom go to school.

With the extra profits from her loan, Kiden hopes to be able to extend the floor of her hotel (restaurant).

loans.use: To import more chickens and bags of cassava flour from Uganda

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy palm nuts

loans.name: Mrs. Yet Ouch Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Yet O. has been selected as village bank loan group leader by fourteen people who are located in Srae Pou village in Takeo province. All the members make up a village bank loan, and they will each use a small part of the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Yet O. was born in 1972. She is a silk cloth seller at her local market. Since her business is going well she wants to expand. So to improve this business, Mrs. Yet O. is seeking a loan to buy more silk cloth for resale. Her husband, Mr. Phong Choub, is a farmer who owns one-hectare of land to cultivate rice on to sell to support his family and he is a cow middleman, too. 

Mrs. Yet O.  is the mother of three children, one of whom is a construction worker, while the others are attending local public school.

loans.use: To buy more silk cloth for resale

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El señor Mario G. M. es de la ciudad de  Santani, con casa propia, soltero, tiene 36 años de edad.
 
           Es propietario de una gomeria con 11 años de funcionamiento, tambien vende cubiertas nuevas y usadas, esta muy bien ubicado, al costado de la ruta 3.

               Es su tercera operación de creditos con esta institución, canceló en forma excelente sus creditos anteriores, y solicita nuevamente el credito para la compra de cubiertas e infladores.
texts.en:
Señor Mario G. M. lives in the city of Santani in his own house. He is single and 36 years of age. He is the owner of a tire store with 11 years of experience. He also sells used and new wheel covers. His business is in a good location, next to route 3. This is his third loan with this institution, having repaid his previous loans in excellent fashion. He again requests a loan for the purchase of wheel covers and pumps.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wheel covers and pumps for resale

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, tiene 24 años, es soltero, vive solo en compañía de sus padres. Juntos viven en su casa propia. El cuidar adecuadamente sus chacras es su principal función, desde hace 12 años disfruta ver como se desarrollan las plantaciones de plátanos, café, frutas cítricas, entre otros productos oriundos de esta zona, aunque le es difícil tener que limpiarlos, pues no le gusta machetear ni retirar las malezas, ya que estando a diario con esta actividad sus brazos le llegan a doler. Por  eso prefiere plantar y cosechar, además Juan pone en practica las técnicas agrícolas que le enseño su padre. En adelante continuara con esta actividad, puesto que el café y plátano son productos muy solicitados en el mercado, además desea construir su propia casa, y en ella instalar un negocio de venta de comestibles. Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y desde un principio trabaja de manera activa en su grupo comunal, junto a sus compañeros. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará decenas de plantas de café y varios sacos de abono para abonar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Juan is 24 years old, single, and lives with his parents in a home that they own. His primary job is to provide adequate care to his fields. For the past ten years, he has enjoyed developing his crops of bananas, coffee, citrus fruits, and other products that are native to the area. Clearing his fields is difficult work, which explains why he does not like removing brush and pulling weeds. Doing this type of work every day makes his arms sore. Juan prefers to plant and harvest, as well as utilize the farming techniques that his father taught him. Later on he hopes to continue growing coffee and bananas since these products are in high demand at the market. In addition, he wants to build his own house and establish a business selling groceries.

This is the second time he has received a loan from MFP. From the start, Juan has worked as an active member of his Communal Bank with the other members. The loan he requested will be used to buy dozens of coffee plants and several sacks of compost for fertilizing his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase coffee plants & sacks of compost

loans.name: Sergio Alberto

texts.es: Sergio Alberto de 64 años de edad, tiene 5 hijos y todos trabajan de manera independiente. Sergio se dedica a la venta de madera, la venta está ubicada en su casa de habitación, lugar el cual es muy bueno para la venta, ya que se encuentra en un lugar muy concurrido, ya que tiene muchos clientes que siempre apreciar los productos de él. El negocio es muy estable, por lo que Sergio solicita un préstamo con el deseo de poder aumentar su inventario comprando mayor variedad de maderas para la elaboración de sus productos, todo esto con el deseo de mejorar sus ventas y así contar con una vida mejor para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Sergio Alberto is 64 years old. He has five children, and they all work independently. Sergio sells wood, and this business is located at his house. The location is very good for sales because it is in a very busy place. He has many customers who always value his products. The business is very stable. Serio is requesting a loan because he wants to be able to increase his inventory. He will buy a greater variety of wood in order to make his products. All of this is because he wants to improve his sales. That way he and his family will have a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jona

texts.en:
Jona A. is from the town of Roxas Cordon Isabela. She is 29 years –old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Jona owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Jona has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 8,200 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jona joined Kiva partner ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jona has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  Jona is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Jona from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Baraka Alanine Group

texts.fr: ManZ. B. est  trésorière du groupe Baraka Alanine, âgée de 37 ans, mariée, mère de 2 enfants, son mari est vendeur de bassin plastic au marché sectoriel de Kibabi-Birere. Son fils ainé est 2e primaire et le second fait l’école maternelle. Juste l’après l’éruption du volcan Nyiragongo, qui aurait complètement détruit la ville de Goma en 2002, elle  commença son business avec son fond propre par la vente des  divers objets ménagers notamment des assiettes, casseroles, fourchettes, etc. plus tard, elle bénéficia du crédit de  Hekima en 2006 pour renforcer son business de commerce. Elle expose ses marchandises dans le marché sectoriel Alanine. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir d’approvisionner  certaines marchandises notamment les pantalons uniformes bleus pour les écouler à la rentrée scolaire d’ici début septembre 2010. Elle souhaiterait  construire une maison un peu spacieuse et faire scolariser ses enfants confortablement. En plus, elle ambitionne avoir une chambre boutique pour ses marchandises. La cliente ManZ. B. remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres citoyens exclus de banque classique.  Il sied de signaler que ce groupe Baraka Alanine est composé de 21 membres, majoritairement femmes dont un homme , monsieur Jules L. n’a pas été présent lors de prise de photo du groupe. Cet homme est le président du marché sectoriel Alanine.
texts.en:
ManZ. B. is the treasurer of the group, Baraka Alanine. She is 38 years old, married, and the mother of 2 children. Her husband is a plastic basin salesman at the Kibabi-Birere sectoral market. Her eldest son is in his second year of primary school and her second is in nursery school. Just after the eruption of the Nyiragongo Volcano, which would have completely destroyed the city of Goma in 2002, she her business with her own funds gotten through the sale of various household items, notably plates, saucepans, forks, etc. Later, she benefited from a loan from Hekima in 2006, to strengthen her shop. She displays her merchandise in the sectoral market of Alanine. This new loan will serve to restock certain merchandise, notably the blue uniform pants for students at the beginning of the school year here in the beginning of September 2010. She wishes to build a more spacious house and to comfortably fund her children's schooling. She also aspires to have a boutique room for her merchandise. The client ManZ. B. thanks Hekima for its actions to aid poor citizens excluded from classical banks. It may be noted that the group Baraka Alanine is made up of 21 members, mostly women and one man, Mr. Jules L., who was not present at the time the group photo was taken. This man is the president of the sectoral market of Alanine.

Translated from French by Martha Schmitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Blue uniform pants
